Penny smiled. "Well, I'm having a sleepover tomorrow night with all my friends." Kindly, she said. "I have a swimming pool in my back yard; why don't you join in and get to know the other girls in the area?" Seeing you wince, she added, "At least with us, you can be yourself."

You knew that if you refused, it would raise red flags in Penny's mind and she would press further, or worse, get another adult involved. Reluctantly, you forced a smile. "If my aunt says its okay, I'll come."

Penny giggled before giving you a hug. "It's going to be so much fun!" Happily, she said. "I'll see you at the sleepover tomorrow night."

With that, she hurried away. After she was gone, you pouted. "I can just hear mom and Hayley teasing me about this right now." Ruefully, you muttered.

1212211113131132213312211232231121321112.content:
When Hannah started practicing, you fully intended to leave the room, but then...you didn't. You had never watched Hannah dance before, not really. Certainly, there had been recitals and this wasn't the first time she had practiced at home, but usually you couldn't have been bothered to actually watch her and really see the dance. Today, you finally did and came to realize two things: One, ballet was kind of beautiful, and two, Hannah was pretty good at it, at least for someone her age. Her steps were graceful and timed perfectly to the music and once you started watching, you found it hard to stop.

After a moment, you took a seat on a nearby comfy chair and continued watching her. It was relaxing, both the dance and the music, and all the stress of being a teenage boy stuck as a young girl seemed to vanish for a moment. A small part of you thought about joining her. The two of you dancing on stage before an audience. The thought wasn't unenjoyable, but still, you weren't going to be giving in to any girly feelings. Just watching the dance was enough for now.

A few minutes into the routine, Hannah started giggling and had to stop dancing. "What are you doing?"

You blushed. "What do you mean?"

Hannah gestured toward you. "You're watching me. I thought ballet stuff bored you."

"It does...I just...I don't know...you dance real good, okay?" Flustered, you don't even realize you made a grammar error you hadn't made since the first time you were seven.

Hannah smiled. "Thanks. This is why I'm practicing at home, so I can get even better. I'm glad you are here too. It's like I'm up on stage."

You nodded, then hesitantly asked a question you were a little scared of sharing. "How...how does it feel when you dance?"

Hannah thought for a second, then answered. "Relaxing. Everything scary or making me sad kind of goes away and I just feel happy and strong."

Happy and strong. That sure sounded nice and before you knew it you said it exactly as much out loud. "That sure sound nice." You blushed again as soon as the words left your mouth, but they made Hannah grin.

"It is." Suddenly an idea seemed to occur to her. "Hey, Joanie, would you be my audience whenever I practice at home? Pleeeeeease." She looked at you hopefully.

You thought for a second then nodded slowly. "I guess that would be okay." You definitely wanted to watch her dance more, and just watching didn't seem too dangerous. It's not like you were actually doing anything girly. Just supporting your sister. It wouldn't turn you into a total, princess-loving, girly girl like her. Still, there was a small part of you that felt...disappointed. This part of you kind of wanted to try this relaxing ballet thing that apparently made Hannah feel happy and not scared. You'd love to not feel scared. It was ironic since fear was probably the thing that was keeping you from asking to try dancing with Hannah as well. Fear of becoming girly like Hannah, and liking it.

Hannah tilted her head curiously. She could tell you were deep in thought, but had no idea about what. Nervously, you shifted in your seat. "What?" You asked embarrassed.

"If you want to practice with me...that's okay too..." She said these words quietly, unsure that was what you thinking and not wanting to scare you off. She really did enjoy spending this time with you and didn't want to push you too hard. She didn't want to lose you as her audience at the very least.

You paused unsure. Inside, your curiosity and your fear were dueling for supremacy. It was an uncomfortable feeling and made you want to both overcome your fear and join your sister and give in to your fear and stay in the audience, which were contradictory ideas and made no sense. It was confusing for you and it took you some time to figure your out what your answer would be. Hannah waited patiently, smiling kindly at you. Finally, you quietly responded.

The second you stepped into the library, you sensed something and turned to find the teenage girl you spotted in the stands while watching the video of Paul's football practice. She smiled kindly then beckoned you with her finger. You were irritated as it was but you walked over to her then cracked the knuckles in your right hand as you made a fist. "Fair warning, I'm in a foul mood." Through gritted teeth, you whispered. "Please make this brief."

"Libraries are within the short list of neutral zones, dear nephew." Calmly, the girl said. "Not even Cassie Bane is stupid enough to use magic here. Any violation would ban her from all libraries, everywhere; you are safe from magic here."

You turned to Harry to find that he was sitting at another table, studying as if he were there for hours and you had walked in alone. Sighing, you turned back to the girl, now knowing her true identity. "Aunt Samantha, I assume." Sitting down, you said. "Do all witches enjoy revisiting their teen years? Should I expect to see a younger version of mom soon?"

Samantha giggled. "She already has, on many occasions." Bemused, she replied. "Only she did so before you were aware of magic so you would never have sensed her near." She sighed. "As for your question, we don't mind seeing our younger self in the mirror from time to time."

"What do you want with me?" Annoyed, you demanded. "Also, I'm not going to your house if I do not know price I would pay in doing so."

"Very wise." Nodding, Samantha said. "I'm considered the black sheep of the family for many reasons, which I will not get into, but I see no sense in you being kept out of the loop." She tapped a specific book on the shelf behind her. "Knowledge is power, my dear nephew; I suggest you power up and drive on."

With that said, she stood up and walked out of the library without another word. Curious, you pulled the book from the shelf and gasped at the title. The Witch Boy Code of Honor. You gulped and turned to the door but Samantha was gone.

"If the library is a neutral zone, would I get in trouble for reading a book of magic here?" Worried, you thought. "Or does a neutral zone mean that no magic can be used in these areas?"

You new nothing of the laws or traditions of magic, having had no training. You were highly annoyed at your family for not telling you much of anything thus far. Still, you had the mysterious book in your hands and had to make a choice. You had to either honor mom's wish and put the book back or open it and read what it had to say.

You smiled more and the two of you began to study for the paper that was due. Watching from the hall, however, Hayley was not as pleased. "I doubt mom would go for that." Wincing, she muttered. "I guess it won't hurt them to ask though."

Later, during lunch, Samantha entered the cafeteria was a teenage student with another young teenage girl. Hayley saw them and frowned. "It's never good when Samantha comes to our school." She then turned and moaned. "Double trouble. Amara Rune has come to our school as well."

"Who is this Amara Rune/" Curious Mel asked.

"A rival from witch school." Whispering, Hayley replied. "I bested her for top student, she took it so badly it almost got her expelled on her last day of school."

Hayley watched Samantha slip Amara Rune a small vial before she walked right for your table. "Not good!" running towards you, she thought.

Only Amara saw Hayley coming and poured the potion into a cup, smiling wickedly at her to which she could only gape in shock. "She poured the potion into the wrong cup." Stunned, she thought. "Or was that poor boy her real target?"

Hayley did not know the boy whose cup Amara poured the potion into but she had walked away, vanishing into the crowd as he drank his soda, potion and all. Hayley could only watch helplessly as Samantha stepped in front of her. "This had to be done, Hayley." Calmly, she said. "It's for John's own good that he learns the danger he is in from experience."

"There is just one problem with that." Frowning, Hayley said.

Hayley grinned. "Your pawn poured the potion into the wrong cup."

Samantha paled and whipped around to find her face to face with the boy who had drank the potion. he looked at Samantha stunned before a dreamy smile formed upon his face. "Hi..." Sighing, he said. "I'm Josh Waters."

Hayley giggled. "I think he has a crush on you, Sammy." Teasing, she said. She then whispered, "Serves you right for meddling in my family's affairs."

With that, she walked away, leaving Samantha to deal with the magically hormonal teenage boy.

1221311213311223231211122122311211211111.content:
Your first reaction was to scream as the world around you quickly shrank. Your skirt and blouse remained the same but shrank with you. In less than a minute, you had been regressed into a six year old girl. Mom smiled at your annoyed look as she cast a second spell. "What ever is the matter, Jodie?" Sweetly, she asked. "There is nothing wrong with needing to learn how to dance."

You wanted to scream at mom for turning you into a six year old only the thought quickly left you and was replaced with only mom's comment about you needing to learn how to dance. It was very strange and unnerving to you. A look of confusion formed onto your face and you blurted out the only thing that came to mind. "Hannah will want to make us all girlie!"

Mom chuckled. "She's just trying to show you two how pretty you can be." Patiently, she said. "Just give ballet a try. If you don't like it after say a week, I'll pull you out." She smiled. "That's fair, don't you think?"

You paused; something did not seem right but you could not figure out what. You knew you were upset about mom for some reason but you could not fathom what that reason was. Finally, you shrugged and gave a frustrated sigh. "I guess that's fair." Softly, you said.

Mom giggled. "Wonderful!" Smiling, she said. "Get your shoes on and I'll take you with me and we can swing by the mall for some icecream."

"What about getting pants or skorts." Pouting, Holly asked.

"We'll talk." Patiently mom said.

You and Holly walked off to get your shoes while mom turned to find Hayley watching her. "Why did you do that to her?" Softly, Hayley demanded. "You know she will remember all of this when you eventually cancel the spell."

Mom sighed. "Jodie will be easier to deal with while she is under the unaware spell." Serious, she explained. "Also, as a six year old, it will be harder for her to gain access to the powerful magic within her." She frowned. "In retrospect, I wish I would have done this from the beginning."

"It's a risky solution, mom." Frowning, Hayley said. "If Jodie's magic breaks through while she is in that form, she will be forced to grow up from that age."

"The same goes for Holly." Serious, mom countered. "It is a risk, I know." Her face softened as she glanced at you, now smiling with Holly as you both spoke of your favorite flavors of icecream. "Only, I no longer can bear to see Jodie getting slowly destroyed by this political tug of war."

"What's your plan, then?" Her face softening, Hayley asked.

Mom sighed. "Right now, I'm planning this as I go." Honestly, she said. "Right now, keeping both Jodie and Holly happy and unaware is the least damaging solution. It will keep both Samantha and Cassie away from them, at least for a while."

Hayley nodded, a smile forming onto her face. "I can imagine both of their faces when they realize what you did."

Mom nodded. "So can I but I'm more concerned about what they may try to get around it."

Later, mom drove everyone to pick up Hannah from ballet. There, she quickly signed you and Holly up for a few classes. Once done, mom drove to the mall where she escorted you all into the icecream shop. You were looking forward to some icecream, forgetting your earlier annoyance with mom. Only upon seeing who was working there, you felt a something between fear and anger. You took a hold of the skirt of mom's dress, catching her attention. She saw the look on your face and looked at the worker. Seeing who it was, she frowned. It was...

1221311213311223231211122122311211211111.content:
Mom called Elvira, her mother and the head witch. "I need your help mom." Serious, she said. "Cassie Bane is becoming problematic and you know as well as I the risks she is taking by constantly irritating my child."

Mom purposely ignored protocol to get Elvira's attention and it worked. "I will speak to the child's mother, Natalie." Patiently, she said. "However, you know as well as I that I cannot interfere, that is the job of the rogue hunters; even then, a law has to have been broken."

"I understand, Elvira." Sighing, mom said.

"I do not blame you for wanting to protect your child, Natalie." Calmly, Elvira said. "However, there is a certain order in which we all must do things." She sighed. "I will talk to the child's parent as Jodie's grandmother but I cannot use my influence as head witch in this matter."

With that, Elvira ended the call, leaving mom slightly frustrated. Less than a minute later, Elvira appeared on the front step of Maria Bane's front door with her four body guards and knocked. When Maria answered, she turned pale upon seeing Elvira. "I have done nothing wrong..." Softly, she protested. "What brings you to my doorstep?"

"Easy, Ms Bane." Kindly, Elvira said. "This is a social call, not an official visit."

Maria released a breath and allowed Elvira to enter. Two guards followed her while two stood at the front door. Maria prepared some tea, which Elvira's guards inspected before allowing her to have and they sat down to talk. "Your daughter, Cassie has become fond of my grandson, John who is as the moment, my granddaughter, Jodie." Calmly, Elvira began. "However, Jodie is going through a very difficult transition at this time. In the end, this transition will give him, or her, great power and responsibility." She took a sip of her tea. "Your daughter's advances are making the transition more frustrating for her which is making things frustrating for all those involved."

"So what do you want me to do?" Courtly, Maria asked. "Do you want me to tell Cassie not to pursue her love for your grandchild?"

Elvira shook her head. "I am asking you to tell your daughter to be patient." Remaining calm, she replied. "My grandchild will not be dealing with this transition, aware or unaware, as a teenager or a child forever. He or she will come out of it in a few months time." She sipped her tea then added, "After that, your daughter will be free to pursue her love for John or Jodie to her heart's content until he or she gets bonded."

With that, Elvira rose from her seat and thanked Maria for her time before leaving. Maria sighed, slightly shaken by the visit then turned to Cassie who was watching from the stairwell landing. "Did Elvira forbid me to go near Jodie?" Tearfully, she demanded.

"No, no, sweet child." Kindly, Maria replied. "She only asked me to tell you to be patient." She smiled, motioning Cassie to come to her before urging her to sit. "You, Jodie, and her friend, Holly are all the victims in this case."

"We are victims?" Worried, Cassie asked.

Maria nodded. "You see, Jodie is Natalie's little treasure; she will bring her family greater power and wealth if she remains a girl." Patiently, she explained. "If he stays a boy, he becomes frighteningly strong which will also bring the family power but in a less subtle way."

Cassie hung onto every word her mother was saying as she explained things to her as one would read a bedtime story to a small child. "What am I to do?" Wincing, she asked. "Why is Holly a victim? Why am I a victim?"

"Natalie has grown fond of the child, Holly." Calmly, Maria said. "One cannot blame her for this as she practically raised her, as a boy, for so long while her mother and new husband were away doing who knows what." She sighed. "She wishes to take the child from her clearly unfit mother but she will fight it. This fight will tear the poor child's heart apart."

"Poor Holly..." Whispering, Cassie said. She knotted her jaw in decision. "Then its a good thing I decided to make her the most girlie girl she can be."

Maria smiled. "That's my daughter." Showing pride, she said. "As to why you are a victim, Jodie's mother does not want to share her family's power with just anyone. She sees us as... below her, unworthy of her family name." She sighed. "Elvira, the head witch sees that and only asks of us to be patient. She wisely refuses to take a stand on this."

"What can I do?" Wincing, Cassie repeated.

"You must be Jodie's lady night in shinning armor, Cassie." Serious, Maria said. "Save her from her mother's selfishness; show her how beautiful and wonderful she can be." She giggled as she cast a spell. "I will help by making it possible to be near her at all times, regardless of the form her mother forces upon her."

Within seconds, Cassie had become a six year old girl. "Mommy!" Startled, she shrieked.

"It is just until Jodie comes out of her transition." Patiently, Maria said. "You want to be near her, do you not?"

"Well, yes." Frowning, Cassie replied. "But do I have to have Michelle with me?"

Maria giggled. "We all must make sacrifices for love, dear child."

Cassie sighed before nodding. "I'll get myself ready for school tomorrow."

Once she had walked back up the stairs, Maria cackled to herself. "That's right, my dear puppet, you get yourself ready." Whispering, she said. "One way or another, I or one of my daughters will be marrying into that family."
1221311213311223231211122122311211211111.title: Puppet.

Michelle defiantly sighed as she stared at her reflection. "Two months and I still can't get used to this. Or this voice. Michelle hated being Cassie's toy, and worse, their mom didn't seem to care. "That's it! You really should talk like the little girl you are!" thundered Cassie, but to her horror, she couldn't cast a spell. "Why isn't it working?"

"You're too young" Michelle said gleefully. "Maybe its time for me to teach you how to be a good little girl."

"You're finally accepted that you're my little sister" Cassie said, trying to hide her anger.

Michelle was taken back by her mom's words but slowly nodded and walked into her room with Maria following. She closed the door and waved her hand, causing Michelle to jump. "It's just a privacy spell, dear." Kindly, she said. "You've become rather jumpy."

With that, she walked out of the room to confront Cassie who was desperately trying to hear what her mom was telling Michelle. Upon seeing her now a seven year old, she screamed at the top of her lungs. "Why did you make her older than me?!" Hysterical, she demanded. "You told me that you wouldn't interfere!"

Mom waved her hand, closing Michelle's door before laughing. "Your tactics were not moving your sister to learn magic fast enough." In a light tone, she replied. "But... she's older than me now." Tearfully, Cassie whined. "It's not fair."

"Keep your eyes on the prize, child." Serious, Maria said. "Focus on getting your new girlfriend and let me deal with our reluctant princess."

Cassie sighed then sulked to her room. Once the door was closed Maria turned to the sound of a giggle and saw her other daughter, Martha Bane who smiled deviously. Martha was Hayley's height and age; a graduate of Witchbloom witch school. She sported long black hair and emerald green eyes. "Are your two puppets tangling their strings again?" Maria Smiled wickedly. "Michelle has a lot of potential." Grinning, she said. "If Cassie fails, she may just win John's heart with the right motivation."

Martha and Maria shared a laugh as Michelle pondered over her mother's words, staring at the leather bound book...

"It's about John!"

Kristy sighed, rolling her eyes then grabbed Cassidy's hand. "There are a lot of John's in this school, twerp." Dragging her away, she said. "If you want to talk to me, keep up; I'm busy."

As you rode your bike towards aunt Catherine's house, you stopped at the park which was about halfway to take a break. You did not have the endurance you once did as a teenage boy, which frustrated you to no end. You looked out at the park and caught part of a conversation between two girls who seemed to have been having an argument. One was fairly muscular but normal; the other had magic, you could feel it.

"There's nothing wrong with a girl building up her strength and endurance." Confident, the first girl said to the other, weaker girl. "We have to be strong to compete with the boys."

The second girl winced. "Mom told me that building my strength too much would change my life in ways I would not want." Softly, she said. "i'm not sure what she meant by that but I know she was serious when she told me that."

The first girl laughed. "She's just being protective." Lightly, she said. "Boy go nuts over tomboys because they don't have to teat them like glass." She smiled. "Trust me, nothing bad will come of you working out; think about it, okay?"

"I'm not so sure." Sighing, the second girl said. "I'll think about it."

As you continued on your journey to aunt Catherine's house, a broad smile began to form onto your face. "The answer was right in front of me the entire time." Curing the irony of it all, you thought. "I'm such an idiot! Magically blessed girls and physically blessed boys! All I have to do is build my strength above my magic!"

"Now you're talking, sport!" A new voice sounded in your head. "Let's get cracking!"

At first, the voice startled you but then you realized it was your original voice, cheering you on.

"Bad idea, Jodie!" Sternly, the girl voice sounded. "You're going to spark a weregirl effect!"

"I missed hearing my old voice." Smiling, you whispered. "I can't wait to get started.I hope Tim still has his weights."

Upon reaching your destination, aunt Catherine greeted you at the door where...

You was stunned, unable to believe the voice was able to make you say all that.

'How did you do that!?! I'm not going to let you take over and turn me into a pwetty widdle girl. Hey! Stop that!'

'Jodie, we're a girl' the voice responded, almost exasperated.

Your mental debate was interrupted by Catherine. "I'm taking what's left of your male side didn't mean to expose your plan, and you're furiously having an internal debate. Trust me, weregirl is a bad idea, and you can ask Timothy that. Just let in go, niece."

You shivered slightly upon hearing Hayley, and now Catherine giving you similar advice. Basically allow yourself to become this Jodie, and one that makes Hannah seem to be an outright tomboy. 'Thats' what Hayley said, but I don't wanna be a pwetty girl. You've got to do something!"

"There is nothing I can do. You passed the point of no return weeks ago, and reality has since then, slowly shifted to reflect that. To nearly everyone, you're always been Jodie, and you have always been a typical girly girl."

"But..." you protested.

"I'm sorry niece. I know its hard for young ladies such as yourself to hear that, but I know you want the truth. Want me to give you a makeover? it'll make you feel better" Catherine offered.

"Yah! Makeover! What am I saying!?! I need to speak to Tim!" you said, freaked out.

'Tim is upstairs" Catherine said, allowing you to pass, but you was stunned when you got there. Not only Tim was a girl, but he, or rather, she was in a pink, girly girls' room.

"What happened to you, Tim?!" Startled, you demanded. "I just talked to you a few minutes ago!"

"I'm Tina in this form and it comes with the territory, cousin." Ruefully, Tina said. "Mom finally explained it all to me as this is the last phase of my own transformation." She sighed. "I'm a siren witch; something you don't want, trust me."

"Are none of us going to come out of this boys?" Quivering, you asked.

"You can still be a boy later on." Frowning, Tina said. "Only it's a lot of work and only a few who go through it find it worth the trouble. Our grandfather and uncle Jack are among those few."

"I can't just do nothing." Pleading, you argued.

"What you are planning is a bad idea for three reasons." Serious, Tina said. She counted on her fingers, "One; trying to switch back now, regardless of the method will place a lot of stress on the body and mind. You are at your limit as it is. Two; the magic within you has already shattered the forces keeping you male. Rebuilding that will take years not weeks. Three; aging yourself will not make you stronger just more confused and miserable due to dealing with hormones, love sick boys and other teenage girl issues I don't care to think about."

You teared up, wanting to cry then pointed at Tina accusingly. "Why should I listen to you!?" Angrily, you demanded. "You were a lot younger than me before all of this!"

Tina shrugged. "Being a siren witch allows for a higher intelligence." Calmly, she countered. "I couldn't allow anyone to find out; no one wants that kind of attention."

You slumped into a chair, defeated. "So that's it?" Depressed, you asked. "I'm supposed to just give up and let this girl voice take me over?"

"The girl voice is you from a girl's perspective." Surprising you, Tina said. "It's sort of like talking to yourself but a lot weirder." She giggled. "You are in your final phase of the transformation which is why I assume you heard a boy voice in your head."

You shot your head up looking at Tina. "How did you..."

"I head my own boy voice just yesterday." Sighing, Tina replied. "It felt weird but refreshing." She paused before snapping her fingers. "Let me show you something."

You watched with morbid interest as Tina went into her closet and came back with a digital recorder in hand. "Remember when I, as Tim, recorded your voice then turned up the octaves a few notches?"

You pouted. "Yeah, I remember. You made me sound like..."

Tina grinned. "I made you sound like a girl." Interrupting, she said. She pressed play adding, "Does it sound familiar?"

You listened to the recording of your voice with the octaves raised and gasped as it sounded exactly like the girl voice in your head! "I've been hearing my own voice?!"

"Hearing and arguing with yourself." Smiling, Tina said. "Both you and I believed that it was an invading force when it was actually our magic becoming active rather than dormant."

"So what am I to do?" Worried, you asked.

Tina sighed, placing down the recorder. "You can't even start working your way back to boyhood until after you are completely a girl." Serious, she explained. "Just do it quietly. From what I understand, both our grandfather and uncle Jack went through hell reclaiming their man card."

You shivered at that before Catherine entered the room. "Thank you for visiting, Jodie." politely, she said. "Only its time for you go back home."

With a wave of her hand, you found yourself back inside your bed room where Hayley was patiently waiting for you. "You definitely have dad's stubbornness, sis." Bemused, she said. "I have an offer for you and I suggest you take it."

"What offer?" Sensing a trap, you asked.

Hayley smiled. "I can do one of three things for you right now."

1221311213311223231211122122311211211111.title: Michelle ages back to normal, but still a girl

choices: You and Holly are registered in.
Hannah goes to witch school too.
1221311213311223231211122122311211211111.content:
The judge smiled kindly. "Jodie Harrison, Christina Smith.." She paused, adjusting her reading glasses. "Oh! Holly Harrison as well."

"Are Jodie and Holly the youngest Harrison girls you spoke of?" Curious, Michelle asked.

The youngest judge nodded. "They are; you along with these three girls have shown much promise with their magical powers." Kindly, she said. She gave a slight giggle. "Though Jodie is a bit of a tomboy, she is slowly coming out of her shell."

"They will all have the same option you have upon graduation." Firmly but kindly, the eldest judge said. "The Harrison girls will remain, for the most part, unaware due to their stubborn nature but that is to protect their chances of having a choice at the end of the year."

"We ask that you do not reveal the fact they are transformed boys like yourself." Serious, another judge said. "The Harrison family is among the most powerful magical families in existence."

"Having two powerhouse boys in the family will rattle many witches just as much as a large family of such powerful witches." The eldest witch added. "That, and you will have issues of your own going into witch school."

"What do you mean?" Gulping, Michelle asked.

The witch judges giggled. "Easy, child; we are referring to getting used to being a teenage girl." Bemused, the third judge replied. "It is a bit different from being a little girl."

"If there are no further questions, this court is adjured."

There was a flash and Michelle found herself standing at the front gates of a strange school with two packed bags of luggage. Behind her, Michelle's mother stood a hundred yards away, looking trapped between pride and worry. Standing next to her was Ms Harrison with two little girls, you and Holly, both looking nervous. With them was another little girl with her mother, both with a rather sad smile on their faces. Michelle assumed she was the one named Christina. She was short with red hair and green eyes. Her mother was a near mirror image of her, both dressed in similar style white dresses.

The gates opened and a tall, professionally dressed woman stepped out and smiled at Michelle then you, Holly, and Christina. "New students please follow me to administrations." Kindly, she said. "Those permitted to enter with them please follow behind."

With a sigh, you followed the young woman with mom holding yours and holly's hand. "Why are we going here again?" Wincing, you asked.

"You and holly have powerful magic for your age." Softly, mom said. "You both need to be trained in how to use it so you do not accidentally harm someone." She looked down at you with a smile. "Patience, Jodie. I went here as a girl, so did Hayley and Mel; you will both have fun here and the year will go by quick, I promise."

You sighed, seeing there was little choice and turned to Holly who seemed just as unsure.
1221311213311223231211122122311211211111.title: You and Holly go to witchbloom.

choices: She is worried about her daughter.
She wants Natalie to adopt Holly.
1221311213311223231211122122311211211111.content:
You turned to mom, worried as a second young woman lead Michelle and Christina down a different hall than you and Holly were being taken. "Aren't we all going to registration?" Wincing, you asked. "Where are they being taken?"

Mom smiled kindly. "Michelle and Christina are going through a difficult time and need special counseling." Calmly, she explained. "Both you and Holly are going through a tough transition and will need a different type of counseling, thus you are going to different rooms."

"What is a transition?" Confused, Holly asked.

"It is the moving from one part of life to another." Smiling, mom said. "Like a caterpillar becoming a butterfly or a duckling becoming a swan."

"Oh..." Still confused, Holly said.

"We're changing?" Guessing correctly, you asked. Mom nodded. "Into what?"

"That is why you are here." Still smiling, mom said. "As you learn magic, you will discover what you will become later in life."

"I... guess that makes sense." Lost, you said.

Mom giggled. "It will become more clear to you before the end of the year." She paused as a door was opened for her at the end of a long hall. "We are here."

Mom led you and Holly into the room while the professionally dressed woman entered behind you and closed the door. She urged you, mom and Holly to sit down in comfortable chairs before sitting down herself. "My name is Tam." Politely, she said. "I am one of the many transition councilors here at Witchbloom all girls boarding school. You and Holly have been asked to learn magic here because there is a legal issue regarding your gender of right."

"Our what?" Confused, you asked.

Mom cleared her throat. "They are under an unaware spell to keep them safe." Quietly, she explained. "The witch court ordered it kept active during their stay until they come to realization of their past selves."

Tam nodded then turned to you and Holly. "Quite simply, there is an argument as to whether you two should be girls or boys."

"Someone wants to turn us into boys?" Taken back, Holly asked.

You and Holly turned to each other, perplexed then both yelled out, "Ew!"

Mom smiled, bemused; knowing you and Holly were actually born boys known as John Harrison and Harry Rich. Tam smiled as well before stating, "You are both here, away from the outside world, to make the decision for yourselves once your training is complete."

"Someone tried to make Jodie a boy earlier." Pointing at you, Holly said.

"No, they were trying to do that to both of you." Firmly but kindly, mom countered. "We all want the choice to be yours and yours alone as it is your life."

"I will be your counselor during your year here." Kindly, Tam said. "The door to my office is always open; if you have an issue, just come see me."

"Well, I can see my girls are in good hands." Standing up, mom said. "I will see you two in a year, girls; behave yourselves, okay?"

"You're leaving?" Worried, you asked.

Mom smiled. "Don't worry, I will call you once a week to check up on you and, as I said, the year will go by quickly."

With that, mom left the room where she met with Mrs Emily Rich.
1221311213311223231211122122311211211111.title: Counseling and registration.

1221311213311223231211122122311211211111.content:
"Why do you wish me to adopt Holly?" Worried, mom demanded. "She will have the option to become Harry again in one year time. Jodie will have to power to become John again as well." She sighed before adding, "That is if she feels it is worth the difficult transition."

"The head witch has five body guards." Smiling slightly, Emily explained. "One of them is due to retire and Elvira Strange wants me to fill the position." Her smile faltered. "There is only one catch; I cannot have any children."

Mom frowned at this. "Do you truly believe this job is worth giving up your child?" Serious, she asked. "Once it is done, you know it cannot be undone without serious preoccupations."

"Holly or 'Harry' will be safer with you, Natalie." Equally serious, Emily replied. "I was close to losing her due to never being around because of the work my husband and I do." She sighed. "Also, I know she will be in a good, long home with you."

Mom sighed. "Very well." Softly, she said. "I will sign the necessary papers... in one year. You have until then to decide if this is really what you want."

Emily rewarded mom with a warm hug. "I better get back to adult classes." Smiling, she said. "Thank you, Natalie."

Mom nodded and watched Emily leave before heading for home.
1221311213311223231211122122311211211111.title: An honor with a price.

1221311213311223231211122122311211211111.content:
As mom walked out of Witchbloom, she paused and saw that there was a light on in Elvira's office. Thinking, she decided to have a talk. Something didn't seem right.

"Yes, Natalie" Elvira said as mom was about to knock on her door. Mom pushed open the door, and saw her mom waiting for her. Elvira had a bottle in her hand, which she was about to put away.

"I take that isn't a drink" mom said dryly, pointing to the bottle.

"A lot safer than most. I'm glad you can recognize memory potion, and not mistake it for wine" Elvira said.

"Memory potion? Did you give any of it to Emily Rich?" mom demanded.

"Indeed. I take it you had a talk with her?"

"Why?" mom asked.

"Without it, she would believe Holly is truly your child, Natalie. In fact, there are very few that would believe otherwise without any assistance. unfortunately, that number is decreasing."

"Is this the reason for Holly and Jodie's sudden summoning here? Or does it also include the whole sorry saga of 'Michelle' Bane?" mom asked. "Despite what people are saying I don't like the chances of them transforming back."

"There is some sort of link between Michelle and Jodie, though Cassandra Bane has declined to tell me what it is. They're getting fitted with their new uniforms right now, and I've seen that neither girl is overly happy 'looking like some anime character' as Michelle politely put it. Holly loved it though. I'm hoping they can shed some light onto the situation.
1221311213311223231211122122311211211111.title: continue.

1221311213311223231211122122311211211111.content:
Inside your new class at Witchbloom all girls boarding school, you turned to Michelle who was lightly tugging onto her skirt. "Pulling on it won't make it longer." Bemused, you said. "I tried it already but I can't get my magic to do it either."

Michelle sighed. "Wearing a skirt and blouse for school is one thing but why all of the different colors and styles of sailor fuku uniforms?" Frowning, she demanded. "I feel like I'm trapped in some weird Anime cartoon."

You nodded, knowing how Michelle felt. The uniforms you, Holly, and Michelle were given had a dark blue skirt with pink trim and a white blouse with pink bands on the collar and sleeves. They were matched with a dark blue jacket with dark pink bands like the blouses and white socks with black ballet flats. Other students were wearing the same style of uniform bot of different color schemes, it didn't make much sense.

"Your guess is as good as mine." Shrugging, you said.

"They mark magical status." Surprising you, Holly said. "I asked Tam when I was being fitted for mine; the three of us are of some kind of magical importance."

"I wonder what..." Confused, Michelle said.

Holly shrugged. "Tam told me you have some huge inheritance coming your way." Softly, she replied. "You'd think your family would treat you better knowing you are the heir to a fortune."

"Or maybe they mistreated you, angry they aren't getting any of it." Worried, you added. "Either way, it answers a few questions as to why they did what they did."

"It also raises more questions." Sighing, Michelle said. She smiled slightly. "Thank you for sticking with me, Jodie. I'll never forget the day you vowed to be there for me as you are with your other sisters."

You blushed slightly. "That's what friends are for; to be there for each other."

"I wonder what importance you two have." Curious, Michelle pondered.

"Our grandmother is the head witch." Blushing more, you replied. "With that comes a certain 'royal responsibility'." You rolled your eyes, moving your fingers up and down to indicate sarcasm before adding, "She can keep it; I'd rather stick with ballet and gymnastics."

Holly giggled."Still a tomboy, sis." Bemused, she said. "I think being a princess would be a great and wonderful adventure."

"Oh sure." Sarcastically you said. "Going only where you are told to go, do only what you are told to do... sounds real exciting, sis."

"Only until I become queen." Grinning, Holly countered. "Then I will make the rules."

She childishly stuck her tongue out at you, making you giggle. "We'll see who gets the crown."

Inside Elvira's office, mom shook her head, looking into her mother's crystal ball. "So that's the reason; John made a friendship pact with Micheal just as he did with Harry."

"As such, they are now all three linked." Serious, Elvira said. "This also explains how Holly and Jodie almost instantly became twin sisters; their bond had more time to develop than with John and Micheal." She sighed. "Still, where Michelle goes, Jodie will willingly follow because of the friendship pact they share."

"It also explains the rivalry between Cassie and Melanie." Frowning, mom said. "Such a pact can make Jodie's sisters protective of little Michelle as if she were their own sister."

Elvira nodded. "Hannah kept Michelle away from Cassy when she could and Hayley often reminded Cassie of witch law; Melanie doing this recently." Softly, she said. She shook her head with a sigh. "I do not see much hope in Jodie or Holly transforming back into their male states either, Natalie but look at them."

Mom looked into the crystal ball at yours and holly's smiles. "They seem happy..." Evenly, she said. "Only they are still under the effects of the unaware spell."

"True; but that spell is slowly weakening." Calmly, Elvira said. "The two are coming to terms with who and what they are." She gave mom a reassuring smile. "Allow fate to take it from here; we have done all we can and now we simply must wait and see."

Mom nodded, though sadly. She loved her daughter, Jodie and her twin sister Holly with all her heart but she still remembered the two rough and tumble boys who were always there for each other and her daughters, no matter what.
1221311213311223231211122122311211211111.title: you and Michelle talk

choices: The boy voice continues to taunt you.
1221311213311223231211122122311211211111.content:
Back at home, you and Holly were dressed to go to ballet. Mom sighed seeing you smiling, acting like any other normal little girl. She was pleased to hear that Michelle had been removed from her family to learn magic at Witchbloom and that her family had been placed on notice for their actions against her as well as you, Holly, and Melanie.

As for Holly, she was all smiles, happy to have her twin sister back to normal as she saw it. "Only two days left to the recital, Jodie." Smiling, she chirped. "Are you ready for your solo performance?"

"I guess." Shrugging, you said. "I feel kind of guilty losing my cool in all."

You jumped as a strange low voice echoed in your head. "Hey, you taught that snobby witch a lesson, sport." Scolding, the voice said. "Don't go soft on her now."

"Who said that?" Looking around, you demanded.

"Who said what?" Confused, Holly asked. She winced, looking at you. "Don't tell me you are hearing voices again...

You teared up, nodding. "I'm hearing a low voice, telling me not to go soft on Cassidy; that I taught her a lesson." Softly, you replied. "I- I think I'm going crazy, sis..."

Holly gave you a brief warm hug. "Maybe it was that spell that was trying to turn you into a boy." Startling you, she said. She then turned to mom. "What do you think, mommy?"

Mom gave you a reassuring smile. "You are not going crazy, honey." Cooing you, she said. "It's just the stress and the guilt of losing your cool getting to you." She gave you a light kiss on the forehead. "Just focus on the recital for now; we will worry about strange voices later."

You nodded, managing a weak smile as mom thought, "The journey back is starting sooner than expected; this is troubling. Poor Jodie is under enough stress as it is."

Deciding to form a plan while you and Holly were distracted with ballet, she drove you, Holly, and Hannah to the dance studio where you met Cassidy and her mother, Darla Bane. "Good morning, Ms Harrison." Evenly, Darla said. "I apologize for my daughter's ill behavior towards your own daughters; I can assure you that she will be raised properly... this time around."

"I accept your apology, Ms Bane." Courtly, mom said. "Every child has their issues, we can only hope we raise them to make the right decisions."

You winced at that, remembering your loss of temperament the other day. "Sorry I lost my temper the other day." Meekly, you said to Cassidy.

"We- We both lost our cool." Looking away, Cassidy muttered.

"Close enough." Shrugging, Darla said.

Mom nodded. "Close enough."

"Sell out." Scolding, the boy voice said. "You need to stick to your guns, sport."

"Don't you have a tree to climb... and fall out of?" Frustrated, you thought back.

"That's not very ladylike, Jodie." Taunting, the boy voice said. "There's hope for you yet."

You sighed and did your best to ignore the boy voice as mom ushered you, Holly, and Hannah into the ballet school for practice. You had a feeling that with this new voice, it was going to be a long day. "I need to talk to Hayley." Worried, you thought.
1221311213311223231211122122311211211111.title: The journey back begins early.

1221311213311223231211122122311211211111.content:
Although you would have been happy to leave with Megan, just to get away from Cassie, you still furious that she had violated you; changed your clothes without your permission. You broke free from Megan's grasp and lunged at Cassie with an angered scream. Cassie, showing fear for the first time, took a step back as if to run but was not fast enough. You tackled her to the ground and began to viciously pound on her face as you would a bully who went too far as John. Cassie screamed and cried with each blow until a strong hand pulled you away; it was Ms Thorn, the principal of the school. "That's enough!" Sternly, she said. "I want both of you in my office, now!"

You turned to Megan to see her walk away as if nothing had happened then walked towards the principal's office with Ms Thorn urging you and Cassie to stay quiet. Once you entered, Ms thorn slammed the door and ordered you and Cassie to sit. "I am well aware of magic, ladies." Angry, she said. "Also, before you ask, yes; I am a witch as well as the head of the D.D.M.C. Department of Dark Magic Control." Cassie gulped, which Thorn noticed. "Using magic on school grounds is forbidden, Miss Bane." Sternly, she said. "Do it again and I will ban you from this school as you were from your last school. Do I make myself clear?!"

"Yes, ma'am." Through gritted teeth, Cassie said.

"Your attitude is unacceptable, young lady!" Unimpressed, Ms Thorn snapped. "Shape up or ship out, I do not tolerate witch bullies in my school!" She then turned to you, equally unimpressed. "I took care of that incident just as I will take care of this one." Ice in her voice, Thorn said. "It is obvious that Cassie has feelings for you, Jodie. Therefore, I am ordering you both to the same classes during school hours."

"You two will work as a team." Ignoring you, Thorn continued. "Any spell used against you from anyone will effect Cassie as well." She gave Cassie a satisfied grin. "The more feminine Jodie gets, the more masculine you will become so I suggest you keep her magically safe."

Cassie forced a smile though she looked like she wanted to scream. Ms Thorn then turned to you. "Any physical harm that comes to Cassie will effect you, Jodie." With the same grin, she said. "The more punishment she gets, the more feminine you will become so I suggest you keep her close and out of harms way."

With that, the door to the principal's office opened and you were both dismissed. After returning home, you told mom what had happened...
1221311213311223231211122122311211211111.title: A forced partnership.

You ran before Mel could cast her spell, nearly ripping the door into the house off its hinges in your haste to get away. The spell, as Hayley saw, harmlessly hit the door and dispersed. "Now you've done it, airhead!" Angry, Hayley yelled. "You threw John into a panic!"

"It was just a simple gender spell." Defending herself, Mel said. "Even without training, girl-John could have beaten it in a few days to a week."

It took us both to keep John from tearing the man apart." She sighed. "That was years before he began to show signs of his physical might taking root."

Mel shuddered. "Do you think he's mad at me? At us?" Uncertain, she asked.

"I think he's frightened and confused." Honestly, Hayley replied. "Your little stunt didn't help." She shook her head, thinking. "Get in the house, Mel; I have to go find him again."

Reluctantly, Mel went back into the house only to scream a moment later. Hayley ran into the house to find that you had left a path of slight destruction while running to your room. Mom was standing among the over turned tables, broken lamps, and fist sized holes in the walls. There was a look of frustration on her face. As she spotted Mel, she let out a heavy sigh. "Let me guess, Mel decided to have some fun."

Hayley nodded. "What happened?"

Mom motioned to the room. "What do you think?" Annoyed, she countered. "John went on a rampage, destroying everything in his path to his room. Fortunately, his anger does not seem to be focused on any of us but on the fact he can't get a straight answer."

122131121331131.title: scoled Melanie.

You dialed a number you were told only to use in emergencies. With what was happening with your family, you figured this was as great as any other emergency. After two rings, a deep voice answered. "Jack Strange speaking."

"Uncle Jack, I need your help." Tearfully, you said. "My family is turning against me and they won't say why..." You then quickly explained the situation, not knowing how much time you had left before mom or your sisters tried to stop you. When you were done, uncle Jack chuckled.

"There is a balance in all witch households, John." Patiently, Jack explained. "You have your magically blessed girls and your physically blessed boys. Because you are a twin to a witch, it makes you twice as strong as normal."

"What does that have to do with..." Confused, you began to ask.

"Most witches prefer not to have witch boys become too powerful." Interrupting you, Jack said. "Your grandfather is the most powerful of them all meaning you could be just as strong as he when you grow up."

"So witches might want to make me a girl to prevent that?" Gulping, you asked.

"Exactly." Softly, Jack said. "Your mother wants the choice to be yours but that might not happen if too many witches discover your potential."

"What can I do, uncle Jack?" Fearful, you asked.

"You are strong and will get stronger." Serious, Jack replied. "Just don't show it off; keep a low profile and roll with the punches. If anyone asks, just say that you lost a bet or something."

That made you chuckle as you looked down at the girl's school uniform you were wearing. "It would fit the pranks we play on each other." Bemused, you said.

"Everything equals out in the end, John." Calmly, Jack said. "Stay strong and good luck."

With that, Jack ended the call. However, unknown to you, mom was listening in on another line. She sighed then...
1221311213311313.title: A call to uncle Jack.

Mom sighed then entered your room without knocking, startling you. "There are a few things your uncle left out you should know." Softly, she said.

"You could have knocked first." pouting, you protested. "Also, why were you listening in?"

"Your uncle and I don't exactly get along well but that's a story for another time." Ruefully, mom replied. "Witches feared your grandfather's strength so much that a rogue witch placed a powerful fear curse upon him. Any witch or witch boy without full training will be utterly terrified of him."

It's... frightening and a witch boy can all too easily lose control." She paused. "Remember the path of destruction you made going to your room earlier?"
