1221311213311313231.content:
"How soon can we take a tour of this Witchbloom school?" Sighing, you asked.

Mom beamed, pleased that you were willing to at least consider witch school. "We can leave just as soon as I get Hayley to take you." Smiling, she said. "She will be pleased to hear you are interested in witch school."

"I'm curious, mom." Serious, you said. "This school will really need to be over the top cool to peek my interest."

Mom giggled. 'Over the top cool' as you colorfully put it meant elements that matched your likes and interests as well as your goals. "I'll call Hayley in then."

Hayley, of course, was elated to hear you wanted to visit Witchbloom. Mom offered to order you your favorite meal of pizza upon your return. "Have fun, dear." Sweetly, mom said. "I wish to hear all about your visit when you get back."

Hayley muttered the spell needed to take you and herself to Witchbloom. "Brace yourself, bro." Bemused, she said.

Upon suddenly arriving at the front gates of the school, you stumbled slightly, feeling a little dizzy. "That was weird." Panting, you muttered. "Warn me next time..."

"Sorry about that, bro." Smiling, Hayley said. "Teleportation does take some getting used to. Still, we're here."

It took you a moment to be able to look around. You and your sister were at the gates of what looked like a normal private school campus. The entire property was guarded by a tall stone wall with heavy iron gates. You and Hayley were standing at the North gate, judging from the sign on a stone arch above it. A short thin woman in a guard uniform smiled at you both upon taking notice of your presence. "Hello again, Hayley." Kindly, she said. "What brings you back here so soon?"

"Hello again, Ms Norse." Kindly, Hayley replied. "My brother John had recently discovered magic." She then frowned and softly added, "We fear it will bring him the wrong attention later."

Ms Norse nodded, pushing back her long black hair and placed her blue eyes onto you with a friendly smile. "We are pleased that you have chosen to visit our school, young man." Remaining kind, she said. "We carry a long history of excellence and success." She then giggled and added, "Though you will be required to wear the visitor's bracelet at all times during your visit."

Hayley giggled slightly, trying to hide her blush. "I nearly forgot..." She summoned a very curious bracelet embroidered with tiny images of flowers, ballerinas, high heels, and other feminine symbols and forced it onto your left wrist. "Don't take that off until we are back home."

"What's this supposed to do other than embarrass me?" Blushing, you demanded.

"It's a magical device that protects you from the spells and enchantments that in turn protect those who come here to learn magic." Firmly but kindly, Ms Norse explained. "If you take it off before the end of your visit, you will become a girl, a witch, and a student at this boarding school for the full year." She then smiled."Fell free to remove the bracelet at any time you feel this school is for you."

"Ms Norse!..." Gasping, Hayley scolded.

Ms Norse shrugged, giving an innocent smile. "You can't blame a girl for trying."

Hayley could only shake her head at that as the gates were opened and lead you towards the visitor's building to sign him in for a tour. On the way there, she noticed that you were looking everywhere, taking in the sights. "One thing at a time, bro." Smiling, she said. "We need to sign in first before we can go wandering around."
1221311213311313231.title: take the tour of Witchbloom.

choices: Elvira pulls rank and gives the tour.
Miss Verse is given the honor.
12213112133113132313.content:
As Hayley led you to the nearest building, which you guessed was administrations, she became aware that your presence was drawing a small crowd of new students. You noticed this as well and was becoming visibly nervous. Hayley took your hand and silently urged you to walk faster. While you followed with a quicker pace, you could hear some of the comments the new students were making behind you.

"That's John Harrison, grandson of the head witch!" Whispering, one student remarked. "What is he doing here at Witchbloom?!"

"That must be his sister, Hayley." Also whispering, another student said. "I heard she was last year's top student, breaking all records."

A third student giggled. "She must have talked him into learning magic and is considering this school." Bemused, she whispered. "We may get another student before classes begin."

"Say nothing, John." Carefully whispering, Hayley warned.

Albeit reluctantly, you remained quiet despite comments from the young witch students you and she passed and followed her into the administrations building where you both found your grandmother, Elvira Strange talking with a young woman you never met before. Elvira was tall and slender with long black hair and deep blue eyes. She wore a flattering black dress and high heels that seemed to make no noise when she walked. The other woman was a short, slightly plump with shoulder length brown hair and green eyes. She wore a suit dress that flattered her figure. The two stopped talking upon seeing you enter. The strange woman seemed surprised where Elvira merely smiled kindly.

"Good afternoon, Hayley, John." Smiling, Elvira said. "This is a pleasant surprise."

"Good afternoon, Elvira, Miss Verse." Politely, Hayley said. "John had learned our little secret earlier than planned." She then smiled, adding, "He had questions and decided a tour would best answer them."

"Elvira...?" Worried, you whispered.

"She is the head witch." Carefully, Hayley whispered back. "We can't call her grandma here as it raises questions of favoritism."

"A very wise choice, if I may say so." Grinning, Miss Verse said. "Our school, although only for girls, offers an education and benefits that will greatly outweigh anything you may lose through a change in gender."

"With all due respect, I'm here for a tour, Miss Verse." Firmly but kindly, you said. "I just want the facts, not a sales pitch." You winced, adding, "I have a feeling this goes deeper than what I've been told."

"I am pleased to see that you are as cautious but not as blunt as your father." Smiling, Elvira said. "I do believe a tour can be easily arranged." She sighed. "Your instincts are spot on, there is a lot to this but I suggest you take it in a little at a time."

"I would be honored to personally lead your tour." Offering, Miss Verse said.

"You offer is appreciated." Calmly, Elvira said. "However, I believe it is in everyone's best interest if I conduct the tour myself."

"I respectfully request the honor, madam head witch." Bowing slightly, Miss Verse said. "I vow not to fail you of this school..."

"Um... what's going on?" Confused, you asked in a whisper.

Hayley held back a giggle. "They're arguing over who is going to give you the tour." Bemused, she whispered back. "It's not often the 'prince' of all Roughnecks requests a tour of witch school."

"Roughnecks...?" Confused, you asked.

Hayley sighed then whispered, "Remember the power all witch boys have...?"

You sighed. "Its political..." Guessing correctly, you said. "Terrific..."

Hayley smiled, knowing that you were just beginning to grasp what you had fallen into and watched as Elvira and Miss Verse politely argued who would give you the tour..."
12213112133113132313.title: Young witches take notice of you.

122131121331131323133.content:
"With all due respect, Miss Verse and madam head witch, the honor should be mine." Serious, Hayley stated. "This is a family affair... we gave the offer to John and he accepted. If anyone else gives the tour other than family, it would give the appearance of carrying an ulterior motive."

Elvira turned to Hayley, surprised but then smiled as Miss Verse looked on, shocked. "Well said, Hayley." Calmly, Elvira said. "I would never hear the end of it from my husband, Dr. Moriarty Strange, leader of the Roughneck community if he viewed a tour lead by myself or Miss Verse as an attempt to sway his grandson's decision."

"I agree that you graduated at the top of your class with honors and breaking every record." Politely, Miss Verse said. "However, this particular visit holds significance..."

"It holds a great political significance." Frowning Elvira corrected. "At first, I believed myself best suited for the task due to its delicate nature. However, I now see that it would be best if Hayley lead the tour so it would be seen as it truly is, a sister showing off her Alma Matter."

"Perhaps one of us should accompany them then." Offering a compromise, Miss Verse said. "At least this way we can guarantee our visitor has a pleasant tour of our fine school."

"I agree." Smiling, Elvira replied. "However, I believe this falls under the jurisdiction of the school prefects; I will summon them."

With a quick phone call, four teenage girls in security uniforms entered the office with serious expressions on their faces. They spotted you immediately and turned to Elvira. "Has this boy caused trouble on campus, madam head witch?" The first girl asked.

"John, this is Tia Winters, Lee Summers, Val Fall, and Mia Spring." Motioning to the girls, Elvira said. "They are this school's top prefects and Rogue Hunter cadets."

"Rogue Hunters?" Confused, you asked.

"Witch police." Firmly but kindly, Miss Verse replied. "They help enforce the laws of magic and protect the masquerade that witches do not exist."

Elvira nodded then turned to the prefects. "Ladies, I would like to introduce you to my grandson; John Harrison whom I am certain you have already been briefed regarding his potential."

The prefects turned slightly pale as they looked at you then they saw Hayley and sighed slightly. "I take it Mr John Harrison is here for a tour with his sister." More calmly, Tia said.

"That is correct." Firmly, Elvira said. "I am entrusting you four to ensure nothing unfortunate happens to our guests during their stay. As John told me, he just wants the facts, not a sales pitch."

All four girls nodded, a bright smile forming upon their faces. "John and Hayley are in good hands, madam head witch." Saluting, Mia said. "We will ensure a pleasant and informative tour."

With that said, the four teenagers lead you and Hayley out of the office to begin the tour. They first took you both to...
122131121331131323133.title: Hayley is given the honor.

choices: still a boy but very sore.
1221311213311313231332.content:
The four prefects led you and Hayley out of the administration building to another low structure where classes were held for many of the students. "Classes do not start for another few days." Politely, Tia said. "However, I can assure you that learning magic is more about weaving spells and stirring up potions; it is an exact art."

Tia was slightly taller than you with shoulder length blond hair and bright blue eyes. She was quite muscular for her age, clearly a tomboy. She motioned to an empty classroom where a lone female teacher was preparing her desk for up coming lessons.

"Pardon the intrusion, Miss Lucy." Politely, Lee said. "We are giving a extra special guest a tour of the school."

Lee was an inch taller than Tia with short brown hair and hazel eyes. She was not muscular but you sensed that her magic was strong. Hayley noticed you blushed slightly at her comment but remained silent though you did see the hint of a bemused grin. Lucy was tall and slender with auburn hair and brown eyes. She turned to the prefects with a single eyebrow raised, carrying a curious look on her face. "Every student who comes here is special in their own way." Firmly but kindly, she said. "How do you see this one individual as extra special?" She smiled upon seeing Hayley then gave a bemused smile to you. "Welcome back, Hayley." Kindly, she said. "I see your little brother has discovered magic a little earlier than you had planned."

"John Harrison shows great potential." Politely, Val said. "He is considering this school but fears a sales pitch rather than the facts."

Val was the shortest of the group. She had mid-back black hair and green eyes. She was not strong in appearance but you sensed her magic was almost as strong as your sister's.

"I- I just learned about all of this today." Blushing, you said. "I was told I needed to make a choice, might or magic, but I need more facts before I can make such a life changing decision." You scuffed his feet, nervous. "I'm not more special than anyone else... honestly, I'd rather be an athlete."

Lucy smiled kindly though you suspected she was holding back a giggle. "It is very rare to meet a humble roughneck." Bemused, she said. "Many witch boys almost immediately go into a mental power trip when they discover the physical powers they have at their command." She giggled slightly. "To be fair, I have also met young girls of witch blood who fell down the same path due to their magic."

"What do you teach in your class?" Curious, you asked.

"I teach the uses and laws of magic." Firmly but kindly, Lucy explained. "The uses and laws of boy magic is equally important. There is a balance and we must be careful to maintain it to avoid repeating past mistakes."

"Can you give an example?" Showing interest, you asked.

Before Lucy could respond, a loud boom was heard that shook the room followed by alarms and buzzers sounding from everywhere. "It's a magical back draft!" Startled, Mia announced. "Lock down the room!"

You whipped your head around just as Hayley did to find the prefects quickly pull their wands from their blazers and pointed them at the door, causing it to close then glow for a moment. This made you visibly worried.

"What is going on?!" Firmly, you demanded.

"A student has likely tried to use a spell beyond her ability to control." Serious, Mia explained. "This causes a magical back draft as the magic used has no where to go but explode outward like a bomb."

Mia was the tallest of the group with short auburn hair and brown eyes. She was visibly strong with strong magic as well. You had no idea what was going on but your mind was already exploring options to make a run for it, taking Hayley with you.

"Stay close to me." Firmly, Lucy said.

Another loud boom was heard and you saw a support beam falling from the ceiling. You called out Hayley's name before pushing her out of the way... The next thing you remember you were waking up lying in a bed...
1221311213311313231332.title: Hayley's teacher.

12213112133113132313321.content:
The next thing you remember you woke up lying in a bed somewhere unfamiliar, you were still alive but very sore. Looking around, you spotted a strange girl looking over you. She gave you a sad smile before speaking. "Thanks for saving me, John." Softly, she said. "You took quite a hit when that support beam fell."

"Sorry... who are you?" Confused, you asked.

The girl sighed. "Oh, yeah... I guess I should explain this." Ruefully, she said. "I'm your sister, Hayley. A first year student tried a body swap spell but, being untrained..."

"She goofed and swapped with you?" Trying to understand, you asked.

Hayley shook her head. "With no specific target, the spell swapped everyone's bodies at random within the range of her magic." Serious, Hayley replied. "Fortunately, it is only temporary as her magic is strong but not that strong. Still, until this mess is fixed, the entire school is in lock down."

Startled, you looked at yourself and screamed as you saw two orbs slowly forming upon your chest! "Why am I changing?!"

"The visitor's bracelet protected you from being body swapped but the magic protecting the school detected your injuries." Serious, Hayley explained. "It has thus shut down your bracelet and is changing you to speed up your recovery." She winced. "However, it also means you are now a student."

You turned pale. "What?!"

"It's not that bad... Lucy." Trying not to grin, Hayley said.

"Don't call me that!" Annoyed, you grumbled. You sighed. "Can't I just be allowed to go home after the school raises the lock down?"

"You could but it would trap you as a girl and a witch for life." Serious, Hayley said. "You were not marked as a trespasser but an injured visitor. The rules are very clear on that particular point."

"We are honor bound to show you that magic is not to be feared by teaching you magic." An unfamiliar woman said. "I'm Miss Lucy." She sighed. "Yes, even the teachers were affected... the rule states that an injured visitor must be taught magic as compensation for being hurt."

"What of the girl who caused all of this?" Wincing, you asked. "Is she okay?"

"She will live but she has been denied her magic until adulthood for her recklessness and serious lack of judgement." Serious, Lucy replied. "Fear not, Hayley will be staying here for the year as well as a teacher's aide so..."

Hayley smiled. "Welcome to Witchbloom all girls boarding school, sis."
12213112133113132313321.title: a girl and a student.

122131121331131323133211.content:
Minutes later, you again met Elvira at administrations. Begrudgingly you were wearing the Witchbloom school uniform along with Hayley who was in the body of another girl. "No one asked for the situation they are currently facing, Lucy." Patiently, Elvira said. Everyone will be switching back to their original bodies in a few days."

"Your selfless act in saving your sister has earned you the status of a student." Smiling, Miss Verse added. "Your mother is very proud of you."

"As am I." giving you a one armed hug, Hayley said.

"I am certain you both had better things planned than this." Bemused, Elvira said. "However, I can assure you, Lucy that learning magic now will help you in the long run." She then turned to Hayley. "Being a teacher's aide this year will earn you the right to be a teacher here next year, if you so wish it."

Both you and Hayley nodded to which Elvira smiled. "Lucy... John, I know you better than you may think." Calmly, she said. "You try to excel in everything that you do, it is your competitive nature that drives this..."

"What are you trying to tell me?" wincing, you asked.

Elvira sighed. "Do not be too surprised if you graduate a girl and a witch for life." Softly, she said. "I say this not because I want another granddaughter but because I know how addictive magic can be."
122131121331131323133211.title: You are enrolled.

choices: you pretended to put on the bracelet
123.content:
Mom mused for a few seconds, before saying, "I've got it! You won't doubt me now..."

"Doubt.... w-what?!" you gasped, as an invisible force grabbed you by your ankle and lifted you several feet into the air. Of course, it meant you was flipped upside down, so now, you was facing mom's bemused face effectively from the ceiling.

"Do you believe me now?" mom asked.

"Crap.. I mean..." you stammered, not quite believing your eyes.

"Language, mister" mom warned as she thought about the next move. Suddenly, your scalp felt itchy, and long blond strands of hair shot out, overwhelming your normal hair. Your new hair defied gravity though, as it quickly twisted itself into a new hairstyle. Mom was already giggling madly when a mirror appeared in front of your still upside down, and shocked figure.

"Mom! What have you done to me!?" you wailed, seeing your new hairstyle. It looked like someone had glued on an extremely stupid looking wig, and decided to do a bad parody of both Mel and Hannah. Braided pigtails did not suit you at all.

Still giggling, mom flipped you back onto the ground. "Still doubting me, now?"

"N-no. Can you fix this?" you pleaded.

Mom didn't answer your plea. Instead, she produced a particularly girlish looking bracelet and said, "Put this on."

"What!? I'm not wearing that" you protested.

"I would, John, if I was you. Especially where we're going..." mom warned.
123.title: Mom decides you do a relatively harmless prank ...

choices: the girls drag you to another room
the girls notice your bracelt, but don't care
1231.content:
Just as you put on the bracelet, you felt a strange sensation, like you we're dizzy and faint. Blinking, you realized that you couldn't see. "Mom! What have you done to me!" you wailed, slightly relived that your voice was still normal. It had crossed your mind that the bracelet might turn you into a girl, which naturally you didn't want.

"Sorry, honey. I forget how much teleportation sickness affects anyone new to it. Your vision will clear shortly: mom apologized.

"Teleportation! Where are we?" you ddemanded, as you felt your body, which was still normal apart from the hair. in a louder voice, you shrieked, "You hadn't changed my hair!"

"Relax, John. You're at Witchbloom magic school. Its a girls' school..."

"You're not going to leave me here" you said, unnerved.

"Only if you want me to, son. Or, if you're foolish enough to remove that bracelet of yours. Its a signal to the girls here; you're safe and are not to be enrolled. Without it, they'll skirt you and enrol you on sight.

You suddenly felt relieved that you put it on. "So why are we here?"

"I want to show you some things. Even if we separate, you're safe. Just head for the admin building."

Naturally, you did separate from mom, when a pair of teenage girls bumped into you. Mom didn't notice; either that, she didn't care. She was already out of sight when you picked yourself up.

"Sorry, I've got to go" you stammered, eager to get away. Something wasn't quite right about the way those two were staring at you....
1231.title: Leap of faith

12311.content:
"Just a moment now." Grabbing your arm, the first girl said. "Where is your escort?"

I got separated from my mom when I bumped into you two." Irritated, you said. "She told me I was safe here and if we got separated to go to the administration building."

"Do you know where that building is?" Raising an eyebrow, the second girl asked.

You paused then shook your head. "Not exactly."

"I am Rachel." Still holding you, the first girl said. "This is Susan. We are school prefects; we enforce the rules here for everyone's safety."

"Can you take me to the administration building?" Hopeful, you asked.

"If your story proves to be true, yes." Honestly, Rachel replied. "We are going to need to ask you a few questions first."

The two girls dragged you to a small building where they had you sit down before Rachel sat down across from you with Susan remaining standing. "Why do I feel like I'm about to be interrogated?" Annoyed, you demanded.

"It is our responsibility to ensure all those who come here are protected and follow the school rules." Serious, Susan said. "You are wearing an official visitor bracelet which confirms part of your story."

"However, you have a very girlish hairstyle." Added Rachel. "This means that your bracelet is either a clever forgery or it is defective."

"Either way, you will completely change into a girl and be enrolled within the hour." Serious, Susan said. "That is unless you can explain the hair."

"Mom changed my hair shortly after I discovered the magic book." Blushing, you explained. You went on to tell the girls what had happened before adding, "I don't want any trouble; I just want to get to the administration building where mom told me to go if we got separated."

"What is your name?" Curious, Rachel asked.

You sighed. "I am John Harrison."

Rachel and Susan gasped then turned to each other shocked before....
12311.title: the girls drag you to another room

choices: Mom is lectured by her mom.
123112.content:
"We need to get you off campus immediately, Mr Harrison." Firmly, Rachel said. "Get up, there is not much time before-"

"Before what?" Standing, you demanded.

"Your body is switching genders!" Urgently, Susan said. "Unless you want to be a student here, move!"

You screamed seeing that two orbs had begun to grow onto your chest and ran behind the two school prefects as they lead you to the front gates. Only, just as you were being pushed through, someone pulled you back. It was mom! "What are you trying to do to my son?!" Annoyed, she demanded.

Rachel sighed, seeing a skirt form where your jeans were. "I am sorry, Ms Harrison." Evenly, she said. "The visitor bracelet you gave your... daughter was defective."

Mom's eyes grew wide as she turned to you and sighed. "Oh dear..."

"We tried to get him off campus before the magic could take hold." Sadly, Sarah added. "However..."

"It seems as if I have goofed." Wincing, mom said. "Sorry, John. You have a tough choice to make now."

"What's that?" Worried, you asked.

"You can either enroll here for the year and learn magic where you can return home a boy, if you wish after graduation." To your shock, she said. "Or you can come back home and start your new life as my teenage daughter and learn magic with the rest of the family."

"There's no way to change me back into a boy now?" Panicked, you asked.

Rachel sadly shook her head. "I'm afraid not." Honestly, she replied. "The magic that transformed you mistook you for a trespasser because the bracelet was defective."

"I'm going to get the lecture of my life for this... Lucy." Wearily, mom said. "Still, you need to choose before I must choose for you."

Tears welled up in your eyes. You did not want to spend an entire school year as a girl but you did not want to spend the rest of your life as one either. With a sigh, you took the lesser of the two choices.

"I'll enroll." Glumly, you said. "Just don't expect me to like it."

Mom gave you a warm hug. "We'll go to administrations and explain what had happened." Kindly, she said. "I'm certain they will understand." Then she muttered, "Mom is going to kill me..."

"We'll go with you." Firmly, Rachel said. "This is as much our fault as it is yours, Ms Harrison."

Sarah nodded in agreement and the three lead you to administrations.
123112.title: escorted you off campus.

choices: you storm off to your new dorm
1231121.content:
You was left in what looked like an ordinary waiting room while a couple of women, or rather witches talked about you. Not that you could tell exactly what was said, but from mom's reaction, it probably involved a stern lecture. After fifteen minutes, Elvira herself walked up to you, flanked by Lucy. Mom was nowhere to be seen.

"Where is mom?" you asked.

"Making herself scarce. You're not the first to be transformed by her own mother, and not the first for it to occur accidentally, but you're the first on school grounds" Elvira said humorlessly. "We'll try to make this transition as painless as possible, but there could be complications."

"Complications? What complications?" you demanded, suddenly concerned.

"You're magically potent, and it may be that you remain a girl longer even if you're not in school. Still, we have one thing in common" Lucy said.

"What?" you said with a half growl.

"Lucy Conners, met Lucy Harrison" Elvira said.

"Lucy? You gave me a girl's name?"

"You'd look foolish Lu, with a boy's name. Still, you're be with girls with a similar story to you. One that was transformed permanently because her mother wanted a daughter, one that got transformed trying to help that said daughter, another that thought drinking from an unmarked bottle was a 'good' idea, one that lost a bet against a witch and was turned into a little girl, and one that thought trying on his girlfriend's... well, ex-girlfriend's uniform would be a good laugh. Speaking of uniforms, I have yours right here" Lucy said as she thrust into your hands a uniform. You scowled as you saw it consisted of white plain underwear, black maryjanes, knee length socks, a blue pleated skirt, white blouse that was secured by a ribbon; you didn't want to wear any part of it.
1231121.title: You are enrolled.

12311213.content:
You frowned at the uniform; distaste clear in your eyes but you sighed and took it from Lucy. "When forced to live in Rome, I guess..." Sourly, you muttered.

You changed into the uniform in a bathroom and came back out, blushing. The clothing was comfortable but it left you feeling out of place as you still saw yourself as a teenage boy rather than a little girl. Elvira had left by the time you came out and Lucy was waiting for you alone. "Elvira had to attend a meeting but you will see her here and there throughout the school year." Kindly, she said. "Allow me to introduce you to your classmates, Lu."

"This is not fair." Tearfully, you said. "Why can't I, or the others, be changed back and sent home?"

"Like the real world, magic is not always fair." Honestly, Lucy replied. "However, it does carry a balance; a good and bad side to everything."

"Sorry but I don't see a good side here." Frowning, you said.

Lucy smiled. "You will, in time." Patiently, she said. "Everyone in your class feels that they had been cheated in some way. It is my job to teach them and you magic and show you all how magic is not to be feared or resented but respected."

Lucy reached a room and opened the door before ushering you in. You saw what looked like the common room in a frat house in a college scene. There were bunk beds lined up against one long wall with name plates on them, two doors on the second wall leading into two bathrooms, a number of desks facing the third wall with a chalkboard, and what looked like a small chemistry station on either side of the door you had just walked through. Five girls who were talking in the center of the room stopped and turned, curious to see you enter with Lucy.

"Class, this is our new student, Lucy Harrison." Kindly, Lucy said. "You may call her Lu. Her mother brought her here for a tour only her visitor bracelet proved to be defective and it marked her as a trespasser rather than a visitor." She paused then added, "All I will say is that it was quite the embarrassment for her mother."

You blushed slightly at the nickname Lucy gave you as the girls walked up to you. From the expressions on their faces, they already knew you were once a boy. Only their surprised looks quickly turned to kind smiles as they each introduced themselves.

The first girl was your height with long blond hair and ocean blue eyes. "I'm Jack, now Jacinta." Softly, she said. "Mom transformed me saying that she wanted a daughter to pass on her magic to and dumped me here to be trained."

The second girl was a near mirror image of Jacinta only with light brown hair and ocean blue eyes. "I'm Paul, now Paula." Shaking your hand, she said. "I tried to save my bro, err, sister by breaking her our of here." She blushed brightly, a frown forming on her face. "Stupid trespassing rule!"

"You were not enrolled because you were trespassing, young lady." Firmly but kindly, Lucy said. "You came onto school grounds as a visitor. You were enrolled because your mother knew you were coming here and told us you wanted to learn magic."

Paula turned to Lucy, stunned. A look of betrayal filled her expression. "What?!"

Lucy nodded, a sigh escaping her lips. "That is why she is now serving a year without magic." Serious, she said. "She forced this upon you both only we did not learn of her illegal actions until afterwords."

"When it was too late." Pouting, Paula said. "Am I stuck as a girl too?"

"That remains to be seen." Honestly, Lucy said. "I can not see the future, girls."

The third girl walked up to you with a bemused smile on her face. She had brown eyes and shoulder length auburn hair tied into two pigtails with a blue ribbon on the left and a pink ribbon on the right. You found that rather odd but decided not to question it.

"I'm Cire, still called Cire." Smiling, she said. "Who knew having a gender neutral name could come in handy around magic?"

"What's your story?" Curious, you asked.

"My mom called her potion collection her 'pop' stash." Rolling her eyes, Cire explained. "I thought she had a stash of colas somewhere and decided to look for it." She laughed in spite of herself. "Well, I found it and I can tell you her 'pop' has quite the kick to it."

"We found evidence that Cire's mother had baited her into searching for the 'pop' collection." Serious, Lucy said. "However, Cire found her situation, although unfair, to be ironic so charges were not pressed."

"I'm Ty, now Tia." Sourly, the fourth girl said. "I'm here because a witch suckered me into a bet without saying she was a witch!"

You turned to Tia, surprised. She was slightly shorter than the others with mid back length sun blond hair and sky blue eyes. You refrained from telling her that her pout only made her look more cute. Lucy smiled kindly at her.

"No, you are here because you took a bet from the daughter of a witch and tried to sneak into the house of a known quasi rogue." Patiently, she countered. "That teenage girl who pushed you into the bet is no longer a witch; at least not until she reaches thirteen again. That still does not make you blameless, you willingly trespassed upon a witch's home. She could have done worse than enroll you here."

"Quasi rogue?" Curious, you asked.

Lucy smiled. "A trouble making witch."

"I guess that leaves me." Sighing, the fifth girl said. "I'm David, now Diana. I decided to wear my now former girlfriend's school uniform as a costume for a masquerade party we were invited to." She huffed. "How was I supposed to know it would automatically enroll me here?!"

Diana was a well built girl for her young age with shoulder length braided brown hair and green eyes. Lucy shook her head, smiling. "Your former girlfriend was reprimanded for foolishly taking her uniform with her off campus." Calmly, she said. "As I told Lu, magic is not always fair but it does carry a balance."
12311213.title: you meet some other students

As you became acquainted with your new classmates, mom returned home to find Hayley looking worried. "Where is John?" Softly, she demanded.

Tia seemed to take the lead. "Sorry to do this to you, Lucy, but we have to talk about you being the granddaughter of the head witch."

You took a step back, not liking where this was going. "Do you seriously think just because the head witch is my grandmother, I have any clout around here?" Irritated, you demanded.

"The head witch trumps everyone else." Serious, Tia replied. "She is literally the queen of all witches."

"That makes you a princess." Wincing, Paula said. "You got to have some pull, even here."

Lucy listened to the conversation, smiling slightly. "I suspected this would happen." Calmly, she said to herself. "The transformed boys will explore every option that opens up to them to change back to normal; let's see how Lu handles this."

You sighed, shaking your head. "Grandma, err, Elvira would not change me back either." Ruefully, you replied. "What chance do you think I'll have in convincing her to change any of you back?" You paused to think then added, "From what I understand, each case is different

"What do you mean, Lu?" Chiming in Lucy asked. "Please explain."

"Well, Jacinta was permanently changed." To her tears, you said. "She was likely sent here to learn magic so not to hurt anyone with her new found power."

Jacinta froze, worried. "You mean like mom?" Wincing, she asked.

"She was stripped of her magic for a year for your permanent transformation." Calmly, Lucy said. "She would have no defense or way to help you should something went wrong. That was why Elvira had you sent here for training."

"Is that the same for me?" Tearfully, Paula asked.

You shook your head. "I'm thinking your mother feared a magical retaliation should you have succeeded." Serious, you said. "She had no magic so I'm guessing that is why she had you enrolled."

"Only she was caught in her own lies." Sternly, Lucy added. "She will get her magic back when you two graduate as fully trained witches."

"That will make the odds even should she decide to try something else." Softly, you said.

"I sort of had my change coming for being so curious." Ruefully, Cire said. "Only, it doesn't hurt to try to snag a 'get out of school' pass, does it?"

"There are no shortcuts when it comes to magic." Serious, Lucy said.

"I guess that means you have to ride out the effects of the potion you drank." Shrugging, you said. "Only I think your mom was counting on your curious nature... May I ask what is with the ribbons?"

Cire giggled. "The blue represents the boy I was and the pink is for the girl I am now." Simply, she explained. She then sighed. "I'm her only child, so..."

"So, your case is much like Jacinta's." Sadly, you said. "It may be permanent."

Cire fought some tears. "Yeah... it might. It's not knowing that get me."

"The bottle was unmarked." Softly, Lucy said.

"Has no one thought to test the potion to see what it was?" Curious, you demanded.

Lucy smiled. "She's using her head." Pleased, she thought. "Very good." She then said, "It was tested; I'll see if Elvira will release the results to Cire."

"Now we're getting somewhere." Smirking, Tia said. "I told you guys; having a princess with us will give us some pull."

Lucy held back the urge to laugh. "If you'd use your head as much as your mouth, you would have gotten much further than this by now." Bemused, she thought.

"As John, I could not back down from a bet either." Honestly, you said. "Only I know a losing wager when I see one." You smiled. "Those are not bets, Tia; those are traps."

Tia opened her mouth to respond but turned away, blushing brightly. "I... I knew that!" Gruffly, she spat.

"I'm guessing that quasi rogue sent you here because she sensed strong magic in you." Surprising Tia, you said. "Otherwise, why would she have even bothered to go though the steps to put you, someone with no relation to her, here for a mere trespass?"

Tia seemed stunned. "I- I don't know." Wide eyed, she said. "I don't think my mom is a witch..."

"Your mom is immune to magic." Cutting in, Lucy said. "Still, although magic does not effect her, it very quickly accumulates and needs an outlet."

"What outlet?" Quivering, Tia demanded.

You gasped. "Passing the magic on to the next generation." Whispering, you said.

Lucy nodded. "Quite correct." Calmly, she said. "Tia is the first witch of her blood line. The quasi rogue only intended a temporary gender change to scare 'him'."

"Only it 'kick started' my own magic." Pale, Tia finished. She sniffed then smiled slightly. "I'm the first witch in my family..."

"That leaves Diana." Turning to the pouting girl, you said. "Something tells me that trying on the uniform alone did not got you enrolled here." Thoughtful, you said. Diana winced, confirming your theory.

"You think there is more to it?" Hiding her smile, Lucy demanded.

"Like you, I can't see the future or the past, Miss Lucy." Politely, you said. "However, I have three sisters; I know when someone is holding something back."

"So what's the real story?" Curious, Jacinta asked.

"You tell me." Defiant, Diana said. "You are the princess..."

You frowned. "I'm thinking you missed your girlfriend so much that you decided to borrow the spare uniform she foolishly took off campus to visit her."

Diana sighed. "Not quite..." Tearfully, she admitted. "She vanished so I figured she had dumped me; I tracked her down to this school and sneaked in to try to win her back." She sobbed slightly. "I know she is not into girls so..."

You shook your head. "You are an idiot!" Sternly, you barked. "Your transformation is not permanent so winning your girlfriend back is not a lost cause!" You scoffed. "You give up way too easy."

Diana looked up at you, hut but then paused as your words sank in and smiled slightly.

"Lu is truly a princess." Smiling, Lucy thought. "A reluctant princess to be certain but a princess none the less; she already has the entire class thinking differently about their situation." She sighed then thought, "Now if she could only get herself to see her own situation in a different light."

"I knew you would come back sooner or later, Lucy." Calmly, Elvira said. "You never were the type to run away from a problem, at least not for very long."

"I need to face those witches who changed me." Determined, you said. "It's the only way to reverse what they did to me and be normal again."

"Normal is what you make of it." Bemused, Elvira said.

"What is that supposed to mean?" Taken back, you asked. "I got changed into a teen girl against my will! The life I had as John was taken away from me and I might not ever get it back!"

"No, you might not." Calmly, Elvira replied. "However, that shouldn't stop you from becoming who you want to be or reaching the goals you make for yourself." She rose from her seat. "Regardless if you are named John or Lucy Harrison, you will always be my fiery grandchild, the one who charges forward, fearing nothing or no one."

"I- I'm scared of magic." Disappointment in your voice, you said. "It's what turned my life upside down."

Elvira smiled. "Fear is like any other emotion, it can be controlled and conquered." Touching your shoulder, she said. "Even I wrestle with that unpleasant emotion from time to time."

"Really?" Unconvinced, you asked. "You?"

"Even the most powerful of people have their fears." Serious, Elvira explained. "Only this is not about me; its about you." She smiled. "I doubt its magic you are fearing. I think you're just mad because two girls got the better of you."

You froze, your eyes wide as if you had been slapped in the face. For a moment, you could have heard a pin drop in Elvira's office before you lightly punched her shoulder. "Grandma...!"

Elvira giggled with you soon joining. "I know where your buttons are, kiddo." Grinning, she said. "You have a lot of your father in you." She then turned serious. "If you truly believe you must face the witches who attacked you here, I will arrange it. However, you must go as you are, a teenage girl. They will see a boy disguise as hiding."

Elvira summoned a visitor bracelet and pushed it onto your wrist before waving her hand, placing you in a modest skirt and blouse with knee length socks and black maryjanes. She then pressed a button on her desk just before a young woman entered. "You called for me, madam head witch?" Politely, she asked.

"Miss Tanner, this is my grandchild, Lucy Harrison." Motioning to you, Elvira said. "She believes she must face the troubled witches who had attacked her here a few days ago." She then carefully whispered, "Take the scenic route."

Miss Tanner smiled then nodded and turned to you. "This way, please."

You did not hear what Elvira whispered to Tanner but you were too focused on facing the troubled witches to think about it. Tanner took you down a long hall where many girls were attending their first class of the school year. Curious, you looked though the windows as you passed. In one room, you saw the teacher showing the class mathematics, something you were quite talented in. You had to be to join the many sports you loved. "Why are they teaching math here?"

"Potion making is an exact art." Simply, Tanner replied. "Much like following a recipe; too much or too little changes how the potion works."

"I didn't know magic was like that." Honestly, you said. "I thought it was like an instinct or something."

"Some of it is." Nodding, Tanner said. "Only its a lot more than just that."

You passed another window and paused seeing a flame burning in a teacher's hand. Your first instinct was to change into the room and help put out the fire only you froze, your eyes dancing as you saw the flame turn into a horse and gallop around the room. "Woah..." Whispering, you said. "Did you see that?"

Tanner inwardly giggled. "That is rather simple spell, Miss Harrison." Lightly, she said. "It's taught to the first years here to show them magic can be fun."

Tanner lead you through a number of halls, passed several classes where you saw more and more magic being used. "We are almost there, Miss Harrison." Kindly, she said. "The troubled witches are usually kept isolated from the other students and I think you can guess why."

You nodded but your focus was no longer on the troubled witches, you were more interested in seeing what was being taught at this school. "I should have stayed long enough for the tour." Dreamily, you muttered. "This magic stuff is kind of cool."

Tanner pretended not to hear you as she passed one final room where you stopped dead in your tracks upon looking into the window. You saw a teacher firing spells at Mel who was deflecting them with some effort with a class of younger students watching with wide eyes. "What's going on in there?" Worried, you demanded. "Is that some kind of combat demonstration?"

"That is the defense against rogue witches class." Standing next to you, Tanner replied. "Like everyone else, sometimes, witches go bad. Young witches need to know how to defend themselves and their male relatives from magic attacks."

"So, they don't need my help..." Downcast, you said.

"They do need your help, Lucy." Serious, Tanner countered. "So, when you are done moping and ready take on the world again, your family will be there for you."

Taking in Tanner's words, a small grin formed onto your face. "Miss Tanner, forget about those stuck up troubled witches..."

"What's wrong, Elle?" Megan called out from downstairs. You knew if she had a role in this, it would be as a distraction. Given the amount of time taken to paint, dry and remodel your furniture, this makeover had to be magical.

After grinding your teeth for a few seconds, you said in an angry voice, "Nothing."

"What do you think? Hey! Don't come up!" you screamed, as you heard your twin's approach. Mel ignored you, and in your panic, you flame reignited. It also resulted in your cheer costume twisting into your hated Cinderella inspired dress. The only positive was that it temporarily drew both Megan's and Mel's attention away from your room.

"Why are you wearing that?" Mel giggled. "Mom? Hayley? Can you come up? I totally need some answers"

You glared daggers as Hayley emerged from her room. Instantly, you suspected her as the remodeller of your room as she looked drained. The instant she saw you, she giggled, but it was quickly followed by a 'Sorry sis', which wasn't at all comforting.

"You lost control, sis" Hayley said as she eyed your outfit.

"Lost control?"

"Yeah. I'm guessing between Mel's noisiness and your room..."

"YOU? You gave me a cheer room?!" you ranted.

"Absolutely not! It must have changed along with you. What sort of room does Candice have?" Hayley asked.

You remained silent about that, but fired a question of your own. "Why are you so tired?"

"I have to practice, Ellie" Hayley said. "Magic and a temper are a poor mix. Try focusing. What do you want the most?"

At first, it was to get out of the dress, but you glared at your twin. Instantly you knew what you wanted, and began to focus. She shrieked as her clothes became the modern version of your own gown.

*****************

1322212211332131121211132312211211111123.content:
That night, you began to think about everything that had happened to you, Candice, and the rest of your family due to the situation at hand. You decided you needed to call grandma, or as you now knew her, the head witch. "I just hope she'll take my call at this hour." Sighing, you muttered. "I need to find a way to settle this before something, or rather, everything gets out of hand."

You called the only number you knew to get a hold of Elvira in an emergency and counted the rings, waiting for her to answer. Finally, after the fifth ring, Elvira answered. "What can I do for you, Elle?" Tiredly, she asked. "It is rather late."

"I apologize for the late call but I feel this is important... madam head witch." As calm as you could, you said. "I strongly feel things are getting out of hand, partially due to your test."

"Well, I am certainly pleased you do not feel I am completely to blame for your situation." Calmly, Elvira said. "Where do you think the rest of the blame falls to?"

"Samantha Forester for selling Harry, now Candice magical artifacts, Candice for shooting off her mouth off in anger, and myself for not thinking things through." Tearing up, you said. "The point is, something has to give before everything explodes into a big mess." You gave a teary sigh. "It seems Kristy Hart has magic too... I don't know what to do, grandma! Please, I need some help or at least some advice!"

Elvira was silent for a moment before she spoke. "You have everything you need to stabilize and control the situation, Elle." Calmly, she said. "You just don't have your facts in order."

"What do you mean?" Confused, you asked.

"Harry, now Candice always went back to Samantha Forester to buy more unusual antiques." Patiently, Elvira said. "Granted, he did not know they were magical or that the shop owner was a witch but he bought them compulsively; why do you think that is so?"

The question caught you off guard. "Maybe he's somehow drawn to magic...?" Guessing, you said.

"Precisely." Softly, Elvira said. "Candice has a magical addiction, just like Kristy Hart. Only she steals what she wants."

"Which would explain why she has magic." Worried, you said. You then gasped. "Does that mean Candice is a witch too?! Also, who did she steal the magical items from?!"

"Samantha Forester has been known to help boys interested in magical artifacts discover their magical talents; Candice carried strong promise despite not being of witch blood." Firmly, Elvira said. "As for Kristy, she is being watched; you need not deal with her unless she confronts you directly but remember the law of magic use in public."

"So Samantha thought she was helping him by allowing the magical artifacts slowly change him into a girl and a witch as she hates men and boys." Mussing, you said. "It makes sense but it's still wrong."

"She is guilty of selling magical items to a non witch but that is a misdemeanor crime; a slap on the wrist I'm afraid. Using magic out of anger in public however has closed her store for a month."

"Then she has been dealt with." Sighing, you said.

"That only leaves Candice and yourself." Flatly, Elvira said.

"What about you?" Softly, you challenged.

"My test was merely a matter of bad timing, no crime there." Firmly but kindly, Elvira said. "However, since you clearly need to be pacified, I will tell you this. Your test is not about your will to be a boy again but your ability to deal with a magical situation. So far, you are doing well because you have the will and humility to ask an expert for help in a situation that is over your head."

"This is not the test I thought it was..." Confused, you muttered.

Elvira gave a short giggle. "No one figures out their test before it ends, Elle." Bemused, she said. "You did figure out it was a test, as I predicted but you will not move forward until you pass or fail."

With that, Elvira ended the call, leaving you with much to think about. "This situation I am in is the test." Taken back, you said. "Only how I settle this determines if I pass or fail." You slumped down onto your bed and sighed. "No pressure..."

The next day, you decided to study the magic book. Although you hated spending the last day you had before restarting school as a girl in your overgirlified room, you needed answers quickly. Plus, you had a feeling it was wise to avoid a potentially vengeful Mel; she hated mom's new photo in the main hall.. Some of the rules were already known to you, such as the no use in public, but even then, there were different grades of no use. To your disappointment, Samantha's magic was on the lesser scale thanks to her relative discretion. Of course if she had tried to roast you and Candice to a crisp with fireballs, it would be a different matter.

Other rules seemed to be more etiquette based; except for unusual situations, males have no magic whatsoever. For their protection, they can only be permanently changed by their mother or legal guardian except for life saving circumstances. All actions must be explained in a satisfactory manner. Temporary changes can be made for demonstrationary purposes. You gave a slight snort at the final warning of the section; Remember magic does not make you all powerful. Although by it's nature, feminine, do not except any sympathy if you end up with a black eye from some enraged boy you've put into a skirt, or end up on a receiving end of a spell from a boy you had just girlified, unaware she can use magic.

"O-kay. No using magic in public. Don't torture people. What else?" you muttered. The rules and what you're already learnt seemed conflicting; Elvira said Samantha had no case to answer, but changing Harry was not under a life saving pretence; it was pre-empting a possible worse witch.

As you turned the page, you discovered a note tucked within the pages.
Congratulations on reading the rules of magic, Princess

"What? That was it?" you said, half disgusted. You continued reading the note. Unfortunately, most of the rules are not written, and are often based on instinct. Trust your feelings. They will tell if you are right. Now it is time to put your abilities into practice....

"Great" you muttered.

All these cases are already monitored, so do not feel pressured into taking a certain case. The first case is of the Summer quads. Three boys, one girl. Unfortunately, the sister is developing her powers, and with it, it will start to spontaneously her brothers into girls. I suggest you read up on the 'twin factor' and pacify the three new witches any way you can.
The second case is closer to home; I know you know of Cassie Bane. She is becoming a problem. Arrogant, distasteful of guys and believing she in the only witch, Cassie has an older brother, Mike that she has been turning on and off into her new younger sister, Michelle. Teach her the error of her ways and restore Michelle, assuming she wants to be changed back. Beware, she will be attracted to you, both in power and physical form. It may involve some stress, as by now, you have realized you no longer feel attraction towards women...
The third case is more complex. Do not. Repeat, do not unleash your temper, Princess Elle, but it involves your cousin Tim....

"Great. What has that little monster done?" you muttered. Tim liked teasing girls, and considered that his name appeared on this list, it meant he picked the wrong girl.

.... Tim had a altercation with our mutual friend, Samantha Forester....

"What?! That bitch!"

...I told you to calm down!...

"Okay. I'm not going to do anything..."

.... The incident has already been investigated, and has concluded that both parties are responsible for Mr, or should I say, Miss Tower's altered crotch, and that Ms Forester has no case to answer. Tim has not been fully transformed into a female, even after repeated visits to Samantha. We suspect there may be an odd respect between the two. Timothy believes she has hidden her new condition, but both her mother and myself are aware. This can not continue indefinitely, and must be dealt with.
