Seconds, later your new breasts shrank back into your chest. Your relief quickly dissipated as you saw that you were beginning to shrink.

"You're turning me into a child?!" you said angrily.

"Yep" Samantha said, slightly pleased with herself. That said, Elizabeth was fuming as much as you. She hated that Samantha had brazenly disobeyed her orders. Samantha wasn't too fazed; she turned to the angry principal and said, "I've just saved your life. You of all people should know that magic and angry, busty, cute witches are a recipe for disaster. 'Lucy' would be more powerful than you anticipate, and all her anger would be at you."

"She will still have magic, still can use them even at her age, and she is still going to progress into her feminine form" Elizabeth said as she stared at you. You were drowning in your vastly oversized clothes, and dismayed at being so young. You guessed you were about six again, which made you even younger than your little sister.

"While I think of what to do with you, you can start dressing Miss Harrison and get her ready for class. Dismissed."
1343211112131311111311111.title: Extreme  measures

choices: Harriet is called to the principal's office.
13432111121313111113111111.content:
After Samantha had left, Elizabeth handed you the same girl's school uniform Hannah wore to school and pointed to a walk in closet. "You can get dressed in there, young lady." Firmly, she said. "Once you are ready, I will escort you to your new class."

You threw Elizabeth a frustrated pout but reluctantly obeyed. As you moved to close the door, you muttered, "All of this because Forester tried to sell Harry a wishing orb!"

Hearing that, Elizabeth grabbed the door, eyeing you with a pale but angry look. "Forester did what?!"

You sighed. "She tried to sell Harry Rich a wishing orb." Softly, you explained. "He did not believe her when she said it granted wishes." You then told Elizabeth the two wishes he had made and what mom told you would reverse the damage.

When you were finished, Elizabeth shook her head, annoyed. "The wishing orb is designed to be mischievous when non witches make wishes on it." Sternly, she said. "Were you a part of these wishes, Miss Harrison?"

You shook your head. "No, I wasn't." You then blushed. "Still, I think my magic might have made things worse for Harry, or rather Harriet. The wish did not make him a girl... I might have accidentally cast a spell on him."

Elizabeth's face softened. "I see... Did your mom call you princess by any chance?"

You nodded to which Elizabeth smiled slightly. "You will not be attending Hannah's class. I have a different class in mind for you."

"What class is that?" Nervous, you asked.

Elizabeth did not answer, she instead pointed to the closet. With a weary sigh, you entered the closet and closed the door. Minutes later, you were escorted by the arm down the stairwells to the basement of the school. "Why are we here?" Worried, you demanded.

"Your new class is, shall we say, a little different." Cryptically, Elizabeth replied.

She stopped at a door and knocked three times before knocking twice then three times again. You recognized it as Morse code for S.O.S. and gulped. The door opened revealing a very short and slender professionally dressed woman. She had shoulder length black hair and thick glasses that made her blue eyes seem to pop out of her head. She looked up at Elizabeth and smiled.

"Good day, Liz!" In a heavy British accent, she said. "What bright mind have you brought to my classroom today?"

Elizabeth smiled. "Good morning, Helga." Kindly, she said. "I bring you princess Lucy Harrison."

The short woman, who was nearly exactly your height, turned to you with a look of curious bemusement on her face. "A princess, you say?" Smiling, she asked. "Not very lady like, is she?"

"I'm a transformed boy." Frowning, you said. "Samantha Forester tried to help me change back..."

"Forester?!" Surprised, Helga asked. She threw her head back, laughing. "That uninspired hack couldn't cure a case of the sniffles!"

"Mom told me Forester was very powerful." Wincing you said.

Helga nodded. "She is; I was her teacher at Witchbloom boarding school." Bemused, she said. "Only she was so obsessed with learning how to get revenge upon boys who had wronged her in the past or had crossed her path, she never studied the counter spells, potions, or curses."

"Forrester is a walking disaster." Firmly, Elizabeth said. "She did study counter measures later in life only she has almost no experience in using them."

"That's why they call her 'setback'." Moaning, you said.

Helga nodded, turning serious. "I am now retired and volunteer here to teach transformed boys who have been called 'princess' to control their emotions so that magical mishaps can be avoided."

"I'm afraid I might have already had a mishap." Feeling guilty, you said.

You explained what had happened to Harry to which Helga nodded. "Your friend's situation will right itself once the mischievous magic runs its course." Gently, she said. "Had it been permanent, reality would have rest making everyone believe Forester was really a teenage witch rather than a transformed adult."

With that said, she motioned you to enter her class where you found six other girls who turned to you before smiling kindly. Uncertain, you allowed Helga to lead you in front of the class.
13432111121313111113111111.title: You meet Helga, the 'princess' teacher.

choices: Mel shows you a message she has just recieved from mom
Mel points towards a small figure that was approaching. It was Hannah
Mel announces that the're taking Harriet to the mall
134321111213131111131111113.content:
As rough as being sent to a class, magical or not, appearing to be a little girl, it was nothing compared to confronting your sisters, or Megan for the first time. Mel was talking to Megan and occasionally Harry, whilst ignoring Samantha. That witch was completely unfazed; already she was used to having Mel put as much distance between them, yet begrudgingly allowing her to remain in hearing distance. You gulped, not wanting to face them, yet knowing that you had to. Reluctantly, you walked up to them, and all four girls instantly knew who you were.

"What happened to you?!" Megan said, shocked, as she eyed your tiny figure. However, you could sense there was a slight amount of bemusement in her eyes.

"You didn't tell them?" you said accusingly. "That you turned me into a little girl in front of the principal. Who then dressed me like this, and then sent me to a class full of little girls."

"You did WHAT?" Harry snapped as Mel said, "Principal Long is a witch?" You was slightly disappointed that Mel was more stunned with the principal than with your transformation.

"I had no choice, sis. John was starting to change, and I had to do something to dampen that magic" Samantha said.

"Dampen what magic?" Megan demanded.

"John is potentially quite powerful. Problem is that only women can work magic" Samantha said.

"Why didn't you tell me?" Megan said, sounding hurt.

"I thought I could beat this" you said, looking a little downcast.

"You will. I can fix you when we get home" Samantha added. You remained silent, not knowing what to say.

"Hey, it could be worse" Mel said, breaking the silence

"Like what?" you moaned.
134321111213131111131111113.title: The end of a very long day at school

choices: Mom enters, thinks you are ill.
14.content:
Out of the corner of your eye, you saw someone enter the room. It was your older sister, Hayley who had been gone for a year at some special student exchange program. At least that was how mom explained it. You were about to turn her way when you heard her gasp and scream out, "Drop that book!"

Startled, you instantly dropped the book. Only it flew away from you before it could even hit the table right into Hayley's open hand. She gripped the book, giving you a frightening look. You shut your eyes and shook your head before looking at Hayley again. Did she actually make that book fly into her awaiting hand?

You let out a short scream of fright when you saw that Hayley was now gone. You ran out of the room and looked around but she was no where to be seen. "Did I really see that happen?" Confused, you muttered. "Maybe I am coming down with something."

Confused and shaken, you walked back to the table and looked at your sandwich. "I'd better go see Dr. Thompson, just in case."

You tossed the sandwich in the garbage and walked out to go visit you family doctor who lived next door along with one of your closest friends, Megan.
14.title: Hayley returns?

143.content:
As you walked outside, you noticed something lying on the ground, carelessly discarded. Leaning down to examine it, you gave a surprised gasp. It was another 'magic' book.

"What is going on?!" you said to yourself, wondering if you was losing it. The sight of it made you want to get to Dr Thompson's even faster, but after a second of thought, you leant down and picked up the book. It was real, and it was glowing too. Stunned by this, you instantly dropped it. Glowing books weren't a good thing...
143.title: You see the book again.

1431.content:
Nervous, and worried about your own sanity, you turned around and saw that nobody was around. "Maybe I should take this.." you said to yourself, but you never got the chance. Before you could do anything, you blacked out.

From the darkness, you heard several voices, all belonging to teen girls. "You're such an idiot, Becky! You know the rules, yet you just had to teleport a boy here!"

"Don't blame me, I was just trying to teleport myself" another voice countered, assumingly Becky's.

"Yeah? What are we going to do with him?" a third voice demanded.

Your mind still, hazy, you wondered what was going on. Rules? Teleportation?! slowly, you started to stir, wondering why everything was still black.

"Damn it, he is starting to stir" the third voice said.

"Just send him back" Becky urged.

"We can't. Just call Eliza and put him out of his misery" the first voice urged. Your eyes widened due to that comment, causing your vision to come back into focus. Instantly, you saw three teenaged girls, staring at you. The seemed to be typical sixteen year olds, except that their blue skirts, and blouse that they wore looked like something that was out of some anime.

"What is going on?" you demanded, clearly worried.

"I'm not going to sugar coat anything. Becky teleported you here, and boys are forbidden at this school" the first girl said.

"I told you, I did not teleport him, Sarah. Cleo, you saw me cast the spell" Becky snapped.

"Teleport? Spell?"

The girls ignored you. Instead, they started to argue about what to do with you. Sarah seemed to want to report you. Becky wanted to hide you, whereas Cleo seemed to want to hide you in plain sight. None of the other three seemed eager with the other's plans and most of the things you overheard was beyond you, but it seemed the principal was crazy, and wasn't fond of boys.
1431.title: Teleported into trouble

14311.content:
Albeit reluctantly, Becky and Cleo agreed that reporting you would bring them less trouble than if they were to try to keep you hidden or a secret. Sarah summoned a crystal ball to her hand and called out Eliza's name. Presently, the face of a young woman with long brown hair and green eyes appeared in the smokey glass.

"What is it, Sarah?" Patiently, she asked. "I have little time for social calls."

"A boy was accidentally teleported into the school, Miss Eliza." Wincing, Sarah reported. "We're not sure what to do with him."

Eliza sighed, disappointment clear in her expression. "Who performed the teleport?" Sternly, she demanded. "You know thew rules regarding males on campus."

"From what we can gather, the boy found Becky's magic book; which she carelessly dropped." Eying Becky, Sarah explained. "She tried to teleport it to her and somehow managed to bring the boy along with it."

"Show me the boy." Annoyed, Eliza ordered.

Sarah held the crystal ball out in front of you. Eliza took one look at your face and raised a hand to her forehead as if she felt a headache coming on. When Sarah gazed into the crystal ball again, she gulped as Eliza was now nearly screaming.

"Do you three have any idea how much trouble you are in right now?!" Furious, Eliza shouted. "That is the grandson of the head witch! Get him to my office... NOW!"

Sarah jumped, nearly dropping the crystal ball as both Becky and Cleo grabbed one of your arms and half carried, half dragged you out of their dorm room towards Eliza's office.

"I told you we should have tried to hide him." Pouting, Cleo stated.

Sarah frowned. "Aw, shut up!"

Within minutes, you were standing in the office of Eliza, a tall and slender woman with shoulder length brown hair and green eyes. She wore a uniform similar to the three girls only more formal in appearance. She urged to to sit in a chair before speaking.

"It is a miracle that you have not transformed yet." Calmly, she stated. "However, I should expect the grandson of the head witch to have at least some magical resistance."

"What are you talking about?" Confused, you demanded. "Why am I suddenly here? Have I been kidnapped by you people?"

Eliza sighed. "You are not yet aware." Shaking her head, she muttered. She turned to the three girls. "I take it back. You three are not in trouble; you're all magically dead where you stand."

The three girls all gulped as Eliza then picked up a telephone and dialed a number. "Madam head witch, we have a teleport incident involving an unaware individual... your grandson, John."
14311.title: Sarah wins

143111.content:
"Wait? What?" you demanded. None of this made any sense, but one thing was certain; the girls, Becky most of all seemed petrified of the people in charge of the school. Petrified was the right word too; she seemed that the witches would turn you into some kind of statue, or even an apple tree! It wasn't something that inspired confidence, but if your grandmother really was in charge...

Less than a minute later, your grandmother walked in, looking less than happy. "Eliza, take these students back to their dorm. I need to talk to John."

"Elvira, I think..." Eliza started, but Elvira shook her head. she clearly wasn't in the mood to argue. "At once" Eliza said. She immediately pushed the three girls out of the room, who were clearly starting to argue once more. Elvira closed the door, and said, "Take a seat, John."

"I need to know what is happening" you said.

Elvira sighed. "As you have guessed, I have paranormal abilities, and those girls have foolishly teleported you into the middle of Witchbloom Girls school."

"I can see that. Those uniforms must be one of your private jokes. Cute. What I don't understand is those girls seemed terrified. Why?" you asked.

"Eliza runs the day to day operation of the school, and she is very protective of or students. You're smart enough to guess why. If those girls had foolishly tried to hide you and you was caught, Eliza would likely assume that you had snuck onto campus, and may react without thinking. She might also use you as a lesson; punishing you for 'your' transgression whilst trying to teach. Still, I suspect you could have remained hidden for longer than expected, but eventually you would have been caught."

"I see.... you're not going to do that, are you?" you asked, suddenly nervous.

"Luckily, no. However, we have another problem."

"Problem?" you squeaked.

"All trespassers must be enrolled. Considering your background, its a miracle that you haven't already changed" Elvira said.

"But I haven't trespassed. I didn't climb the fence, or gone through the gate" you protested.

"True, but the magic doesn't know that"
143111.title: The arrival

choices: you reluctantly wear the full uniform
you refuse to wear anything, and try to escape
1431111.content:
"So you're saying that I'm going to be enrolled in a girls school full of magic girls even though I'm here due to incompetence? Do you have any idea what they're going to do to me, unless....." you said, trailing off as the full implications hit you.

"I'm sorry, John. The fact that you realize how bad your situation is shows how smart and adaptable you are" Elvira said.

"But I don't want to be either turned into a girl, or go around normal, which would be the same thing" you protested.

Elvira's eyes wavered for half a second. "I know this is not the thing that you want, but we have to deal with the changes to us as they happen. Trust me, there are some of your fellow students that got it worse than you. People playing with 'joke' potions. Mothers that wanted a daughter.... John, here is your uniform."

You looked at the uniform that was in Elvira's hands and instantly felt sick. It was, as you guessed the girl's uniform. "I can not wear that."

"You can and you will. It is the uniform, and all students must wear it."

"But..."

"None of the other students will say anything, especially if you don't end up changing, or at least initially. it'll mean your resistances are extreme, and no witch with a brain would want to mess with you. If you do change, it just means you blend in. I suspect that is another reason why our trio wanted you to hang around. They probably thought you was 15 or 16."

"Great" you said dryly, though you wondered if you could make a dash for the gate. Surely you had a chance. Elvira however looked unimpressed. "Don't even think about it, John. I've seen that look before. Eliza would have you sprouting roots and branches before you can even see the gate. No, put on the uniform, and meet me outside this office in five minutes."

"Grandma, I ..."

"Just do it, before I am forced to take matters into my own hands, and I have to force you into that uniform. Try to take things seriously, John. What you do will affect what happens. See you when you're suitably attired." With that, Elvira disappeared, leaving you holding a girls' uniform. You looked down at it distastefully. Apart from the animesque skirt and blouse, you also had knee socks, maryjanes, and girls' underwear.
"What? No way?" you growled, looking at the bra. It was pink and even bigger than Hayley's.
1431111.title: One sided debate

choices: Elvira talks to the three witches.
14311111.content:
There was no way you wanted to wear any part of the uniform but Elvira's words about sprouting roots and branches haunted you. Teary eyed, you reluctantly put on the uniform and quivered as you felt your body quickly changing to suit it. None of what was happening to you was fair; in fact you found it very cruel and unusual. Once you had finished getting dressed into the uniform, you were aware that you were completely female. Sighing, you quietly walked out of the office, not bothering to wipe off your tear stained face. Elvira was in the hall, waiting with another young woman. She was about Elvira's height, slender but fit with long auburn hair and green eyes.

"Lucy, this is my grandson, currently now my granddaughter." Politely, Elvira said. "She will be attending your class this year."

"How exactly did she come across this school?" Curious, Lucy asked.

"A botched teleportation spell." Frowning, Elvira replied. "Unfortunately, the girls who botched the spell waited too long to decide on any action."

"I see..." Wincing, Lucy said. She turned to you, smiling kindly. "I am Lucy Connor, Miss Harrison. I taught your sister, Hayley."

You frowned. "Just keep those idiots who did this away from me." Gruffly, you demanded. "Unless of course, you want a major cat fight on your hands." You then threw Elvira dirty look, causing her to sigh.

"Please take Lu to your class." Calmly, she said. "With a little luck, she will change back upon returning home at the end of the year."

Lucy nodded and escorted you away as Elvira walked into an office to speak with Eliza. "I take it your granddaughter will be as defiant as the other transformed boys." Flatly, she said.

Elvira sighed, shaking her head. "It's to be expected." Softly, she said. "Lu did not ask to come here, she was brought against her will." She frowned. "Be on your toes with her, Eliza; as far as she is concerned we already have two strikes against us. One, holding her against her will and two, transforming him into a girl."

"What do you suggest?" Worried, Eliza demanded.

"Still waters run deep." Darkly, Elvira replied. "Lu may seem outwardly calm but inside, there is a storm brewing..." She frowned deeply as if to give a warning. "Don't push her too much; just let her take the classes and graduate at the end of the school year."

Eliza sighed but nodded. She had made it a policy to push hard on the transformed boys to show them that magic, although it had caused their plight, was not a tool for revenge or even some pay back. There were other ways for boys to even the playing field.

"I'll try not rub her the wrong way." Flatly, she said.

Elvira nodded. "See to it that you don't."
14311111.title: Still waters run deep.

143111113.content:
Elvira entered her office just as her phone began to ring and picked up on the third ring, knowing who was on the other line. "Hello, Hayley." Dryly, she said. "You need not fret over your missing brother, dear. He, or rather, she is here at Witchbloom."

"How did he, err, she end up there?!" Stunned, Hayley demanded.

"That is what I am trying to piece together." Serious, Elvira replied. "Has John touched a magic book recently, say in the last twenty four hours?"

"I caught him holding a magic book in the kitchen earlier today." Worry in her voice, Hayley said. "He never opened it; I managed to get it away from him in time."

"How did he come across it?" Calmly, Elvira asked.

"I'm not certain." Honestly, Hayley replied. "I never asked him."

Elvira sighed. "One of the sixteen year old teacher's aids lost her magic book and attempted to teleport it back to her while here at Witchbloom." Serious, she said. "Unfortunately, because so little time had passed between then and when John had touched the book the first time..."

Hayley moaned. "The magic in the book detected an interest and he was teleported along with it to its owner, the teenage witch at Witchbloom." Wearily, she finished. "Did they decide to keep him there then?"

"The three witches argued over what to do with him rather than teleport him back." Frowning, Elvira replied. "Although they are not entirely to blame, 'Lucy' seems to be holding a grudge due to her situation."

"You named her after my teacher?" Surprised, Hayley asked. She sighed. "Do you want me to try to talk to her?"

"No; I need you to keep everyone but your mother unaware as to where Lucy is." Serious, Elvira replied. "She will have enough trouble this year without any distractions from home or some boy thinking he is going to play the role of hero."

Hayley giggled slightly, imagining Harry trying to rescue her brother, now sister from Witchbloom all girls boarding school. "I'll do my best, madam head witch." Honestly, she said. "Call me if anything changes, okay?"

"Of course, dear." Kindly, Elvira said.

After ending the call, Elvira sighed, drumming her fingers onto her desk. "This is going to be an interesting school year."
143111113.title: Hayley learns where you are.

choices: the girls try awkwardly to make you comfortable
1431111133.content:
"Where are we going?' you demanded, as you saw that Ms Conners was leading you back towards the dorms.

"Change of plan. All students have to have the opportunity to acclimatize to their new surroundings, especially students such as yourself. Elvira kind of forgot that, and it is extremely unfair of us to go and say 'go to class' and pretend that nothing is wrong. You're old enough to know there are differences between boys and girls.

"Where are you going with this?' you said awkwardly, your cheeks red.

"Relax. What I meant was that you know that your posture is different. Your balance is different. You have hair. By going to the dorms, it gives you a chance to get used to your new form, and dare I say it, check it out" Lucy said.

Your checks went even redder. "What!?!"

"Most students, and you're clearly one of them, find things more than a little awkward after such a transformation. We try to help by magically dampening any awkward feelings, unless of course, we really want to hurt someone, like bad people. Still, that is a discussion for another day. Here is your dorm" Lucy said, revealing a small dorm consisting of four beds. You looked deeper inside, and saw the other students. It was Becky, Cleo and Sarah.

"Miss Lucy, who is the new girl?" Sarah asked, as her eyes went wide. She didn't need your suddenly furious face to tell them who you were.

"I think you already know" Ms Conners said, as you took a few steps towards the witches. You wanted payback.

"But why is she here?" Becky asked. "We all know miss Harrison is planning to kill us! Just look at her eyes."

"I want answers' you hissed as you felt something grab you by your legs, preventing you from moving. "Hey!"

"Calm down. I'm just immobilizing you" Sarah said, but she was staring at Ms Conners as if she was searching for approval. Cleo however, rolled her eyes.

"Stop trying to be the teacher's pet. If you had gone with my solution..."

"Your solution was idiotic" Sarah snapped. "She is too strong. I can't hold her forever."

"Why are they here?" you demanded at Ms Conners as you felt the magical bonds weaken. "To get my anger out of my system?"

"Partly, but you will be staying with them, Lucy Harrison. I would consider it a favor if you try not to kill them" Ms Conners said, leaving you with three quarrelling, slightly nervous witches
1431111133.title: Inadvertant confrontation

choices: summoned a test flame and freaked.
demanded to be put in a class.
14311111332.content:
"Well, I guess you will be joining us, helping young witches learn magic." Wearily, Sarah said.

"How do you propose she will be doing that, Sarah?" Annoyed, Cleo demanded. "She has no training what so ever! I doubt she even knows how to summon a test flame!"

"We'll have to teach her then." Sighing, Becky said. "We have a few days before classes start so between the three of us, we can give her a crash course in magic."

"That is assuming she wants to learn." Eying you, Sarah countered. "It normally takes weeks just to master the basics. It takes months to grasp the advanced stuff and that's if the student is willing to learn it."

"Wait a minute!" Annoyed, you yelled. "You three aren't students?!"

"We graduated three years ago." Serious, Sarah explained. "We are working as teacher's aids as part of a program to become full time teachers when we reach adulthood."

"I feel sorry for the kids." Grumbling, you whispered.

"Look, what happened to you was an accident." Irritated, Becky said. "I wanted to teleport you back but I had no idea where I had dropped the book."

"We could have teleported you just outside of the school property but that would have left you waking up in a strange neighborhood." Serious, Cleo added. "We couldn't do that. That's why I voted to hide you until we could form a workable plan."

"We panicked; that simple." Flatly, Sarah said. "That lead to the argument you woke up to. Feel fortunate that I won my argument and reported your presence." She sighed. "Look, I know you hate us right now but what is done is done. You are part of the teacher's aid program now."

"Elvira said you were all students." Defiant, you countered.

"We are, in a way." Softly, Cleo replied. "We are learning to be teachers."

"That said, I'm guessing you are our first crash course student." Shaking her head, Sarah said. "The only question is, are you willing to learn?"

Unknown to you or the girls, Ms Lucy Connors was watching through a crystal ball with Elvira at her side, with a bemused smile. "So you are saying that putting Lu in there with them is a punishment and a test?" Curious, Lucy asked.

Elvira nodded. "Having to work with an angered transformed boy is their punishment; Having to work with an untrained teenage witch is their test." Serious, Elvira said. "The contract the girls sighed states that if one fails, they all fail. They must get Lu to help them succeed if they want to be teachers next year."

"What about Lu?" Wincing, Lucy demanded.

Elvira sighed. "Lu's test reflects upon her actions." Somewhat sadly, she replied. "The more defiant she is, the less chance she will have of becoming a boy again after graduation."

"That's a bit harsh, madam head witch." Wincing, Lucy pointed out.

"I know it seems cruel." Softly, Elvira said. "Lu did not ask to be here. However, I know her to be a very intelligent and resourceful child; she has a chance if she can keep a level head."

Inside the teacher's aid dorm room, you...
14311111332.title: A tense situation.

143111113322.content:
...saw a large flame coming out of your right hand. Instantly, you screamed.

"Oh my God.... Help!" you gasped, on the verge of hyperventilating.

"Calm down" Cleo urged.

"My hand is on fire!" you wailed.

"Its a sign of your power. All witches undergo it" Sarah said. She stared at your flame and turned to Becky and Cleo. In an almost contemptuous voice, she said, "Her powers are strong, and you thought you could have hidden her?"

"Not this again" Becky snapped, as she moved next to your terrified figure and folded your fingers back. immediately, the flame extinguished itself. Fearfully, you watched her unfold your hand..

"Don't" you protested, but Becky had already flattened your hand, which remained normal and flame-free.

"What is going on? I need answers" you said shakily.

"Congratulations. You're a witch, Lucy" Sarah said.

"What?!" you said, freaking out again.

Becky glared at Sarah. "What she is trying to say is it is a sign of power. All witches can produce a flame. For it to reappear, you just have to will it."

"Okay" you said quietly. You had no intention of producing it again, but Sarah's crass mannerisms caused Cleo to start arguing again.

"Nice way of handling things, Sarah" Cleo said sarcastically.

"I'm not going to sugar coat things. What is going to happen when she starts experiencing life as the teenaged girl she appears?

Overhearing this, you gulped, uncomfortable with where this was going. Of course, you knew of some of the things, but you didn't expect any of it to happen to you.

"See how uncomfortable you're making Lucy. If you allowed me to follow my plan of hiding her.." Cleo snapped back.

"Which would have failed. Lucy's magic is too strong for you to have disguised or for Becky to hide under her bed. What matters now, is that Lucy is a girl, and we need to make feel comfortable" Sarah said bluntly, earning her two snorts from the others, who appreciated the irony. Ignoring you and the others, Sarah watched over to her vanity, and picked up her make-up box. :Least you make a pretty 15 year old girl, Lucy..." She said.
143111113322.title: A sign of power causes a freakout

choices: You freak out, sensing a trap.
Lucy enters, thinks there was a fight.
1431111133221.content:
"What's with the makeup?" Taking a step back, you demanded.

"All teacher's aides must look presentable; its the rules." Calmly, Sarah replied. "Right now, you are a mess and need to learn how all this works."She sighed. "None of us are going to have time to help you in the morning."

"Like it or not, you are a part of our group." Flatly, Becky added. "All girls go through this routine every morning to get ready to face the day."

"I thought I was going to learn magic." Pouting, you protested. "I don't see how this is going to teach me anything other than get used to being a girl."

"The more comfortable you are, the less chance the students have to smell your fear." Serious, Cleo said. "We need to learn how to control a classroom filled with girls who are able to use magic; confidence is a powerful tool."

"Enough with the pep talk." Frowning, Sarah said. "Let's get this makeup lesson over so we can move on; we don't have enough time to mess around here."

That said, she opened up her makeup box whil;e Becky and Cleo held you down, just in case...
1431111133221.title: continue

14311111332211.content:
Annoyed and frustrated, you held still while Sarah began to apply a foundation to your face, making it all one color tone. "I'm certain you had seen your sisters apply makeup to their faces and come out looking like little runway models." Serious, she said. "However, that is not the idea behind makeup, not at all."

"What do you mean?" Confused, you demanded.

Sarah smiled. "The idea behind the serious use of makeup is to highlight your features in a way so it looks like you are not wearing any makeup at all." Bemused, she explained. "The idea is to look more attractive but at the same time, look natural."

"I guess that makes sense." Wincing, you said.

"Too much makeup not only can make you look like a fool but it can also damage the skin, eventually making you look far older than you truly are." Calmly, Sarah continued. "Too little makeup and it becomes obvious that you are wearing it or have no idea how to use it."

"So its an art." Trying to understand, you said.

Sarah nodded. "Exactly."

Within five minutes, Sarah announced she was finished and held up a mirror for you to see. "What did you do?" Confused, you asked. "I mean there is a certain glow to my face but I don't see anything majorly different other than that."

Cleo giggled as she and Becky released you. "That's the point." Smiling, Cleo said. "Naturally beautiful with just the right amount of makeup."

"We women just make it look easy." Winking, Becky added.

"Ha- Ha." Unimpressed, you said. "What's next, fashion one o' one?"

"Only if you want to be a girl permanently." Serious, Sarah replied. "As it is, we don't have the time to focus on such things. We need you to be ready to help us mold young magical minds to be responsible witches."

"That's ironic." Folding your arms, you said.

Sarah sighed, rolling her eyes. "Moving on, its time for you to learn how to summon and use your magical power." Patiently, she said. "The reason boys of witch blood cannot use magic is because it builds in the uterus, an organ boys do not possess."

"However, boys are not powerless; far from it." Serious, Becky added. "What they lack in magic, they make up for in heightened attributes as well as acute senses."

"Then why was i not trained in that before this?" Frowning, you demanded.

"You likely were; just not in a way you would notice." Serious. "No offense but boys mature more slowly than girls so their introduction to magic is usually done a year later when their heightened attributes become all too obvious."

"Enough." Bluntly, Sarah said. "We can cover all of this later." She turned to you. "There is a lot to cover and very little time. Please close your eyes and find your center..."

While Sarah, Cleo and Becky continued your crash course in magic...
14311111332211.title: You hold still.

143111113322114.content:
At home, mom sighed upon hearing where you were and what had happened. "It would seem that fate had decided to smile upon us." Looking relieved, she said.

"You don't seem worried that John, or rather, Lucy is at Witchbloom, mom." Worried, Hayley said. "Care to explain?"

"I have been magically holding back John's attributes as well as his senses." To Hayley's shock, mom explained. "Due to his twin connection to Mel, he is unusually powerful for his age; I was planning to send him to Witchbloom the second they opened enrollment."

"To teach 'her' how to control her magic powers?" Frowning, Hayley asked.

"As well as to teach 'him' how to control his powers as a boy." Serious, mom countered. "The only question now is which will your sibling like more, magic or might."

"I'm more worried what will happen to those three witches if Lucy ever gets a hold of them." Softly, Hayley said. "She has a lot of patience but once it runs out..."

"That is exactly why I am pleased she is over there." Serious, mom said. "Even if Lucy somehow bumps into the three witches who had caused this, I am certain she is being carefully watched."

Back at Witchbloom...
143111113322114.title: Mom learned where you were.

1431111133221141.content:
Wanting to get through the year quickly and with as little stress as possible, to paid attention to the girl's teachings and learned the spells quickly. This both impressed and frightened the girls as they all knew you were still holding a grudge against them for being stuck there.

"Well that was fast." Hiding her worry, Sarah said. "You've mastered almost all the basics in less than a day; you are a natural at magic, it seems." She forced a smile. "Great job."

You suppressed a yawn. "What's next?" Tiredly, you asked.

"Bed." Yawning, Cleo replied. "Magic is draining and we've been at this for hours."

"We'll pick up where we left off tomorrow after breakfast." Walking towards her bunk, Becky added. "With as fast as you learn, you'll likely be at our level before classes even start."

"What about dinner?" Frowning, you said. "I don't know about you but I'm starving."

"There is a cafeteria just down the hall." Moaning, Cleo said. "Just turn right as you walk out the door, you can't miss it."

You nodded then headed out the door and turned right. You walked down the hall and found the cafeteria just as Cleo said. You looked about and found Elvira sitting at one of the tables. She smiled and waved you over to her. "Out for a walk, are we, Lucy?" Softly, she asked.

"Out for dinner." Frowning, you countered. "I'm hungry. Cleo said I could find a meal here."

Elvira sighed. "I am disappointed that one of them did not walk you down here as they were supposed to." Annoyed, she said. "No new student is allowed to wander the halls alone as too many things could go wrong."

You were about to ask what she meant by that but Elvira quickly changed the subject. "What would you like for dinner? I know you are hungry."

You shrugged. "What's on the menu?"

Elvira chuckled. "How about a nice big chicken salad with some light dressing and a chocolate milk to wash it all down?"

Although you had never eaten a large salad before, it sounded good so you agreed and it was ordered to your table. Minutes later, Elvira got you talking about your magic lessons and seemed both pleased and worried that you had mastered the basics in such a short time."

"I see you are serious about learning magic." Softly, she said. "Tell me, is it to get revenge on the three teacher aides or to keep yourself from going crazy?"

"A little of both, I guess." Frowning, you replied. "I need something to keep my mind off of the rut I'm in because of them." You then gave a half smile. "Success is the greatest revenge; I plan to surpass them then break every record in this school before demanding my male body back."

Elvira's worry turned into bemusement. "That is just the type of revenge I would expect from her." Hiding her grin, she thought. "With the power she yields, she may just pull it off but she will find it a lot harder to give up her magic than she thinks."

After finishing dinner, Elvira escorted you back to your dorm to find Sarah, Cleo, and Becky...
1431111133221141.title: You learn spells quickly.

choices: Cleo and becky blamed you for Sarah's failure.
Other teachers wanted to train you.
14311111332211412.content:
Elvira escorted you back to your dorm to find Sarah, Cleo and Becky arguing again about you only there seemed to be a sense of panic in their voices. Having their backs to the door, they did not notice you or Elvira enter right away. "The kid is a strict amateur and yet she has mastered the basics in less than a day!" Worried, Sarah complained. "If she keeps at this pace, she will surpass us before classes even begin!

"We could show her off as a prize student." Hopeful, Cleo said. "After all, we trained her." She smiled. "That would make us look like top notch teachers."

"I say this is a test from Elvira." Nervous, Becky said. "Send us a seasoned witch disguised as a boy and see how well we train 'her'."

"She would not be learning this fast if it were that kind of test, Becky!" Annoyed, Sarah said. "Use your head!" She sighed, shaking her head before turning to Cleo. "That little rug rat will never play along with your idea; she will make fools out of us all! We need to get rid of her!"

You opened your mouth to gasp but Elvira gripped your shoulder in a silent warning to remain silent as she watched and listened to the three girls talk. "Just how do you propose to get rid of her?" Distraught, Cleo demanded. "She's the grandchild of the head witch!"

Sarah was silent for a moment before replying, "You leave that to me."

"Exactly what did you have planned for my granddaughter, Sarah?" Ice in her voice, Elvira demanded. "Jealousy is not an attractive trait for a witch!"

All three girls spun around, startled and immediately began fumbling for an explanation only Elvira was not hearing it. Sarah vanished from the room, causing both Cleo and Becky to scream in fright. "What did you do to her?!" Frightened, Cleo demanded.

"I sent her home; she will never work here with the type of attitude she demonstrated with my granddaughter." Annoyed, Elvira replied. "As for you two, you are on very thin ice; I suggest you tread lightly from here on out if you want the job you seek!"

With that, Elvira walked out of the room, leaving Cleo and Becky very much shaken. News of Sarah's expulsion and you learning magic at an incredible pace spread like wildfire among the other teachers and teacher aids literally overnight. It was not long before...
14311111332211412.title: Thin ice.

choices: stay with Becky and Cleo for now.
143111113322114123.content:
Later the next day, Elvira giggled to herself hearing your panicked voice in the reception area of her private office. "I suspected this would happen; all well laid out plans can and will go astray." Bemused, she said. "Lucy didn't count on the attention she would get by learning the basics of magic so quickly."

She hid her smile, seeing a young woman lead you into her office. "Grand, err, madam head witch, I have a bit of a problem and I'm not sure what to do." Shaking, you said. "I need your advice."

"Are Becky and Cleo giving you grief?" Patiently, Elvira asked.

"No, its the other teachers and their aides! Distraught, you replied. "They're all asking me to study with them instead of Becky and Cleo! They're telling me how they could help me reach greater heights, find my full potential!" You moaned. "It's really starting to scare me, grandma!"

Elvira smiled. "Of course they are, Lucy." Bemused, she said. "You are a natural at magic; I'd dare even say gifted. Any teacher who has you under their wing would have a lot to brag about." She giggled. "Careful what you wish for, my dear granddaughter."

"What can I do?" Tearfully, you asked.

"Well, Becky and Cleo will not be working here this year as they failed their test; they will only be staying on as teacher's aides." Patiently, Elvira replied. "That leaves you with a choice." You opened your mouth to speak but Elvira was not finished. "The test had started before your arrival, don't worry about it."

"What's my choice?" Nervous, you asked.

Elvira sighed before turning serious. "One, you can either choose a teacher to transfer to and learn magic this year." Calmly, she said. "Two, you can stay with Becky and Cleo until classes begin where you will be learning under Lucy Connors who trained your sisters, Hayley and Mel."

"Can I just transfer to Miss Connors class now?" Wincing, you asked.

"You could." Smiling, Elvira said. "Only you would be doing more than just working magic."

"Like what?" Curious, you asked.

Elvira smiled. "You'll find out if you chose to transfer to her class." Bemused, she said. "It's different for each student who directly requests her."

You sighed, wondering what to do. Finally, you said, "I want to..."
143111113322114123.title: You became frightened by your 'fame'.

choices: lessons with Becky and Cleo continue.
At home, Harry looks for you.
1431111133221141232.content:
Elvira seemed pleased by your response. "You always were one to finish what you start." Kindly, she said. "Even if it was not your choice to start." She giggled. "Cleo and Becky will be pleased to hear this as well."

"Why?" Confused, you asked. "I thought they would be glad to be rid of me."

"Part of their test was to finish the task I put before them." Patiently, Elvira replied. "Sarah failed but she acted on her own so I realized that could not punish all three of them." She sighed. "So long as you grin and bear their teachings until school starts, the two will pass their test."

"Am I being tested as well?" Worried, you asked.

"In a way, yes." To your shock, Elvira replied. "Only your test is of your own making through your decisions and actions." She smiled. "Your test will determine whether you graduate here and go home as John or Lucy."

"Do I get any clues or am I going through this test blind?" Wincing, you demanded.

Elvira giggled. "All of the clues you will need will be in the lessons you will receive through the school year." Kindly, she said. "Every student who comes here is tested and each student's test or tests are different. You are not the only one going through this."

You sighed. "I guess I better get back to my dorm then." Softly, you said. "Thank you for the advice, madam head witch."

"You are welcome, Lucy." Smiling, Elvira said.

With that, a female worker escorted you out of the office. Once you were gone, Elvira smiled. "Lucy Connors will have her hands full with her." Bemused, she said. "More so than she did with Hayley and Melanie; she has a lot of potential."
1431111133221141232.title: stay with Becky and Cleo for now.

choices: At home, Harry looks for you.
The council is concerned by your success.
14311111332211412321.content:
Days later, on the first official day of school, you entered Miss Lucy's classroom with a note from Elvira and a paper in a fancy frame. You felt both proud and worried at the same time as you had learned enough to be considered a fully trained witch in less than a week. Elvira seemed troubled by this and spoke to you privately about it.

"You are the second young witch in our long history to ever reach this level so quickly." Serious, she said. "I know its nothing you want to hear but I highly doubt you would have been a boy much longer had you not found that magic book." She sighed seeing you tear up and added, "If it's any consolation, your mother is very proud of you right now."

"Who was the first witch in our history to reach my level?" Gulping, you asked.

Elvira gave you a rueful smile. "Me."

You gave the note to Miss Lucy who read it before sighing. "Congratulations, Lu." With a bemused smile, she said. "You have graduated from Witchbloom all girls boarding school before classes have even began. Only one other has ever accomplished this."

"Elvira told me." Pouting, you replied. "Only she insists I still stay here for the year to learn more as a tutor and teacher's aide."

Lucy smiled. She had dealt with several transformed boys but you were the first to show such incredible promise as a witch. "She is going to be a greater challenge than Hayley and Melanie combined." Ruefully, she thought. After a moment, she asked, "So, how did it feel knowing you ran circles around the three teacher's aides who accidentally summoned you here?"

You smiled slightly then sighed. "From what Elvira told me, I would have been here even if I never found that magic book." Softly, you said. "Still... it felt good."

Lucy giggled. "There are a lot of teachers here jealous of me as I get the honor of advancing your learning of magic." Smiling, she said. "Don't be surprised if a few invite you to their class to tutor a few of their own students."

You pouted at that. "Great, just what I wanted; more attention."

Lucy smiled before motioning to a number of girls entering the dorm room. "Shall we greet our class, Miss Lu?"
14311111332211412321.title: Rare accomplishment.

choices: Other teachers are curious about you.
Other transformed boys are curious about you.
143111113322114123213.content:
Unknown to you, as you greeted your fellow students as a teacher's aide, Elvira met the witch council for an 'emergency' meeting. Tessa Summers, a tall woman with long black hair and green eyes frowned at a report lying before her on the table. "Madam head witch, your granddaughter is showing incredible progress in learning magic." Serious, she said. "At this rate, she will have the power of an adult witch before her fourteenth birthday." She sighed. "As speaker of the council, I must say that this is dangerous."

Denise Winters, a short and thin woman with blond hair and blue eyes nodded. "I must agree, madam head witch." Firmly, she said. "Although such talent is extremely rare, this is the first time we have seen it in a transformed boy. The odds of 'her' returning to 'his' male state is slim." She frowned. "As head of the secrecy department, I must remind you that his transformation was against his will; as a male in the royal family, if her form becomes locked..."

Sally Fall, an amazon of a woman with short brown hair and brown eyes sighed. "If her form becomes locked, she will become the next head witch." Darkly, she said. "There has not been a transformed boy as head with in over a thousand years." She shook her head. "Madam head witch, as head of the rogue hunters, witch police, I urge you to let Lucy walk away from Witchbloom as a fully trained witch now, it will increase her odds of being a boy again."

Vicky Spring, a tall slender woman with red hair and hazel eyes moaned slightly. "Even as a boy, the child poses a problem." Serious, she said. "He has the potential of becoming just as physically powerful as his grandfather, Dr Moriarty Strange." She winced, turning to Elvira. "Madam head witch, as head of witch boy affairs, I urge you to consider locking away at least some of your grandchild's power before she, or he becomes to strong to control."

"Your panic is premature, ladies." serious, Elvira said. "Lucy Harrison learned magic quickly to be rid of the teacher's aides who had brought about her situation as a student at Witchbloom. As of now, she too is concerned by her success and wishes nothing more than to return home."

"Then why are you insisting she stay?" Curious, Sally asked.

"Lucy is highly gifted in magic but she is still only a thirteen year old girl." Firmly, Elvira replied. "She will face many of the same challenges I did growing up only she will have it worse, having the mind of a boy." She sighed. "I would rather her stay for the year to gain the maturity she needs to use her power wisely."

"What shall we do if she decides to return to his male state?" Wincing, Vicky asked.

Elvira frowned. "We shall deal with that when or if it occurs." Serious, she said. "For now, Lucy Harrison stays at Witchbloom all girls boarding school for her own well being."

At Witchbloom...
143111113322114123213.title: The council is concerned by your success.

1431111133221141232131.content:
Inside your classroom, Lucy hung your diploma on the wall next to her own and turned to greet her class with you standing nervously at her side. "Welcome to Witchbloom all girls boarding school, girls." Kindly, she said. "I am Lucy Connors and this is my teacher's aide, Lucy Harrison; you may call her Lu."

"It- It's an honor to meet you all." Nervous, you said.

The girls looked at you curiously but Lucy spoke up before things got too uncomfortable. "Lu is like all of you; this is her first year at Witchbloom too only she is a gifted student." She smiled, a hint of pride on her face. "Lu graduated in only seven days and is now a teacher's aide."

Gasps and whispers erupted from the small class until Lucy called for silence. "Speed reading and a photographic memory helps." Blushing, you said. "Other than that, I'm not any more special than any of you; I still have a lot to learn."

"That is very true, Lu." Serious, Lucy said. "When all of you graduate, you will be considered fully trained witches but there is far more to learn as those with older sisters will tell you." She smiled. "Please, introduce yourselves and tell us a little about you."

The first girl, a skinny tanned girl with brown hair and brown eyes stood up. "I am Emma Walker. I come from a long line of healer witches and hope to make my family proud."

The students applauded as the second girl stood up. She was short and plump with red hair and green eyes. "My- My name is Danielle Wild; you can call me Dani. I got teased a lot about my height and weight until one day, I- I made something happen." She shifted uncomfortably on her feet then added, "I am what they call a first witch or the first witch in my family history."

She held back a sob and you stepped forward, giving her a hug. "Those who teased you are not real friends, Dani." Firmly but kindly, you said. "Real friends see you as the wonderful person you are and I can assure you that you are among friends."

Dani looked at you, surprised then turned to the other girls who smiled and nodded. She then gave you a grateful smile. "Thank you."

"Well said, Lu." Smiling, Lucy said as you returned to her side.

The students applauded as the next girl stood up. She was a few inches shorter than Dani with doll like features, long black hair and blue eyes. "I am Raven Hawk." Shyly, she said. "I come from a long line of rogue hunters; they are the witching world's version of the police." She sighed. "I do not know if I will qualify as one but I am willing to try my best."

"That is all anyone can ask, Raven." Kindly, Lucy said. "There are many aspects of the rogue hunter police force such as councilors who help witches and witch boys deal with trauma."

Raven smiled. "I had not thought of that." Softly, she said. "Thank you."

The class applauded as the next girl, stood up. She was of average height with long blond hair and blue eyes which seemed to be at the verge of tears. "I am Jacinta Bowers." Tearfully, she said. "I was known as Jack until a rogue permanently changed my gender. Mom sent me here to learn magic along with my sister, Paul, now Paula."

The girl, Paula stood up next to her sister. She was the same height with long brown hair and brown eyes. She too was teary eyed. "My sister and I woke up to screaming and saw a woman attacking our mom." Near tears, she explained. "We jumped in and kicked her rear to the curb." She then sobbed slightly, adding, "Only not before she hit us both with a spell, turning us into girls for life. We're stuck like this and stuck here for the year."

Lu smiled kindly. "Jacinta, Paula... you are both confusing pride for punishment." Firmly but kindly, she said. "You both took on an adult witch as boys and managed to win; that alone I assure you is an incredible feat."

"All witches must learn to control their powers either here or at home." Reciting one of your lessons, you said. "However, it is considered a great honor to a mother to send her son to witch school; not all transformed boys get this opportunity."

"Your mother is very proud of you both, I promise you that." Smiling, Lucy added.

Both Jacinta and Paula smiled as the class applauded. The last girl, tall and muscular with short black hair and green eyes stood up. "I am Rachel Mathews." Firmly but kindly, she said. "I too come from a long line of rogue hunters. I have already been accepted into rogue hunter academy after I graduate here."

Again the class applauded as Lucy turned to you. "It's your turn, Lu."

The class turned to you as you cleared your throat. "I am Lucy Harrison." Nervously, you said. "Like Jacinta and Paula, I am a transformed boy only I have never had to fight a witch." You blushed terribly as you told your tale of how you ended up a student then a teacher's aide. When you were finished, Dani winced, saying, "That doesn't seem fair."

"Lu would have become a girl and a witch with impressive power even if 'he' had not found the magic book." Firmly, Lucy said. "Only one other witch had reached her level in such a short time in our long history but she is the first transformed boy to manage this feat. I can assure you that her mother and sisters are very proud of her."

"Who was the first?" Curiously, Emma asked.

Lucy smiled. "Her grandmother, the head witch, Elvira Strange."
1431111133221141232131.title: You meet your students.

choices: Frist class: counseling a transformed boy.
14311111332211412321314.content:
"That is insane." Smiling, Emma said. "Will she become the next head witch, then?"

You blushed at that as Lucy replied, "Elvira Strange will pick the next head witch just as the last one picked her. Sometimes it is someone within the family and sometimes it is not." She smiled, adding, "It could be any one of you, including a first witch."

Dani blushed then asked, "will Lucy be learning with us of helping you teach?"

"She will be doing a little of both." Kindly, Lucy replied. "She will be helping me teach all of you the basics while learning some of the advanced magics." She raised a finger in warning. "Do not try anything advanced without my supervision; any of you. Anything could go wrong."

A soft knock on the door moved Lucy and you to turn to find Elvira entering the room with a familiar looking girl. "I am sorry to interrupt, Lucy." Kindly, she said. "However, we have a late arrival and I feel she would benefit from your class."

"Of course, Elvira." Smiling, Lucy said. "We had just finished introducing ourselves. Perhaps the young lady would like to introduce herself as well."

Elvira gently urged the girl forward. She was about your height and build with rosewood hair and green eyes. "I was named Harry Rich." Blushing, she said. "Now, I'm being called Bethany..."

You hurried over to Bethany, looking stunned then turned to Elvira, your eyes demanding an explanation. "What happened?" Whispering, you asked.

"Bethany's parents are immune to magic." Calmly, Elvira explained to the class. "They had absorbed massive amounts and, eventually, that magic required an outlet." She motioned to Bethany. "That outlet became Bethany Rich; a rather powerful first witch of the Rich family clan."

You gave Bethany a warm hug. "Welcome to the class." Kindly, you said.

Bethany sighed, as you did your first day and took her seat, grumbling under her breath. Elvira merely shook her head. "Like Lucy, Bethany is not taking to her new situation very well." Kindly, she said. "Please show her a little patience."

Lucy smiled, giving a nod and classes resumed.
14311111332211412321314.title: Another student joins the class.

143111113322114123213142.content:
"The first lesson we will cover this year is how to council a transformed boy." Kindly, Lucy said. "Miss Lu was not given the best of counseling when she was brought here against her will. That said, it is a miracle her teachers did not walk away with worse than a reprimand from the head witch."

The students turned to you, surprised then turned to Bethany who blushed brightly before beginning to sob. Only she was surprised when Dani took her hand. "I'm a first witch too." Smiling slightly, she said. "Maybe we can help each other."

"My sister and I kicked a rogue to the curb before being transformed into girls." Stepping up to Bethany, Jacinta said. "You are not the only transformed boy here."

"I'm willing to bet you were impressively strong as a boy." Grinning, Emma said. "Convert that strength into magic in your head and you'll have a good idea how powerful you are as a witch."

"You are still the person you were as a boy." Kindly, Raven said. "The only thing that really changed is how you will see the world and how the world will see you."

Bethany turned from one girl to the other, blushing profusely. "I still have the mind of a teenage boy." Softly, she said.

"Which means you are not 'gone' as you might fear." Serious, you said. "You and I, Jacinta and Paula all remember our lives as boys."

"Your lives are not over... ladies." Smiling, Lucy said. "You are just entering a new chapter of your life with your memories and core beliefs intact." She motioned to the true girls in the room. "Let us help you all enter that new chapter on the right foot."

You exchanged looks with Bethany and the Bowers sisters before smiling slightly. "I got a bad feeling about this..." Whispering, Bethany said.

You sighed. "So did I when this part came up." Softly, you said. "Trust me though, its better to just get it over with."

What was Lucy talking about?
143111113322114123213142.title: Frist class: counseling a transformed boy.

1431111133221141232131421.content:
Bethany's eyes went wide upon seeing Lucy hold up a large make up kit. Both Jacinta and Paula took a step back, wondering if they should run. You smiled slightly as the transformed boys, although unnerved, did not try to run. "Think about this... ladies." Kindly, you said. "Do you seriously think real girls put this stuff onto themselves if it was uncomfortable or made them stand out like a sore thumb?"

Jacinta and Paula turned to each other uncertain. "How does make up help us with learning magic?" Softly, Paula demanded.

"Strong emotions augment magic." Serious, you replied. "That includes negative emotions such as self doubt and low self esteem." You then smiled. "You would be surprised what a little make up and the right clothes will do to turn those negative emotions into positive ones."

"When it comes to make up, less is more." Smiling, Lucy said. "Now, will any of you young ladies care to step forward to demonstrate this?"

"I- I'll volunteer." Shyly, Dani said. "I think I could use more good self esteem."

"You are beautiful with or without makeup, Dani." Kindly, you said.

Dani blushed at that and sat in the chair before Lucy got to work. "The first thing you need to do is build a foundation." Smiling, she said. She summoned a vanity in front of Dani and handed her the foundation sponge. "Light swirls, cover everything evenly with a very thin coat."

"You are making me do this?" Surprised, Dani asked.

You smiled. "The best way to learn is first hand." Calmly, you said. "Don't worry, Miss Lucy and I will walk you though it."

Once the makeover was done, Dani looked at herself in surprise. Her face had a gentle glow of its own with light colors accenting every contour of her face. She was breathtakingly radiant. "Is- is that me...?"

"That is you." Smiling, Lucy said. "What do you think?"

Dani smiled. "I love it."

Lucy returned Dani's smile then turned to the class. "Who is next?"
1431111133221141232131421.title: Makeovers.

choices: You can talk to Lucy and I about anything.
