Hayley seized your hand and dragged you back into your room. "I know what you're doing. It's understandable, but it doesn't change the reality that you're now my cute little sister. I know, you're still you, and you're going to be still you even if we dress you up in the puffiest princess dress we could find..."

"You're not going to do that!" you gasped.

"No. Too dangerous, though Mel might for making her 'look bad'. Not too sure which she would go for, maximum awkwardness, or one that makes you prettier."

"Enough. Answers" you snapped.

"Mom would have a fit if she saw you in that. She would say its not only unladylike, she would mutter something about looking after your body, sis" Hayley said.

"I told you, stop..."

"And I'm not listening. If you want answers, Lucy, put this on" Hayley said, half giggling, as she tossed to you not only the pink panties set you rejected, but a similar pink strapless bra, a pink skirt and a tube top that would show a lot of your midriff and of your breasts.

"Blackmail" you growled.

"You want answers, Lu. I want to see Mel's shocked and outraged face. I suggest you do before mom takes things into her own hands" Hayley shrugged.
1442221233.title: your own missfitting clothes.

14422212332.content:
Hayley looked at you shocked as you threw the clothes at her face but sighed when you said, "You warn me about squabbling witches and you want to start a fight with Mel... and me!? Not very smart, sis!"

"Okay, okay... you have a valid point." Calmly, Hayley said. "Still, you can't deny that the clothing you are wearing is uncomfortable. It will drive you crazy before you know it."

"It's driving me crazy now." Under your breath, you muttered.

Hayley smiled. "The bra gives your 'girls' support so they will not feel as heavy on your chest." Holding up the bra, she said. "Also, the panties are made to accommodate a lady's more sensitive skin."

You rolled your eyes. "Fine."

You moved to change out of the boys clothing you were wearing only Hayley snapped her fingers and you were instantly wearing only the strapless bra and panties. You screamed in surprise before throwing your sister an impatient look, which she ignored.

"We don't have all day, sis." Bemused, Hayley said. "At least wear the dark blue skirt and pick out a blouse you can live with from what I brought you."

Although you were fuming at your situation, you picked out a blouse that looked the least feminine, a baby blue short sleeve, and put it on. Only when you looked in the mirror, you found that your own choice accented your bust and curves very well due to it being a but snug. At least it was comfortable. "Perfect..." Sarcastically, you muttered. "I look like a runway model."

Hayley giggled. "You have good taste." Teasing, she said. "Mel is going to flip..."

You growled, "Hayley...!" Causing her to sigh again.

"Don't have a fit, sis." Lightly scolding, she said. "You won't like what it will bring you." She then smiled again and motioned to your bedroom door. "Mom and the rest of the family are waiting for us downstairs; we'll have a talk about what happened to you over some tea."

Albeit reluctantly, you followed Hayley out of the room and downstairs to your awaiting family...
14422212332.title: You win your argument but still lose.

144222123321.content:
Mom and your remaining sisters were waiting for you at the base of the stairs. As soon as Mel saw you, her eyes boggled slightly before she whined to mom.

"Mom, like why is she looking like that?" Mel complained as she took a firm look at you. Hayley was right; Mel was, for some reason. extremely jealous of you, which was annoying. Shuddering, you imagined her reaction if you had worn the pink, more revealing clothes Hayley had tried to get you to wear.

Mom intervened. "Melanie. We talked about this. Your sister hasn't magically enhanced herself or anything like that. That is what Lucy looks like" mom snapped.

"But.... Look at her..." Mel complained, but you was beyond listening to her pathetic, jealous rants. Instead, you focused on mom and said coldly, "You've been talking about me behind my back? For how long?"

"I had to, Lucy" mom said.

"Please don't...."

"I won't Lucy. Sorry to be harsh, but you're now Lucy, and you're now as much as a girl as any of us" mom said to your horrified figure as the full implications started to set in. "I kept magic from you for several reasons. Firstly, Hannah" mom said, turning to your youngest, pouting sister. You wondered what she was angry about. It wasn't like she had her whole life tipped upside down, and told you're still you, except with different clothes.

"I'm not too young, mommy" Hannah protested.

"Yes, you are. Even if you can use magic, you cannot use it safely, or understand it. Plus, the strain it puts on you is more than you imagine. You'd be asleep most of the day. Don't pout sweetie; If Lucy had turned into a little girl, I would forbid her for the same reasons."

"But its not fair!" Hannah whined.

Mom ignored her. Turning to Mel, she said, "You are not ready either."

"What? I totally am" Mel complained.

"You're reckless. Plus, your first reaction to your sister is jealousy, as if you thought magic gave her a more feminine body than you. It didn't. If you had changed Lucy instead of her naturally changing on her own, she would look exactly the same. The only reason either of you know is that it isn't easy to hide Lucy...."

"Mom!" you snapped, hating how they're talking about this change right in front of you, like if it wasn't a big deal.
144222123321.title: Mel's reaction.

1442221233212.content:
Mom rolled her eyes, giving a sigh before pulling you to her private study and closing the door. "I know you don't like this and that it comes to you as quite a shock." Almost scolding, she said. "However, magic is real and you are a real part of a family of witches."

"Then why can't you change me back?" Pouting, you demanded.

"There was a magical barrier that was keeping you male." Patiently, mom explained. "Remember all of those colds you were getting out of the blue?" You nodded and mom continued. "Those were the result of your magic pounding against that barrier. It's a rare warning sign; so rare, we did not realize it until that barrier began to fail."

You teared up, still pouting. "I'm guessing that barrier can't be built back up."

Mom shook her head. "Magic is very strong in our family." Serious, she said. "It would be in your best interest if you adapt to your new gender and learn magic." She managed a slight smile. "I would have preferred to have a son just as you would prefer to stay a boy but I more prefer you to be alive and well."

You managed a weak smile back. "Good point."

Mom giggled. "It's going to take time to get used to things." Calmly, she said. "We didn't treat it as a big deal because we knew about magic a littler longer than you."

"Why am I the last to know about it?" Pouting again, you asked.

Mom grinned. "Male puberty."

You gave a half grin. "Ha Ha."

"I'm serious." Calmly, mom said. "Witch boys are blessed physically; they have attributes upon hitting puberty that would amaze you." She smiled. "However, you are a girl now and i can promise you that girls have powers that will amaze you too. Just do me one small favor."

"What's that?" Curious, you asked.

Mom sighed. "Please don't fight this. There is nothing we can do to change you back so just let us help you adapt and move on."

You moaned then sighed before replying, "I'll try."

Twenty minutes later...
1442221233212.title: mom talks to you

14422212332122.content:
Twenty minutes later, Hayley dragged you into the mall and led you to the teen girl's clothing department where she pointed out the various styles in women's wear.

"Tell me again why we are shopping for clothes again." Pouting, you demanded.

Hayley giggled. "Well, we could have changed your old clothing into girls' fashions." Bemused, she said. "Only you would not have had any say in the styles you got."

You sighed, looking at the many different styles in girl's clothing. "What makes you think I have any idea what style I want?"

"That's why I'm here." Calmly, Hayley replied. "The clothing you buy for yourself says a lot about your personality; more than you might realize." She paused, thinking. "I'd say that you are a 'tough princess' type of girl who is somewhere between Hannah and Mel."

"What?!" Taken back, you asked. "Are you nuts?! I'm nothing like them!"

Hayley laughed. "Hannah loves ballet while you enjoy Tia Chi, both a type of dance if you really think about it." Calmly, she said. "Mel is a bit of an airhead but she has her tomboy side while you are a tough kid but you are kind to a fault."

"What does this all have to do with fashion?" Annoyed, you asked.

Hayley smiled, motioning to a mannequin wearing a dark pink skirt and white blouse. "This alone would not suit you; it requires an accessory." Smiling, she explained. "Tell me what you think and remember, you are not a boy anymore, you're a teenage girl."

You watched as Hayley took a denim jacket and put it over the blouse before placing a pair of women's boots at the base. You did not know why but you could actually see yourself in the outfit without feeling uncomfortable. "I suppose that's one outfit I could see myself in." Blushing, you admitted. "How did you know I wouldn't outright reject it?"

Hayley giggled. "Two reasons." Amused, she said. "One, I took a transformed boys fashion class at witch school and second, I know you all too well, dear sister."

"Do you now?" Unimpressed, you asked.

Hayley nodded, still amused by your half hearted defiance. "You will not take any major change lying down unless you have a good amount of control over the change." Calmly, she said. "I'm not telling you what to wear or buy, I'm just showing you what I know you will like."

You rolled your eyes to Hayley's further giggles then continued shopping with her pointing out various accessories to make the outfits more palatable to your individual tastes. You grudgingly admitted that Hayley knew what she was talking about when it came to fashion and the styles you would like as a girl. Still, there were many other challenges facing you. Upon gathering a small wardrobe for you to start with, Hayley dragged you to the next part of the shopping trip you were not looking forward to...
14422212332122.title: Hayley takes you shopping.

144222123321221.content:
"Here it is" Hayley said, mostly to herself, as she dragged you in front of a lingerie shop. You, seeing what she intended, protested at once.

"Hayley! I'm not going in there!" you said.

"Why not?"

You felt like saying that you was a transformed guy, but instead, you said, "We're supposed to be discrete, right?"

"That's right, sis. What are you getting at? You're not going to throw a tantrum like some five year old?" Hayley said, half grinning. You didn't like the grin, as you wondered if she would actually do it and turn you into a little kid.

"Don't give me that shark-like grin. A... girl.. that is... like me would have done this before" you said, uncomfortably staring at your new breasts.

"True, but a friend of mine works here" Hayley said, dragging through the door.

"Awesome: you muttered, as the only person in the shop walked over. The only person in store was a auburn haired girl Hayley's age. Her green eyes seemed piercing as she stared straight at you.

"Hayley! Good to see you again. So you've finallygot your little sister?" the girl said.

"Yeah. She needs a fitting, Em" Hayley said slightly uncomfortably.

"I can see that" Em said. "So what got you? Twin factor? Mel's incompetence? Hayley finally wanting a sister?"

You stared daggers at both teenage girls. "I've had enough...."

"Lucy's sensitive. She only transformed a few hours ago" Hayley said, more to Em's benefit that to yours.

"Oh.... I guess she doesn't want this... I thought you wouldn't be so quick and give your sister some time..." Em said as she whipped something quickly behind her back.

"What have you got there?" you growled.

"Nothing..."

You glared, causing Em to submit. "Ok. it's just I thought you had been like this for a couple of days..." Em said as she pulled out a pink, frilly bra and panty set.

"I'm not wearing that" you immediately said.

"Yes you are" Hayley said just as quickly. "You need it, and it's not like anyone is going to see"
144222123321221.title: An awkward fitting

1442221233212211.content:
"I'm not wearing pink." Firmly, you stated. "I do have the right to at least pick my colors."

Hayley and Em turned to each other, surprised then laughed before Hayley stated, "Lucy, you are too funny for words but okay..."

The bra instantly changed to a baby blue color and you took it from her before placing it into a shopping basket with a look of satisfaction. "I know why girls need to wear a bra, I have three sisters." More calmly, you said. "Right now, I'm only demanding to have my own choice of style."

"I guess that's not too much to ask." Bemused, Hayley said. "You will need at least six pairs along with some panties and maybe some stockings."

"We have a few attractive nightgowns." Motioning to a clothing rack, Em suggested.

"I prefer pajama tops and bottoms to a nightgown." Wincing, you said. "I will be sleeping, not trying to impress anyone."

Again, Hayley and Em laughed; causing you to blush. To you, your demands were simple and common sense only to them, they seemed rather comical. "I'm serious." Pouting, you protested.

"We know, Lucy." Smiling, Hayley said. "Still, do you really think mom will let you try to impress anyone in your room at your young age?" She giggled. "She won't even hear of it when I suggest bringing in company after dark."

"I'm still not wearing that kind of nightgown." Firmly, you said. "It looks a bit... revealing."

Hayley and Em giggled then motioned to a changing room. "It's time for you to get measured.." Politely, Em said. "I'll have Hayley do it if you are feeling shy."

Blushing, you entered the changing room with Hayley who had you remove your blouse. She measured you quickly then had you put your blouse back on. "You are almost a full cup larger then Mel." Selecting the proper size in light blue, she said. "She is going to be jealous."

"She can have them." Pouting, you countered. "These are sure to give me a back ache later."

Hayley laughed at your comment. She seemed to be having a blast at your expense. "Welcome to our world, little sis." Bemused, she said. "Only this is just the basics of being a girl. You still yet have so much to learn."

"You seem to be having fun, though." Grudgingly, you said.

Hayley smiled, unfazed by your comment. "I'm having a blast helping my little sister." Calmly, she said. "There is a lot a normal girl needs to worry about, not to mention a witch girl, but your biggest complaint so far is the color of your underwear."

You blushed brightly at that. "I don't know all of the problems girls go though, I'll admit that." Softly, you said. "Still, if I'm going to be stuck as a girl, I at least want some control over my new life."

"You will have control over your life." Calmly, she said. "Gez, you are such a drama queen."

"At least I'm not a 'royal pain'." Pouting, you countered.

Em smiled. "Just wait until your first period."
1442221233212211.title: Bemusing demands.

choices: a sales assistant tries to give you some products, mistaking you for a girl
You bump into Samantha Forester, who knows exactly what is happening to you
1443.content:
Meanwhile, you were unaware of all this, though you were puzzled as you stared at your reflection. You swore that your hair weren't so long, though in truth, it was an inch or two past your ears. As you pondered whether you were going insane, your phone rang. it was Harry.

"Hey John. What's up?" Harry asked.

"Just the usual. Trying to do my homework, and wondering whether to head for the mall."

"Why do you want to go there?" Harry asked, knowing you weren't so keen on the place.

"I think I need a haircut. Any longer and I'll have comparisons to Mel" you said.

Harry chuckled. "Not going to happen. You're way too ugly to be compared to Mel... "

"Stop fantasizing over my sister" you said light heartedly.

"Want me to come with you? Why don't we hit the arcade afterwards" Harry suggested.

"That place has already taken most of my money" you moaned.

"So? I'll met you before your haircut."

"Why?"

"I want to get something for Mel and I want your input. I'll see you at the cosmetics and perfume counter" Harry said.

"Arggh. I hate that place" you complained as you ended the call.
1443.title: The haircut question

14432.content:
Twenty minutes later, you were standing by the perfume counter, waiting for Harry. Predictably he was late, and you wondered if you should get your haircut before he arrived. It was getting far too long for your liking.

A voice interrupted your musings. "Can I help you?"

You turned around and saw that a woman in her twenties was standing close to you. "Yes. I friend of mine was supposed to meet me here to get some advice for what he should get my sister. I might as well save that idiot the trouble and get them myself"

"What about yourself? Are you interested in seeing anything for yourself?" the sale assistant asked with a slight smile.

"What do you mean?" you asked.

"Your skin looks a little dry. I have some samples for several moisturizers for you to try" the assistant said.

Your eyes widened. Why would you want to try on some moisturizers? Especially when you knew Harry was coming. "Um no thanks" you said.

"If you can try them, I can provide a slight discount for your perfumes."

You gave a slight frown as it would be kind of embarrassing, but it wouldn't be a total embarrassment. "Sure" you said.

"Okay, miss"

Your eyes went even wider. Miss?
14432.title: mall misadventures

choices: You just want a hair cut.
You ask for a haircut, get the works instead.
144321.content:
You caught a look at yourself in a small mirror and found that your hair had somehow grown over an inch passed your shoulders. What was more shocking, it had turned a more honey blond color like your mom and sisters. "This is insane!" Whispering, you said. "How did this happen?!"

"We all have bad hair days, miss." Smiling, the saleslady said. "There is a wonderful salon here in the mall I can recommend; I go there every week to get my hair done." She motioned to a salon across the hall from her store. "We girls deserve to pamper ourselves every now and then."

You gave a nervous giggle only to pause. "Did I just giggle?"

The saleslady offered you a number of moisturizer samples, which you tried to humor her then purchased one along with a perfume you knew Mel would appreciate. The saleslady offered you a coupon for half off on a haircut and style. You sighed as she then hit you with a perfume scent and offered you the discount she had mentioned. Not wanting to make a scene, you bought the perfume, thinking Hannah might like it then walked to the salon. "Just tell them Diana sent you and they'll take care of you."

"This is costing more than my trips to the arcade." Grumbling, you muttered. "Oh well. I need a haircut so why not?"

You entered the salon where you were met by one of the stylists. "Can I help you, miss?" Politely, she asked. "I could offer you a book of the many styles we offer."

You put on a patient smile, though you felt like screaming. "Diana sent me." Motioning to the scents and oils shop across the hall, you said. "She offered me a coupon for my purchases."

The stylist smiled. "Diana is one of our best customers." Kindly, she said. "She does not offer coupons here lightly." She giggled, looking at you. "I'm guessing you are a tomboy."

"Something like that." Uncomfortable, you replied. "I just need a haircut and style."

The stylist beamed at you, increasing your discomfort. "If you agree to let us use you as a before and after photo shoot, I can offer you the works for free."

You did not like the sound of that, especially not at a salon that specialized in serving female clients with beauty treatments. You were uncertain as everyone was calling you miss. Still, you did see a few male model pictures hanging on the wall so it was really a toss up.
144321.title: Mall Madness.

1443213.content:
"Honestly, I just want a haircut." Trying to be polite, you said. "There's no need to give me any special treatment."

"You're so humble." Bemused, the hairstylist said. "Very well. Would you like us to wash your hair before we cut it? It will make it look fuller."

You shrugged. "That's fine."

The hairstylist smiled. "Wonderful. I'm Dee, by the way."

Dee led you to a chair where you were turned around and leaned back so your longish hair draped into a clean sink. Dee then began to wash your hair, massaging you scalp. It almost immediately placed you into a state of relaxation; you hardly noticed that she was using a sweet smelling shampoo. Another stylist moved in and began to apply a cream to your face.

"What are you doing?" Startled, you demanded.

You almost sat right up but Dee gently held you down. "It's just a deep moisturizer, sweetie." Gently, she said. "My goodness; you are a jumpy one."

You blushed at that. "Sorry. It's been a strange and stressful day."

Dee smiled. "Then just let us help you unwind." Calmly, she said. "We are quite skilled at relieving tensions with a little pampering."

You sighed. "What do I have to lose?" Shrugging, you said.

Dee smiled, finishing washing you hair, then brought the chair up right again. Your eyes were closed due to the moisturizing mask they had put on your face so you could not see what Dee and her team were doing to you. However, they did tell you what they were doing as they did it.

"Your nails are cracking." Sounding concerned, another woman said. "You know, we offer a clear gel that can strengthen your nails."

"I really can't afford too much more." Wincing under the mask, you said.

"Don't worry about it." Almost giggling, Dee said. "We have free samples of almost everything to entice customers to buy them later."

Albeit reluctantly, you allowed the woman to work on your nails. You became worried when you felt them being filed but tried to to fidget from it. You did not want Dee to make a crocked cut or worse nick you as she was cutting your hair.

Finally, the mask came off but Dee urged you to keep your eyes closed. "I am going to give you a curly hairstyle." Smiling, she said. "I sort of want it to be a surprise but don't worry, I can change it if you don't like it."

You sighed when again shrugged. You could not see why the hair stylists were going through so much trouble just for a haircut and style. You felt a light brush on your face but did not protest. The women had gotten this far with you, there was no sense in protesting at least not until they were finished and you could see the results.

Nearly an hour later, Dee announced that she was done and turned you in your seat. "Tell us what you think, dear." Smiling, she said. "Are you cute or what?"

You opened your eyes and gazed at the mirror. "What did you do to me?" Stuned, you demanded. "I look like..."
1443213.title: Special treatment.

choices: you make it to the other salon
14432132.content:
"... a little princess" you stammered. Everything looked much more feminine, and your hair, whilst girly looking before, now looked ten times worse. Even more surprising, was the fact you looked far skinnier and less muscular than before, but a simple makeover couldn't do that. Could it?

Dee mistook your shock for stunned delight. "I'm glad you like it, miss. Would you like me to include some product for you to take home?"

"N-no" you stammered, wondering how on earth she could mistake you for a girl, even with the sprayed perfume and longer hair. although embarrassing, you decided it was best not to correct Dee's mistake, and quickly head for the other hairstylist at the other end of the mall. Surely they could straighten it out, dye it, and generally make it look like you're not going to the prom. Quickly you paid for the haircut (surprisingly the makeover was done for free), hoping you could make it before someone does actually recognises you.
14432132.title: An unwanted style

choices: you notice a massive change to you
the dye doesn't work, much to Anya's surprise
144321323.content:
Fortunately, this wing of the mall was fairly quiet, but you had a reminder on your phone that Harry was waiting for you. After sending him a message that things were taking longer than expected, you entered the salon. Another woman was waiting to do your hair, and just like Dee, she thought you was a girl.

"How can I help you, miss?" the woman, Anya asked.

You hoped she couldn't see your embarrassment. "I'd like my hair straightened, cut and dyed light brown" you said.

"Really? I think your hair looks pretty" Anya said.

"Its not me" you said, looking down at your hands as Anya sat you down in a chair and started cutting off the curls. You barely noticed, as you was more focused on your hands They seemed smaller somehow,, and you swore that Dee had used clear nail strengthener, and had not painted them pink... Shaking your head, you focused in time as Anya applied the dye.

"What color are you using?" you asked, shocked at what was happening.

"Jet black" Anya said, to your surprise.

You eyes widened. What was happening......
144321323.title: you make it to the other salon

choices: you see your gender completely shift
1443213231.content:
A part of you wanted to get up, but despite everything, you didn't want to draw attention to yourself. Two minutes later, Anya said she was done, which made you even more worried. even you knew dying your hair took far longer than a couple of minutes. When Anya passed a mirror in front of you, you gave a girlish shriek.

Everything had changed. Your hair, now jet black was at least shoulder length and twin braided, but that wasn't the most disturbing part. Your face was completely girlish, much more rounded, and cute looking with no trace of hair. Silver studs pierced your ears, but the worst part of the change was your eyes. Every person in your family had blue eyes, yourself included, but now, your eyes were brown.

"How?" you said in a much higher pitched voice. That did it for you; you knew that somehow you was turning into a girl, and worse, it looked like you was turning into someone not even from your own family.

"I don't know what you're talking about, miss" Anya said.

"Can't you see?" you snapped, your fear fuelling your temper. Placing your hands to your mouth, you intended to check out your changes, but instead found yourself giggling. Instantly, you pulled your hands away, and more shockingly, found you had changed even more. Your eyes now looked different, giving you an almost... Asian appearance. That did it for you; you knew you had to get out now...
1443213231.title: you notice a massive change to you

choices: mom arrives, and she is not happy
you follow Samantha to her house
14432132311.content:
Alarmed, you got out of the chair, but instantly, you saw that your clothes were starting to change in shape, color and texture. Your jeans went first; they rapidly changed into a blue pleated skirt, which revealed your still unchanged legs. It looked odd, especially as nobody could see anything wrong, and it became worse as your socks grew out to your knees. A sharp confining feeling snapped your attention away from your lower body, causing you to see that your shirt had become white. Panicked, you saw that the confinement was due to the formation of a bra. Fearing that it was about to cause another change to you, you didn't notice a hand snatch something from your new clothes.

"Huh?" you said, surprised. It was Samantha Forester, and she had an odd look on her face. It was both of relief, but one of extreme worry.

"I thought I'd get more than a 'huh'" Samantha said as she held a red ribbon in her hand.

"What are yo doing here? What is going on? How..." you said, as you saw that Anya was unconscious and lying on the floor.

"First of all, you have to know than none of these stores had anything to do with your sudden Asian schoolgirl makeover, 'miss',... and neither have I" Samantha said hastily.

"Schoolgirl?" you squeaked.

"You would have been, if I hadn't interfered. Might have been a normal school, too."

"But..."

"My guess is adaptive magic and a corrupted curse. I need to examine you more, before something happens" Samantha said
14432132311.title: Unlikely savior

choices: you stare seeing that something is growning on your arms
144321323111.content:
"Examine me? What is this all about? Adaptive magic?" you demanded, trying to remain calm.

"Adaptive magic is where the spell adapts to the surroundings. If you admire a bridal gown, you might find yourself in it. If see seashells, you might be using them for a swim. If you call say your sister an 'airhead'..." Samantha explained.

"Okay. I get it. How powerful is this magic, and why the gender and ethnic change? How do I stop it?" you yelled, wondering why she used those examples.

"Irony. Have you mocked any girls lately, John? Or their school? Or what they wear?" Samantha asked.

"No"

"It is possible that someone likes your potential, but it doesn't explain the most obvious change to you. I won't lie. I always thought you had great magic potential and thought you should be dressed. Literally. Maybe someone had the same thought. All I need to do is get you home without Natalie trying to blow my head off... Damn it" Samantha said. With shocking speed, she flung you to the back of the store and dived in after you. Seconds later, mom stormed in, her eyes deadly.

"Forester! What have you done to my son!?" mom raged.

"Nothing."

"Right. You can not hide behind your force fields forever and when they're down..."

"I've been set up, Natalie. My magic cannot do everything that has happened to John. If it wasn't for me, she would be enrolled in a different school by now..."

"I'm suddenly going to trust you?" mom replied.

"Show her" Samantha whispered to you.
144321323111.title: mom arrives, and she is not happy

choices: ... Samantha rips off the transforming clothes
1443213231112.content:
Despite feeling extremely nervous about it, you knew it was good advice, and you needed help. Fast. No way you wanted to be stuck as a girl, especially one that looked nothing like any other member of your family. Looking down at your right hand to gather your composure, you noticed something white growing on your hand. It quickly spread, encasing your hand within seconds. You knew what it was; a white, wrist glove, which was expanding down your arm. A quick glance told you that the same was happening with your left arm as well.

"What is that screaming? What are you doing to my son?" mom said sternly at the other side of Samantha's barrier.

"We have a problem" Samantha said in a flat voice

Hinata sighed. "That is part of the experience." Patiently, she said. "In hindsight, we should have prepared you better for this and for that I do apologize." Her face then turned stern. "However, what is done is done and you must deal with it until the time comes to swap you and John back."

You're now a seven year old boy
Hannah does something else to you
15.content:
Several hours later, you were in your room, along with the book. You hadn't the time to look at it, as you were busy with assignments from school, but it was lying on your desk.

"What going on, John" a voice asked. It was Hannah.

"I don't have time to play, Hannah. I'm busy" you said.

"Please, John. Mel won't. She told me that she'll be busy all week, and that I'm not to disturb her. Hayley won't be back until tomorrow" Hannah whined.

"I can't either because I have nearly the same amount of work to do" you answered in an even voice.

"What's this?" Hannah asked, spying the magic book.

"Just some book I found on the floor" you said, slightly annoyed.

"Can I see it?" Hannah asked. Like yourself, she didn't know what the book really was.

"Sure. Whatever. As long as you just leave me alone. I have to get this study done" you snapped as you got up and gave Hannah the book. Much to your disappointment, she stayed in your room, as she started reading the front of the book.

"Hey, it's a spellbook" Hannah said in a delighted voice.

"Not now" you growled, annoyed that she had broken fifteen minutes of silence.

"No, really John. Here" Hannah said as she read a spell.
15.title: Later, Hannah spots the book

1543.content:
The entire room went black the moment Hannah finished reciting whatever she was reading. John slowly regained consciousness a few minutes later, and immediately realized something was wrong. For starters, his vision was suddenly blocked by some long blonde hair. What the hell? When he brought a hand up to move the hair out of the way, he was surprised to see it was suddenly much smaller and daintier than before.

Wanting to know what was going on, he got to his feet and ran over to the mirror on the back of his door. If the blonde hair and dainty hands were a surprise, John was positively floored by what he saw in the mirror. Instead of seeing a reflection of himself wearing his shorts and Call of Duty t-shirt, he saw a reflection of Hannah wearing her favorite violet-colored dress. No, this can’t be happening!

John’s fears were quickly realized when the reflection in the mirror copied every move he made; down to the horrified expression on his face. Suddenly feeling overwhelmed, John screamed at the top of his lungs. After screaming for a moment, John stopped when he heard groaning coming from behind him. Turning around, he saw his body turn over onto its back.

John didn’t need to be a genius to figure out that if he was Hannah’s body, she was likely in his. Running over to his body, suddenly aware of how much bigger everything was, he started shaking his body. “Hannah, is that you?”

Hannah slowly opened her eyes; only for them to bug out when she saw who was standing over her. “Who are you and why do you look like me?”

While Hannah became aware of the fact that her voice was different, John looked at her and said, “Hannah it’s me, John.”

“John?” Looking at him, Hannah said, “Why do you look like me?”

“Probably for the same reason you look like me.”

Sitting up, Hannah said, “What are you...”

Hannah stopped mid-sentence when she saw her reflection in the mirror. Seeing the horrified look on her face, John said, “What exactly did you read from that book, Hannah?”

“I-I don’t know.” Running her hands over her new body, Hannah said, “It said it was supposed to help two people understand each other better.”

“We’re in each other’s bodies; I think it’s safe to say it did that.”

Making her way over to the mirror, Hannah started touching her face. “What are we supposed to do now?” turning to John, scared, Hannah said, “I don’t want to be an icky boy?”

“Do you seriously think I want to be you?” spotting the book on the floor, John said, “The spell you used came from that book; see if there’s a way to undo it.”

Hannah went over to grab the book. John watched as she ruffled through the book for a moment. Closing the book, she said, “I don’t get it, the pages are blank.”

That jogged John’s memory a little bit; remembering something he noticed when he first found the book. “I noticed some writing earlier that said the book isn’t for male eyes.” Sighing, John said, “I’m a girl now, so maybe it’ll work for me.”

Handing the book to John, Hannah said, “It’s worth a try.”

********************************


Meanwhile, downstairs, Melanie was walking into the house; having stayed at school to chat with some friends. Placing her bags on the floor, she was surprised to find the house seemingly empty. “Hello? Is anyone home?”

She was about to walk into the kitchen to get a drink when she heard movement upstairs. Going upstairs, she heard voices coming from John’s bedroom. As she got closer, she realized they belonged to John and Hannah. Walking up to the closed door, she listened as John said, “Can you see anything?”

“I’m not sure.” Pausing, Hannah said, “There’s definitely some writing here, but I’m having a hard time making it out.”

Wondering what they were talking about, Melanie opened the door to find Hannah holding the family spellbook in her lap. Running into the room, before John or Hannah could react to her presence; she grabbed the book and said, “Hannah, you shouldn’t be reading this! It’s far too dangerous!”

“It’s a little late for that, Mel.” Looking at her, Hannah said, “I’m not Hannah, I’m John.”
1543.title: A Brother/Sister Body Swap

15431.content:
The magic book in her hands, Melanie looked at Hannah in disbelief. “If that’s your idea of a joke, Hannah, you can do better.”

“I’m telling the truth, Mel; I’m really John!” pointing to Hannah, in his body, John said, “I found that book under the recliner in the family room. Hannah read something from it and we swapped bodies.”

Looking at who she thought was John, Melanie said, “Did you put her up to this, baby brother?”

John couldn’t help but glare at Melanie for that remark; not realizing how adorable it made him look in Hannah’s body - even though he was only 5 minutes younger than her, Melanie never missed an opportunity to remind him that she was older. Meanwhile, Hannah let out a sigh and said, “It’s the truth, Melanie; I’m the real Hannah.”

“Forgive me if I have a hard time believing you.” Gesturing to the book in her arms, Melanie said, “There are body swap spells in here, but Hannah’s too young to be able to use them.”

“I don’t know what to tell you, Mel.” Sighing, John said, “One minute I’m sitting on my bed, the next thing I know I’m laying on the floor in Hannah’s body.”

Melanie had to admit that if this was a prank, that John and Hannah were certainly committed to it. Placing the book down on John’s desk, Melanie said, “Let’s say, for a moment, that I believe what you two are saying.” Kneeling down to John’s level, Melanie said, “If you’re really John then you’ll be able to tell me what happened to Rachel Johnson at lunch today.”

Rachel Johnson was on the cheer squad with Megan, and she viewed Megan as her chief rival on the squad. John wasn’t sure what lead to the altercation in the lunchroom, but Rachel had approached their table with a bone to pick with Megan. It all happened so quickly that he barely had time to process what happened. Looking at Melanie, he said, “She slipped on a puddle split soda, bumped into another student’s lunch tray and fell to the floor with spaghetti all over her.”

John hoped that was enough to convince Melanie that they were telling the truth; although she might think that he’d told Hannah that story. To be honest, he probably would have if he hadn’t ended up in her body. With a flabbergasted look on her face, Melanie said, “John? That’s really you?”

“As strange as that sounds?” placing his hands on his waist, John said, “It’s really me in here.”

Suddenly Melanie burst out laughing; causing both John and Hannah to glare at her, which only made her laugh even harder. Once she finally stopped, Melanie said, “This is too funny.”

“I’m glad you think it’s funny, Mel.” Pouting, Hannah said, “You think I want to be an icky boy?”

“And I really don’t want to be my own little sister.” Looking at Melanie, John said, “You said there were body swap spells in that book; can’t you find one to undo this?”

“Undo what?”

Startled, everyone turned to find Mom standing in the doorway with a confused look on her face. With a weak smile, Melanie said,
“Hi, Mom.”

“Hello, Melanie.” Turning serious, Mom said, “Does someone care to explain what’s going on here?”
15431.title: Melanie's Reaction

154311.content:
After everyone went down to the kitchen, it took 20 minutes to explain everything to Mom. When they were finished, John could tell that Mom was upset. With the book on the table in front of her, Mom just stared at the others sitting across from her – John never felt so small in his life; and it wasn’t just because he was in Hannah’s body.

Everyone was getting nervous as they wondered what Mom was going to do. Taking a deep breath, Mom looked at Melanie and said, “You’re grounded until further notice, young lady.”

“What?” shocked, Melanie said, “But I didn’t do anything?”

“Didn’t you?” sighing, Mom said, “If you hadn’t been so careless with the book, your brother and sister would still be in their rightful bodies.”

“But I spent hours looking for once I realized it was missing.” Gesturing to John, Melanie said, “How was I supposed to know John would find it, or that Hannah would be stupid enough to read it?”

“Hey!” glaring at Melanie, Hannah said, “I’m not stupid, you’re stupid!”

“Be that as it may, you’re still grounded until I say otherwise.” Pausing, Mom said, “Which, I’m afraid, means you won’t be going to that concert this weekend.”

“This totally sucks!” getting up, Melanie glared at John and Hannah, “Thanks a lot, you guys.”

Once Melanie stormed off, Hannah and John turned to mom. Looking at Mom, Hannah said, “What’s going to happen to us, Mommy? Can you undo the spell?”

John winced when he heard his own body talking like a little girl. Looking at Hannah, Mom said, “I could undo it, quite easily, but I’m not going to – at least not yet.”

Now it was John and Hannah’s turn to be upset. Both of them looked at Mom and said, “What!?”

“I’m sorry, but I’m not going to undo the spell; Hannah needs to learn there are consequences for her actions.”
While Hannah started tearing up, John looked at Mom and said, “I’m kind of the victim in all this, why am I being punished?”

“You’re not being punished, John; but I think this will do you some good as well.” Sighing, Mom said, “The purpose of that spell was to help two people understand each other; I think it will do you good to have a better understanding of what Hannah’s life is like.”

Overcome with emotion, Hannah stormed out of the kitchen in tears; like she usually did whenever she didn't get her way. After a moment, John turned to Mom and said, “But I don’t want to be a 7-year-old girl!”

“I’m sorry, sweetie, but my decision stands.” Looking at John, rather cryptically, Mom said, “If you give it time, I think you’ll find this is for the best.”

“Not likely.” Getting out of the chair, John said, “What am I supposed to do now? Can I go play some video games?”

“I don’t think so, those are way too violent for a 7-year-old girl.” Sighing, Mom said, “I’m afraid you’ll have to find something to do in Hannah’s room.”

Grumbling to himself as he walked out of the kitchen, to no one in particular, John said, “I wish I never found that stupid book.”
Once everyone was out of the kitchen, Mom sat back in the chair and said, “Perhaps this incident can fix what I couldn’t do 7 years ago.”
154311.title: Explaining Things to Mom

1543112.content:
Meanwhile, as soon as she left the kitchen, Hannah went straight upstairs to her room. As she stood in the doorway, she noticed how small everything in her room seemed now. Going over to her dolls, she sat down and grabbed one of them. As she held it in her hands, Hannah started to tear up again, “I can’t believe I have to be an icky boy.”

“You think I want to be a little girl, Hannah?”

Looking up, Hannah spotted John standing in the doorway; one hand behind his back and the other holding the hem of her favorite dress. “What do you want, John?”

“I hate to do this; but technically, thanks to you, this is my room now.” wincing, John walked into the room and said, “Your room is down the hall.”

“But that’s a boy’s room!”

“I don’t like this any more than you do, Hannah.” Sitting down next to his little sister turned older brother, John said, “But we’ll just have to live with this until Mom decides to change us back.”

Trying to regain her composure, Hannah said, “I’m sorry I got us swapped, John.”

“I know.” Looking at Hannah, flashing the same smile she would give, John said, “Maybe Mom’s right; maybe this will help bring us closer together.”

*********************


After Hannah and John made peace with each other, they spent almost 30 minutes having a tea party. As time went by, although he would never admit it, John found himself enjoying the experience. He was just starting to get into it, playfully asking if Hannah wanted more tea when Melanie came walking into the room with a dour look on her face. “I’m glad to see you two are having so much fun.”

“Forgive us for making the best of a bad situation, Melanie.” Trying to sound intimidating in Hannah’s body was difficult, but John did what he could. “We’re in this mess because you were irresponsible with the magic book.”

“I’m not the one who read a spell out of the book.” Gesturing to Hannah, Melanie said, “You could’ve stopped Hannah from reading it."

"How was I supposed to know something like this would happen?" Looking at her, John said, "I didn't even know magic existed until today."

John heard the sound of the phone ringing downstairs; followed shortly after by the sounds of a muffled conversation. After a moment the sound of footsteps coming up the stairs could be heard. Mom appeared in the doorway to Hannah’s room; looking at John, she said, “That was Kelly’s mom inviting Hannah to a sleepover tonight.” Pausing, she said, “I hope you don't mind if I said yes.”

"Why should I care if Hannah's been invited to a sleepover?" Suddenly the reality of the situation dawned on John. His face turning pale, John said, “There's no way I'm going to a sleepover with a bunch of little girls."

"For the time being, John, you are in Hannah's body." Sighing, Mom said, "I'm sorry but that means you have to be her, and that includes going to school and playing with her friends."

“You can’t be serious, Mom; I have no idea how to act like a 7-year-old girl.”

“I have a solution to that problem.”

Looking at Mom, with a confused look, John said, “What kind of solution?”

“It’s called a mimic spell.” Taking a breath, Mom says, “It’s used to help someone blend in with a certain group; in this case, a group of 7-year-old girls.”

John suddenly had a bad feeling in his stomach. Looking at Mom, he said, “It’s not permanent, is it?”

“Don’t worry; I’ll remove the spell when you come home tomorrow.”

“Will I remember that I’m supposed to be a boy?”

“This spell doesn’t affect memories; only personalities.” Sighing, Mom said, “So yes; you’ll be a 7-year-old girl with the memories of a 13-year-old boy.”

John paused to think it over for a few moments. He wasn’t too keen on the idea of attending a girl’s sleepover; but if mom had a way to make it easier, he’d be stupid not to go for it. Taking a deep breath, John said, “Okay, I’ll go for it.”

“Okay then.” Looking at Melanie, Mom said, “Melanie, honey, you might want to leave the room for a moment. Hannah and I will be protected from the spell’s effects, but I’d rather not have to explain why my 13-year-old daughter suddenly has the mind of a little girl.”

Melanie didn’t argue as she turned to leave; closing the door behind her. She leaned against the opposite wall for a few minutes until the door opened again. Seeing Mom in the doorway, she said, “Did the spell work?”

“Come and see for yourself.”

Melanie walked back into the room to find John and Hannah in the corner by Hannah’s dollhouse. There wasn’t anything particularly strange about that; since John would occasionally play with Hannah like that. What amused Melanie was the sight of her twin brother and little sister acting like they were 7-year-old girls.

“No Hannah, you’re doing it wrong!” Holding a dog figurine in his hands, John said, “The doggy goes ‘woof’ not ‘bark.’”

From behind her, Melanie heard Mom say, “Let’s go John; I promised Kelly’s mom I’d have you at the house by 5:00.”

“Okay, mommy.”

As she and Hannah watched John follow after Mom, skipping down the hall just like Hannah would do, Melanie hoped her carelessness wouldn’t take her brother from her.
1543112.title: Continue (Melanie's POV)

15431122.content:
Thirty minutes had passed since Mom had brought John to the sleepover; Melanie and Hannah were downstairs in the family room waiting for her to get home with some pizza. The two of them were watching TV when Hannah said, “I hope John’s going to be alright at the sleepover tonight.”

Melanie didn’t let on, but she shared Hannah’s concerns. “You saw how he was acting after Mom cast that spell.” Muting the TV,
Melanie said, “I’m sure he’ll be fine.”

The two sisters talked for a few more minutes until Hannah got up to use the bathroom. Melanie was about to start watching TV again when there was a knock at the door. Thinking it was Mom; she got up and walked to the front door – only to find Megan and Harry standing there.

Opening to the door, she said, “Hey guys, what’s up?”

“We were thinking of going to the movies tonight.” Pausing, Megan said, “We were hoping John and you would like to come.”

“I’d love to come, but I’m grounded until further notice.” Sighing, Melanie said, “I’m not sure John is feeling all that well either; I
think we may pass.”

“Damn, that sucks.” Groaning, Harry said, “We were going to go see The Hermit.”

The Hermit was a newly released teen slasher movie; one that Melanie really wanted to see. Before Melanie could say anything else, Hannah came out of the bathroom. “Wow, peeing standing up is really...”

“John!” turning around, blushing, Melanie said, “Harry and Megan are here.”

Melanie didn’t know it, but Hannah also had a little crush on Harry; ever since he fixed a flat tire on her bike a few months back. Walking up to them, making sure to act as John would, she said, “Hey guys, what’s up?”

“We came to see if Melanie and you wanted to go see The Hermit tonight, but she’s grounded and you’re not feeling well.”

“What?” unaware of what Melanie had told them, Hannah said, “I feel fine; I’d love to go to the movies.”

“John, can I talk to you for a moment?”

After indicting that she’d be right back, Hannah followed Melanie down the hall to the kitchen. Once out of earshot, she said,
“What’s going on?”

“I could ask you the same thing, Hannah.” Incredulous, Melanie said, “First off, you realize The Hermit isn’t the type of movie you’d like.”

“It’s not like I’ve never seen scary movies before, Melanie.”

“Okay, fair point.” Sighing, Melanie said, “Why do you want to go to a movie with John’s friends?”

“Why not?” confused, Hannah said, “He gets to go to a sleepover with my friends; why can’t I see a movie with his?”

“Okay, that’s another fair point.” Pausing, Melanie said, “But do you really think Mom will let you go to the movies?”

Seeing Mom standing outside talking with Megan and Harry, Hannah said, “Why don’t we go ask her?”

Melanie followed Hannah back to the front door; walking up to Mom outside on the patio. “Mom, tell...John that it’s not a good idea for him to see this movie.”

“Your sister is right, John; I don’t think it’ll be appropriate for you.”

Harry and Megan looked on, unsure of what was going on. Looking at Mom, Harry said, “My cousin saw the movie last night, Mrs. H; he said it really wasn’t that scary.”

“Please Mom?” looking at Mom, Hannah said, “I promise it’ll be okay.”

After thinking it over silently for a moment, Mom took a deep breath and said, “Okay John; if you think you can handle it, I’ll let you go.”

“Sweet, thanks mom!” turning to Harry and Megan, Hannah said, “Let me get my wallet and I’ll be right out.”

While Hannah went to get John’s wallet, Megan and Harry went down the sidewalk to where Harry’s mom was waiting in the car. Once everyone was out of earshot, Melanie turned to Mom and said, “You realize you just agreed to let your 7-year-old daughter see a horror movie, right?”
15431122.title: At the House (Hannah's POV)

154311221.content:
John had been at Kelly’s house for almost 20 minutes; and despite his fears, he was having fun. That likely had something to do with the mimic spell Mom placed on him, but he didn’t really care – so long as no one suspected that he wasn’t really a 7-year-old girl.

Walking out of the bathroom, having changed into a pair of Disney pajamas Mom had packed, he went down the hall to Kelly’s room. Going through the door, he saw that Kelly’s mom had brought up some pizza and juice for dinner. Looking at him, Kelly said, “What took you so long, Hannah?”

“I had to go potty.”

As John went to grab a slice of pizza, he was mentally kicking himself for getting himself into this situation. If I hadn’t found that stupid book I wouldn’t be at a sleepover with a bunch of 7-year-olds .

Once he had his pizza, and juice box, John went over to join the others – Kelly, Michaela, and Amber. As he sat down, Kelly said, “Hannah, do you want to play dollies or watch movies?”

I can’t believe I’m making this kind of decision. Taking a bite of the pizza, John said, “How about we play dollies and watch a movie?”

“Okay!”

Soon enough John found himself playing with Kelly’s dolls while they watched 101 Dalmatians. As time went by, although he’d never admit it, John found himself starting to enjoy playing with the others. Maybe being a little girl for a while won’t be so bad. I just hope Hannah’s having an okay time in my body.
154311221.title: The Sleepover

1543112212.content:
It was almost 9:00 by the time the movie ended; Hannah, Harry, and Megan walked out of the theater with everyone else. Hannah was surprised she made it through the movie; as it was definitely scarier than any horror movie she’d ever seen.

As the three of them walked outside to wait for Harry’s mom, Megan turned to them and said, “Now I’ve seen a fair number of scary movies, but that one was definitely one of the scarier ones.” Looking at Hannah, Megan said, “Thanks for holding my hand during the movie, John; it made me feel safe.”

Hannah didn’t really understand why Megan was thanking her; although she had held Megan’s hand, it was for Hannah’s benefit and not hers. There were some portions of the movie, especially towards the end when the Hermit was chasing the protagonist with a bloody knife, which proved to be too much for Hannah to handle.

Looking at Megan, acting like she thought John would, Hannah said, “That’s what I’m here for, Meg; to make you feel safe.”

Hugging Hannah, Megan gave her a quick kiss on the cheek. “Well, I really appreciated it.”

Hannah stood there as Megan and Harry went down to the parking lot to wait. Feeling Megan’s body against hers, followed by the kiss, caused a reaction Hannah wasn’t familiar with. That was weird; but for some reason I really liked it. Making a note to talk to Melanie about it, Hannah went down to join the others.
1543112212.title: After the Movie

155.content:
"What are you doing? I really don't have the time for this game, Hannah, so quit it" you demanded, as Hannah finished reading her spell. She had barely finished when a white pulse of light emitted from the book, blinding you both. Still blind, you said, "How did you do that? I want answers, young lady."

"I don't know, John. I just read a spell for us to go somewhere interesting" Hannah said, her voice showing she was just as surprised as you were. "It's your book. How did you do that light trick? I feel sick...."

"I didn't do this, and neither did you... Melanie. Is this some kind of joke?" you said angrily. The fact you couldn't see didn't help your temperament either. Five minutes later, your vision started to clear from the flash blindness and once you could see again, you saw that you weren't in your bedroom anymore. It looked like some storeroom, or basement.

"Hannah? Can you see?" you asked.

"Not really" your sister said sourly. "Why?"

"We're not in my room anymore. Any idea what happened?" you said, wondering if the flash had also knocked you out.

"It's magic, John. grab the book" Hannah said somewhat excitedly.

"Damn it, Hannah. Magic isn't real. There has to be a logical explanation" you said as you leant down for the book. Surprisingly, It was gone. That confirmed it in your mind. The flash from whatever it was, knocked you and Hannah out. You were likely in the basement or something like that.

"Hey, look at this" Hannah said, seemingly fully recovered. Sighing, you wondered what had gotten her excited
155.title: An adventure with your little sis

1551.content:
"Seriously, Hannah?" you said the moment you saw it were a bunch of wigs. While it was odd that there were over two dozen different mannequin heads, each containing a different wig, it wasn't something that really excited you. Especially since they were all female wigs.

"Why don't you try one on, John. Please?" Hannah pleaded,

"No, and don't touch them. It's not yours" you said.

"But they're so lifelike" Hannah whined.

Stepping forward for a closer look, you had to agree with your annoying sister. The wigs were of all different colors, mainly blonds, reds and browns, but with the occasional black. "Okay, I've looked at the wigs. Can we go now, and see where we are?" you said, even though you felt a faint allure to the wigs. Almost like what you felt with the 'magic' book.

Hannah ignored you, as she was particularly focused on the.....
1551.title: The room full of wigs

choices: You go for the cheerleader inspired wig
you put on the Cinderella wig
15511.content:
.... blond wigs. It wasn't surprising since every female in your family were blond. Even some of the guys, such as your cousin Tim had blond hair, but you were different with your dark brown hair.

"Please John. I wanna see you as a blond like me" Hannah said.

"Okay. I'll look" you growled, trying to ignore the growing feeling that you should just try something on. The first wig had hair that would have been shoulder length except that it was held up into a pair of high pigtails by a pair of hot pink scrunchies. It definitely screamed both Melanie, and cheerleader to you, as Mel wore her own hair in a similar fashion. The hair, was more of a golden blond than the honey blond of your sisters, Hannah seemed very keen to see you with it on your head, least until she spotted the next wig.

"No, Hannah" you muttered as you saw the next wig. It was a lighter shade of blond, and had a weird up do. It would had confused you, despite it's familiarity, though Hannah's presence made it crystal clear in your mind where you've seen it before. Hannah loved princesses and of them, Cinderella most of all. She definitely would have spotted the wig that resembled that of her idol. "Please. John."

While the urge to put on a wig were almost unbearable, like if you were spellbound or something, you didn't want to have a hairstyle like that. "Next" you said.

"Please. Please!" Hannah begged
15511.title: Going for the family colors

choices: You notice your clothes look a little off
155112.content:
"No" you said flatly, fully intending to wear another wig just to shut her up.

"Please, John. I won't tell. Please. Please" Hannah whined. You didn't believe her; she'd tell everyone within a millisecond, and embellish her story too, but thanks to the magic in the room, you found yourself reaching out for the Cinderella inspired wig.

"I can't believe I'm doing this" you muttered as you stared at the golden hairpiece in your hands. The hair felt incredibly soft, and actually smelt nice. After a few seconds of final resistance, you gave in to your new desires to wear the wig, and slowly placed it onto your head.

"Yah. You're the best, John" Hannah said, hugging your around the waist.

"Whatever" you said, knowing that your cheeks were flushed with embarrassment. "I don't know why I even did this. Remember you promised that you'd remain quiet." Now that the wig were on your head, you weren't overcome with a desire to wear it. Hannah was the only reason you still had it on.

"But it suits you, John" Hannah giggled.

155112.title: Hannah's idol

1551122.content:
You dropped down to stare at Hannah "Yeah? Okay then. How do I get this wig off?"

"How should I know. Here" Hannah said as she took advantage of being able to grab your hair.

"Arrgrh. Damn it!" you screamed as you stood up, out of reach of Hannah's reach. "What is wrong with you? I told you it's stuck to my head"

"I think it's like real hair" Hannah said.

"Don't be ridiculous. You know its a wig" you snapped. As you looked down at your sister, you saw that something had happened to your shirt. Normally, it was white, but now it had a very faint blue tinge to it. Blinking, you looked at it again, wondering if your mind were playing tricks on you. To your shock, the blue color had deepened in color. Without a doubt your shirt had become pale blue.

"What happened to my shirt? Hannah? Is there something wrong with the lights?" you squeaked, trying not to show your were slightly rattled.

choices: Cassie disguises herself to observe you.
Cassie asks your friends about you.
1551122113222221122131221132112133111321.content:
You were in a foul mood when you left school for home. After everything you had been through you, now there is a love sick girl who has eyes for your female self. There is just one problem; if you permanently become female, you will also become one of the most powerful witches in the witching world.

"That Cassie is playing with fire." Sourly, you muttered.

"Is my little boy feeling grumpy?" Teasing, Cassie asked.

You turned, startled to find Cassie standing up against a tree, smiling. "I can make all of your troubles melt away once I make you a girl for good." Sweetly, she purred. "I know you will love it."

"Do you now?!" Irritated, you demanded. "You don't know a damn thing! If I become a girl for good it will shake the entire witching world, you complete idiot!"

You blushed after saying that as Cassie took a step back. She seemed stunned that you verbally lashed out at her. "I know your family is magically powerful." More serious, she said. "Still, transformed boys don't become that strong..."

"Forget it!" Still blushing, you said. "Just know that my life will only get more difficult if I permanently become a girl and a witch."

Without another word, you continued to walk home, Cassie did not follow you. She instead pondered over your words before sighing with a dreamy sigh. "He's so mysterious!" Swooning, she said. "I have got to get to know 'her' better!"
1551122113222221122131221132112133111321.title: Your tantrum sparks Cassie's curiosity.

1551122113222221122131221132112133111321.content:
Cassie quickly decided the best way to learn more about you was through your closest friends. She tried Harry first, as she was the only one that also knew about Cassie's own abilities.

"Hello cutie. How are your enjoying your new found femininity, Ariel?" Cassie said with a sweet smile.

"What do you want?" Harry growled.

"Such a tomboy. I can see why there are those rumors about you and Melanie Harrison" Cassie said.

"Which isn't helped by you" Harry growled. "Get to the point, witch."

"I know a little about gender magic, and I can help you. All I need is some information about John...."

Harry's response was epic. After a quick, curt, and from Cassie's point of view, unexpected rant, se saw Harry was not going to give any information. Her sweet persona vanished and turning to Harry for a final word, Cassie said, "Hope you like being a girl and having such a feminine name, Ariel, cuse you're going to have it for a very long time. Here's a gift to remind you. Harry/Ariel frowned at the (completely non magical) bikini that Cassie had tossed to her as she walked of.

Next on the list was Megan. Cassie correctly guessed the real reason of Mel and Megan's falling out, and knew she could take advantage. Megan had just exited the lockerrooms, ready for cheer practise when Cassie walked up to her.

"What do you want?" Megan said frostily.

It surprised Cassie She wondered if you had told Megan about herself, but she forgot that Megan didn't like her too much before any of this happened. " I need some information about John. You see, I have the same powers you fear, and I can help you. Whatever you want. All I need is some information about John..."

:You stay away from my brother!" a voice yelled. It was Mel, and she looked angry. "I know what you are trying to do, Bane, and it's NOT going to work!"

"Why not? We both want the same thing....." Cassie said. "You get your twin sister and I...."

"can jump in the sewage tanks. Why don't you go flirt with Kristy Hart? You'd suit each other" Megan said, causing a slight giggle from Megan.

"I'm going to find out: Cassie said. Turning to Megan, she said, "Your fears are correct. Mel is unstable, and its only a matter of time before John joins you in that uniform."

"So not going to happen."

"Why not, airhead? Your flame is unstable. You're reckless, and I will get what I want" Cassie said as left, inwardly feeling frustrated. Her hunt for information had meant she had ruined her chances of following you
1551122113222221122131221132112133111321.title: Cassie asks your friends about you.

choices: Tim motioned her hands towards her dollhouse
Tim said, "She is back in the first grade."
Tim said, "Brooke has a new girl in class...."
1551122113222221122131221132112133111321.content:
Meanwhile, you wondered what to do. You knew you had a major problem with Cassie following you, and eventually she would try something major against you. While your exterior was impervious to anything she could do to you, who knows what would have if she did anything to your interior, which was one thing that Elvira did not test. Plus the whole mermaid thing greatly complicated things.... With a sigh, you started walking towards your aunt's house, as you needed outside perspective.

Your aunt looked slightly surprised to see you when she opened her door. "Hello John. I wasn't expecting to see you so soon. Tiff is upstairs."

You looked at your aunt, slightly puzzled. Elvira had renamed Tim, 'Brittany', much to her delight, so you wondered why. Seeing your confusion, Catherine gave a slight wicked grin. "Parental override. I preferred Tiffany, as it was closer to her boy name. I would have allowed Tiffany to pick her own name, but..... she was uncooperative."

"What do you expect?" you said.

Catherine shrugged. "She is up in her room, pouting."

"And Brooke?" you enquired, wondering about her other cousin.

"In her room. I had to separate them" Catherine said.

"Great" you muttered sarcastically. "Do you know everything about what happened?"

"Mostly. Don't get her wet in public. I suppose its the same with you."

"Yeah" you said, with a sigh. Deciding not to tell her about your own problems, you headed to Tim's room and opened her room. Tim was lying on her bed, still dressed in her school uniform and looking very much like Hannah. However, the similarities ended with appearance. Tim wasn't happy with her new pink room, and was openly glaring as she saw it was you that opened the door. Her death glare melted when you said, "Tim?"

"Thank you for not using that stupid name mommy has used. Your the first not to use it" Tim said.

"I'm surprised you're still dressed in that" you said.

"What else can I wear?" Tim wailed as she walked over and flung open her wardrobe. Inside it had several dresses, a ballet outfit and strangely, a onepiece swimsuit. Naturally all in pink.

"Why the onepiece? We both can't go swimming...."

"Mommy has installed a pool in the basement. She said it would be good for me. That isn't the worst. School's a nightmare. Everyone has treated me like some dumb cootie infested girl" Tim wailed. "I look like Princess Cootie and they want me to act like her too!"

"Least you don't have a unpleasant witch wanting to change you then date you" you said. Tim ignored your comment, so you said, "We both have unwanted attention. Anything good?"

"I found out what happened to Greg" Tim said, as a slight smile formed on her face.

"Yeah. What?" you wondered.
1551122113222221122131221132112133111321.title: the other transformee

1551122113222221122131221132112133111321.content:
"I'll show you!" Tim said excitedly, as she headed to the farthest part of her room. Like everything else, it was super girly, but Tim had been busy trying to mess things up. It was a mess. Two different pairs of shoes were thrown carelessly on the floor, along with what you assumed were the matching outfits. A pair of tights were dangling over a dollhouse, which made you laugh. Undoubtedly Tiffany the pretty slob found a more constructive use for her girl's toys. To your surprise, she pulled them off, and reached inside the doll's house and picked up a small doll.

"I'm surprised you're actually picking that thing up" you said.

"Look harder, John" Tim gushed. At first, you thought it was just another girl doll with it's hair strangely styled, but looking on it's plastic face and lipsticked smile made you uneasy. There was something familiar about that thing....

"That is Greg" Tim said with a slight girlish giggle.

"What?! How?!"

"Are you sure you're not going like some mushbrained girl? Grandma was angry with what he tried to do to us. Appropriate that she is now a mostly inanimate object" Tim said.

"Can he hear us?" you said, alarmed.

"Yes, but its not going to do her much good. Grandma said 'Pretty Georgia' will only change back when I'm back to normal, or when I lose interest in dolls. Whichever comes first."

The casual way Tim said that was creepy. She had to know it could be years. "Wait! You're telling me that my girl taunting cousin is now playing with dolls?"

"No! I.. um.. only did her hair because she hates it. And her dress...."

"Hey. I'm not judging, Tim. We all have our issues thanks to our transformations."

"Like what? You're still a boy, John" Tim pouted.

"Go swimming with me, and you'll find out" you growled.

"Eww. No way. I can thing of anything more icky and stupid" Tim protested. "I'd rather play with Pretty Georgia than be some stupid fish."
1551122113222221122131221132112133111321.title: My bully, my doll

1551122113222221122131221132112133111321.content:
Meanwhile, Cassie was glaring, as she half watched her sister, Michelle (who in reality is her changed older brother) play in the back garden.

"What's wrong with you?" Michelle demanded after twenty minutes of bringing up her courage to ask. Normally attracting unwanted attention was a very bad idea.

"Oh. You wouldn't understand" Cassie said in a dismissive manner.

"I'm sixteen years old" Michelle pouted.

"We've been over this, Shelley. You're only seven and you're too young to understand..." Cassie said in the same dismissive voice.

"I understand all too well. Normally you're all over changing me and putting me into this ridiculous outfit, but now you're staring aimlessly. You've got a crush. Who is it?" Michelle said.

"What do you mean ''ridiculous'? Little girls love being in dresses. Admit it, you like it, Michelle" Cassie said.

I do not! Besides, I will find out Cassandra. You and mom cannot keep me like this 24/7" Michelle said. She immediately winced, wondering if she had a mistake; she had no doubt both her mother and Cassie would love to keep her as a little girl. However, Cassie didn't seem interested. "Really? How will you find out his name?" Cassie mocked. "By asking his little sister?"

Michelle initial reaction of agreeing that she hasn't yet gone to a grade school class (something she had no doubts about Cassie wanting to do to her) was tempered by Cassie's mistake of saying his. "What? But you aren't into guys. Unless.... You evil witch! You can't go around doing shit like that!"

"Language, young lady" Cassie said with a wicked grin. "I can always fix that if you wish."

"Try it!" Michelle growled

"Don't tempt me" Cassie said sadistically. "Ballet lessons for a name."

"I'm not playing your games, Cassandra" Michelle said sourly. "You know, you're going to get what's coming to you..."

"Right? From whom" Cassie mocked. She knew about your sisters, but she kept Michelle completely oblivious.
1551122113222221122131221132112133111321.title: Meanwhile with Cassie

1551122113222221122131221132112133111321.content:
Around 6pm, you walked through the front door. Only Hayley was around, which suited you as you had no desire to be around any of Mel's magical idiocies. Hayley seemed to be a little puzzled by your presence.

"Where were you?" Hayley asked.

"Aunt Catherine's house. I wanted to see how our cousin is doing" you replied.

"Brave" Hayley said with a snort. "I won't think she would be too pleased to see you, considering what had happened."

"Better me than you girls" you said with a smile, though you wondered if that would be the case next time you visited. You forced Tiffany -with Catherine's help- into her new swimsuit, forced her into the basement where the new pool was, and splashed into the pool together. Naturally, Tiffany was outraged, and her mood wasn't improved when she saw that she had transformed after five minutes of exposure to the water. Not even your own transformation a minute later helped. Unaware of your memories, Hayley gave a half giggle.

"I suppose you're right, John. Tim would not want to end up like Hannah. Anyway, its safe to go upstairs. Mom has finished with Mel" Hayley said.

"What do you mean?" you wondered aloud.

"Magic lessons, stupid. Mel isn't the most magically stable" Hayley said. "Would have been bad news for you if you hadn't had that resistance. Don't know how you've got it, but you seem to be able to shrug off anything that Mel can throw at you. It doesn't mean much, but even if you didn't have magical resistance, Mel would be disappointed. We both know how vain she is, and lets just say that you would be prettier than her."

You winced; your mermaid transformation told you that your feminine form would be quite busty, and you wondered if that was a reason Cassie was determined to make you into her eye candy. "Mel isn't the only one to try something against me" you said softly.

"What? Has Tim discovered her powers?" Hayley asked, somewhat surprised.

"No. It was that Cassie Bane. She had as much luck as Mel" you said flatly.

"Oh God. You're in so much trouble, bro. I think you know it, but that family isn't too nice..." Hayley said. "I'm glad you're immune else that sort of thing could start a full on war between them and us. How did you get it, anyway? I doubt it's a natural talent."

You tell her...
1551122113222221122131221132112133111321.title: continue

1551122113222221122131221132112133111321.content:
... "Officially, nothing happened, Hayley" you said. While you didn't want to tell her the full truth and potentially expose your secret, as well as Harry's and Tim's, you felt you owed Hayley something. Besides, you hated the fact she had kept her own secret from you, which was only exposed by her meeting 'Ariel'. Instantly, Hayley's face turned to shock. Like any secret language, she knew the hidden meaning of your words.

"Oh my God, John! What have you gotten yourself into?"

"Something so unpleasant that grandma decided to personally respond to" you said.

"Are you okay?" Hayley asked, wanting more information. "You got girlified, didn't you?"

You paused before giving your answer. "Yes."

"How come you're still a guy, when both Ariel and Tiffany are girls?"

"Harry and Tim" you corrected.

"John, trust me, that mindset isn't healthy. Its typical of someone that is under threat of 'her' own transformation, and I have seen it. If you're doomed to be my sister, I promise I'll make you rock" Hayley said.

"No. Not that. I got an experimental treatment which was so painful, even... Tiffany preferred to be female" you said, throwing a bit of truth into things.

"I can see why 'nothing happened'. I won't tell Mel, bro, that you're still under threat. Better she thinks that she can't have her twin sister" Hayley said

"Where is Mel?" you wondered.

"Ariel's house, giving her some tips" Hayley said.
1551122113222221122131221132112133111321.title: Hidden meanings

15511221132222211221313.content:
"If you are not worried by this, you can have the room." Frowning, Harry said. "I'm not sharing a room with something that might try to force its way onto me in the middle of the night."

"Fine." Through gritted teeth, Tim said. "I'll take this room."

"Then it's settled." Flatly, you said. "But first..."

You pushed the lid of the chest closed and pushed it against the wall, under the window, which had a large sill, keeping the chest from opening more than an inch. Tim watched you, curious.

"Why did you do that?" Raising an eyebrow, he asked.

"Call it an early warning system." Calmly, you replied. "The chest will hit the sill before there is enough room for anything to slip out." You gave Tim a rueful grin. "Hopefully that will wake you up and give you some time to run for your manhood."

"Ha. Ha." Humorlessly, Tim said. "You two are being paranoid. Mom told me I had to stay away from magic. Why would we be put somewhere with magical stuff?"

"I'm not taking any chances." Frowning, you said. "Mom and Elvira are not telling me the entire truth when it comes to me, I can feel it." You sighed. "I can only assume the same is for you two as well."

"What are you saying, john?" Unnerved, Harry asked.

"I have a bad feeling about all of this." Serious, you said. "I suggest we sleep lightly tonight."

You then began to carefully search the other two bedrooms. Harry and Tim watch you, uncertain what to think of your behavior.
15511221132222211221313.title: Not taking any chances.
